2364.storyline: Natalie Wood's first movie in three years. It could have been her comeback, but she did not capitalize on its success at all. Shot in the fall of 1968, this would be Wood's last acting job for almost five years, until the summer of 1973, when she worked on a made-for-television film called The Affair (1973). She didn't make another feature until Peeper (1975), a gap of six years. Wood more or less retired after Penelope (1966), when she was just 28.

2365.name: The Thing Called Love
2365.storyline: All cast members performed their own songs.

2366.name: Pushing Tin
2366.storyline: Billy Bob Thornton and John Cusack attended air traffic control schooling in Toronto as part of their role research.

2367.name: The Discovery
2367.storyline: Charlie McDowell directed his then girlfriend Rooney Mara and his mother Mary Steenburgen in this film.

2368.name: An Unfinished Life
2368.storyline: The 1966 Mercury truck used in film was only sold in Canada, the actual shooting location.

2369.name: My Father the Hero
2369.storyline: Gérard Depardieu offered to sing a song on the soundtrack for the credits as he had for My Father the Hero (1991). Instead, the Screenwriters begged him to perform "Thank Heavens for Little Girls" during a talent show. It was later referred to as the funniest scene in this movie.

2370.name: Guess Who
2370.storyline: The director's reason for making the film? "I have a 12-and-a-half-year-old daughter who's beautiful, and I'm sure she's going to come home one day with some Lithuanian, Samoan, punk-rock drummer dude, and I thought if I did this movie I'd be able to work out my issues before that day comes."

2371.name: View from the Top
2371.storyline: The segment where the trainee flight attendants at Royalty Airways are undergoing training by John Witney (Mike Myers) included a lesson on how to deal with terrorists. The scene was cut from the film, and was not included on the DVD release as a deleted scene.

2372.name: A Tale of Two Christmases
2372.storyline: FYI, if you ever get a candy cane, stuck in your hair, don't cut it out like the people in this movie; it comes out with hot water; it's just sugar!

2373.name: Jingle Bell Princess
2373.storyline: In the Barbara Dunlop novel versus the GAC movie adaptation: Sam Cutler has twin daughters in the novel, and the Princess is named Jasmine. In the movie, he has one daughter, and Jasmine is now named Amelia. His mother-in-law is not who the Princess met at the airport, as that was changed to his mother for the movie. Also, you find these things out in the first five minutes of the book and movie.

2374.name: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
2374.storyline: From Reggie Hammond in 48 Hrs. to Chris Carver in Candy Cane Lane, take a look back at the iconic career of Eddie Murphy.

2375.name: Romeo Is Bleeding
2375.storyline: The film's title is taken from a Tom Waits song. In the end credits he receives "special thanks" for its use.

2376.name: Sister Swap: Christmas in the City
2376.storyline: Kimberly Williams-Paisley is Ashley Williams's older sister in real life.

2378.name: Sommersby
2378.storyline: This movie is one of several fictional adaptations of a true, famous legal case of imposture from sixteenth century France. The case involved a man named Martin Guerre who, having disappeared from his Basque village in 1548, suddenly reappeared eight years later. Despite his slightly changed appearance, he convinced his family, wife, and fellow villagers that he was indeed Martin Guerre; he and his wife had two more children and he sued a paternal uncle for the claim to his father's estate. That uncle became suspicious that this returned Martin Guerre was actually an impostor named Arnaud du Tilh, and he contrived a way to have him tried for imposture. This suspicion was ultimately confirmed when the actual Martin Guerre arrived in court during du Tilh's trial. Arnaud du Tilh was convicted and hanged in September 1560.

2379.name: A Christmas in Switzerland
2379.storyline: Aired in the UK as 'a Swiss Family Christmas'

2380.name: Let It Shine
2380.storyline: Coco Jones was 13 years old during production. It was her debut.

2381.name: A Christmas to Treasure
2381.storyline: Taylor Frey and Kyle Dean Massey have been married for 6 years when this movie was made.

2382.name: Miss Lovely
2382.storyline: Miss Lovely (2012) had released around 300 screens in India on 17 January 2014.

2383.name: I Love Trouble
2383.storyline: Julia Roberts and Nick Nolte reportedly did not get along throughout filming. Nolte would go on to say that this was the worst movie he had ever done while Roberts later said that Nolte was the worst actor she had ever worked with.

2384.name: When in Venice
2384.storyline:
Very beautiful movie set in Venice, Italy
Truly amazing scenery and excellent soundtrack. Definitely a must-watch.This movie beautifully captures the charm and romance of Venice, with its stunning canals and timeless architecture setting the perfect backdrop. The story is heartfelt and relatable, following a protagonist's journey that feels both personal and inspiring.It's a feel-good film that transports you to the heart of Venice, making it a must-watch for anyone who loves travel or dreams of exploring the city. Equal parts charming and visually stunning, it's definitely worth your time.

2385.name: I Wanna Hold Your Hand
2385.storyline: Director Robert Zemeckis' feature debut, as well as his first of many collaborations with producer Steven Spielberg. Despite the film's relatively modest budget (approximately $2.8 million), Universal Studios were uneasy with Spielberg's choice in hiring the unproven director. To prevent Zemeckis from being fired, executive Ned Tanen made Spielberg agree that if Zemeckis was doing a markedly poor job, Spielberg would step in and direct the film himself. This way, Universal could hardly lose: they would either have given a new whiz-kid director his first chance, or they would have gained another Spielberg film to release.

2386.name: Hellfighters
2386.storyline: The news truck seen at the first fire carries the markings of KPRC Channel 2, which is a real Houston NBC affiliate. The reporter, Chris Chandler was an actual KPRC reporter as well.

2387.name: Falling Like Snowflakes
2387.storyline: About 25% through the movie, Susanne comes around the wall in the art gallery, and she says to Charlotte, "It's beginning to look a BIT like Christmas!" But watch her mouth, and you'll see her say "LOT" rather than "BIT -- "It's beginning to look at LOT like Christmas!" (the song title). Perhaps this was changed during the film's editing because it might violate a song copyright.

2388.name: Kama Sutra: A Tale of Love
2388.storyline: In order to film in India, the production had to use a fake title "Tara and Maya." Indian authorities would not have permitted the film to be made there had they known its true title and content.

2389.name: Kiss Me Kate
2389.storyline: In supplemental information on the DVD mention is made that Keenan Wynn and James Whitmore neglected to rehearse their "Brush Up Your Shakespeare" number more than once or twice because they thought it was silly. When it came time to shoot it they made numerous fumbles and mistakes which the director thought was on purpose. He later complimented them on making it look like something a couple of thugs would perform. They never told him the truth.

2390.name: Hollywood Dirt
2390.storyline: Based on a book by author Alessandra Torre.

2391.name: Stroker Ace
2391.storyline: Burt Reynolds famously turned down a role in the feature film, Terms of Endearment (1983) for this film, saying it was the biggest regret of his career. He had made a verbal commitment to Hal Needham to do this by the time he was offered the Garrett Breedlove role in that film, but said in hindsight Needham could have waited, since "the world was not clamoring for another Reynolds car chase picture".

2392.name: Wuthering Heights
2392.storyline: Sinéad O'Connor makes an uncredited appearance as Emily Bronte.

2393.name: Everything, Everything
2393.storyline: Olly's life at home was a bigger role in the book than in the movie. The book goes more into depth on Olly's life and his person.

2394.name: Wild Wild Punjab
2394.storyline: I watched the trailer few days ago, it seemed funny & interesting movien to watch so decided to watch the movie on first day only. I wasn't wrong. It kept me seated till the end with lots of laughter & entertainment.Then afterwards, I searched this movie wondering the ratings of the movie and it's 5.7 I mean what wrong with the people. Every minute is so entertaining & storyline is also good. Acting & humor is so awesome.People need to keep their logic aside while watching a funny movie like this.I have never wrote a review about any film but seeing such low rating made write this review.

2396.name: Celeste & Jesse Forever
2396.storyline: Tired with traditional romantic comedies, Rashida Jones wanted to write one about a break-up instead of a meet-cute.

2398.name: The Gold Rush
2398.storyline: Sir Charles Chaplin stated that this was the film by which he most wanted to be remembered.

2399.name: Under the Cherry Moon
2399.storyline: The movie's world premiere was held at the Centennial Twin Theater in Sheridan, Wyoming. The evening included an afterparty and a forty-five-minute private concert by Star and Director Prince at the local Holiday Inn. Local resident Lisa Barber won the right to host the premiere when she was the ten thousandth caller in MTV's "Prince Under the Cherry Moon" contest. Several cast members attended, including Prince, Joni Mitchell, and Ray Parker, Jr.

2400.name: A Joyous Christmas
2400.storyline: Michael Rady played the guitar and sung for this role. He wasn't dubbed.

2401.name: The Nutty Professor
2401.storyline: During filming, Jerry Lewis and actress Stella Stevens started an affair that lasted two years.

2402.name: Beautiful Thing
2402.storyline: As of July 2013, the council estate where filming took place has been demolished as part of the Tavy Bridge regeneration project.

2403.name: Funny Thing About Love
2403.storyline: The video Bryce (actor/comedian Jason Gray) is watching in bed a little over 50 minutes into the movie is the Drybar comedy special KVON (who plays Luke) did in early 2021

2404.name: Soulmate
2404.storyline: South Korea's adaptation of a Chinese film called Soulmate (2016).

2405.name: Enigma
2405.storyline: Mick Jagger owned an original four-rotor Enigma encoding machine which he loaned to the film for historical accuracy in constructing props.

2406.name: Meet Cute
2406.storyline: The character of Gary played by Pete Davidson was written for Johnny Galecki

2407.name: Untamed Heart
2407.storyline: To help her with her Minneapolis accent, Marisa Tomei asked that her driver be a native of the city. The first driver was sacked when she found out that he was from New Jersey, as was the second one when it transpired that he was originally from Texas.

2408.name: A December Bride
2408.storyline: Daniel Lissing plays a character who can't sing very well, but in reality, he has a great singing voice and can play the guitar. He has performed on various talk shows with other co-stars (like Erin Krakow from When Calls the Heart (2014)).

2409.name: Tromeo and Juliet
2409.storyline: James Gunn was paid $150 for the screenplay.

2410.name: Robots
2410.storyline: Emma Roberts was originally cast in the lead role until being replaced by Shailene Woodley.

2411.name: Debbie Macomber's Dashing Through the Snow
2411.storyline: The characters of Dash and his sister Lily are named after writers Dashiell Hammett and Lillian Hellman.

2412.name: Magical Christmas Ornaments
2412.storyline: J.P. Presley: memories build the bridge between our minds and heart, and they should be preserved like treasured keepsakes

2413.name: An Awfully Big Adventure
2413.storyline: Alan Rickman was reportedly upset to find out that Georgina Cates had lied about her age (she was 19 at the time of filming but stated she was only 16) in order to land the role of Stella. He had gone out of his way to be extremely gentle around her during their intimate scenes because of her perceived age.

2414.name: Us x Her
2414.storyline:
Aj Raval is great beauty and angeli khang both are stunning in the FilmIn the movie character are traveling in different set of experience in there life but younger people both can't have enough matured to handle the hard situations in the life.Young couples rich but some situations make worse go for bad decisions.Miscarriage of child caiotic life of bothhusband and wifeDrug usageFemale depression of losing childUnfaithful husband at final
So erotic with threesome scene
The full movie is sexy.Soft core Philippines erotic drama.Bare breast are seems all over the movie no more than that but it makes more hot.

2415.name: Sergeant York
2415.storyline: Alvin C. York himself was on the set for a few days during filming. When one of the crew members tactlessly asked him how many "Jerries" he had killed, York started sobbing so vehemently he threw up. The crew member was nearly fired, but the next day, York demanded that he keep his job.

2416.name: Chalet Girl
2416.storyline: Bill Nighy and Brooke Shields wore their own items on set in order to reduce the film's budget, including the latter's engagement ring.

2418.name: Christmas Comes Home
2418.storyline: The coffee shop in this movie was shot in an actual coffee shop, Weston Coffee Roastery owned by Roger Gascoigne and Laura Landon located in Weston, Missouri.

2419.name: My Beautiful Laundrette
2419.storyline: This film and A Room with a View (1985) both opened in New York on the same day, March 7, 1986. Both movies featured Daniel Day-Lewis in prominent and very different roles: in A Room with a View, he played a repressed, snobbish Edwardian upperclassman, while in Laundrette, he played a lower-class gay ex-skinhead in love with an ambitious Pakistani businessman in Thatcher's London. When American critics saw Day-Lewis, who was then virtually unknown in the US, in two such different roles on the same day, many (including Roger Ebert of The Chicago Sun-Times and Sheila Benson of the LA Times) raved about the talent it must have taken him to play such vastly different characters. In his review of My Beautiful Laundrette, Roger Ebert wrote, "A movie like this lives or dies with its performances, and the actors in 'My Beautiful Laundrette' are a fascinating group of unknowns.... The character of Johnny may cause you to blink if you've just seen the wonderful 'A Room with a View.' He is played by Daniel Day-Lewis, the same actor who, in 'Room,' plays the heroine's affected fiancee, Cecil. Seeing these two performances side by side is an affirmation of the miracle of acting: That one man could play these two opposites is astonishing."

2422.name: Cold Comfort Farm
2422.storyline: Director John Schlesinger had to pay for the blow-up from 16mm to 35mm, because neither the BBC, nor Thames Television, who owned the overseas rights, thought the movie would work in the theater, and therefore would not waste their money on the print. It was the fifth highest-earning British movie released in U.S. theaters that year.

2424.name: Peaceful Warrior
2424.storyline: Director Victor Salva first became familiar with the work while in prison for child molestation. He credits the original story as "a story that changed my life".

2426.name: Bad Guy
2426.storyline: Director Trademark (Kim Ki-duk): Han-ki remains a mute character for much of the film.

2427.name: Pandora's Box
2427.storyline: Despite being replaced by Louise Brooks at the last minute for the role of Lulu in Pandora's Box (1929), Marlene Dietrich managed to snag another coveted role. Her removal from "Pandora's Box" freed her up to play one of her most iconic roles, Lola Lola in Josef von Sternberg's The Blue Angel (1930).

2428.name: Bel Ami
2428.storyline: Christina Ricci was asked in an interview if it was difficult filming the nude scenes in this movie. She said "I trained my brain not to care about nudity at work. It's like going to the beach. You could spend the whole time obsessing, or you could just go to the beach, forget about how you look, and have a good time."

2429.name: City Hunter
2429.storyline: The film is to be shot on the real-life streets of Tokyo's Shinjuku area, where the "City Hunter" saga is set.

2430.name: Broken
2430.storyline: Lead Eloise Laurence sings the song in the beginning and at the end herself.

2431.name: Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus
2431.storyline: MGM optioned the biography, upon which this film is based ("Arbus"), in 1984 as a possible starring vehicle for Diane Keaton.

2432.name: Hondo
2432.storyline: Michael Pate who plays the Indian chief was also in real life an expert in Old West Military procedure. He told later that the Indian attack in the movie was not realistic at all, because Indians were experts in guerrilla warfare and would never have been trapped in an arroyo by the U.S. Army.

2433.name: The Tempest
2433.storyline: The decision to switch the gender of the lead character was a diving board to a whole new appreciation of the play. It had everything to do with Dame Helen Mirren and a coincidental exchange that writer, producer, and director Julie Taymor had with Mirren. When Taymor encountered Mirren at a party, she had already envisioned Mirren in the role and their conversation cemented her decision. "We were talking Shakespeare", Taymor recollects, "and she had no idea I was planning this film when she mentioned that the first Shakespeare she ever did was Caliban in 'The Tempest', and she actually said to me, 'You know, I could play Prospero-as a woman.' And I said, 'Do you want to? Because I've been preparing a film version of 'The Tempest' with exactly that in mind.' And, fortunately, she said 'yes'."

2434.name: Rendez-Vous
2434.storyline: Sometimes the dialogue is in Dutch, sometimes in French, but sometimes in English!

2435.name: A Kiss Before Dying
2435.storyline: The producers had to fight the Production Code office, or what was left of it by this time, to get the word "pregnant" into the film. Even then, the word was deleted in some parts of the country by local censors. The novel was further bowdlerized by having no discussion in the film between Bud and Dorothy about the possibility of her having an abortion, and the pills Bud gives her are said by him to be vitamins and are in fact simply poison to kill her - whereas in the novel they are intended to induce a termination of pregnancy.

2436.name: Must Love Dogs
2436.storyline: According to writer, producer, and director Gary David Goldberg, he gave the script to John Cusack and encouraged him to change any of his character's dialogue to better suit him. Goldberg was surprised by Cusack's response, who later sent him about thirty-five pages of new dialogue for his character.

2437.name: The Last Summer
2437.storyline: We see how well The Last Summer stars K.J. Apa and Maia Mitchell know their romantic movies when they play a round of the IMDb Romantic Movie Quote Quiz.

2438.name: Sunrise in Heaven
2438.storyline: The iconic look Jan gives actor Travis Burns who portrays Steve at the end of the in the 'chow hall' sequence was demonstrated by the real Jan Hurst to actress Caylee Cowan so she could replicate it on screen.

2439.name: Moh
2439.storyline: A brave step taken by team to bring this type of story in Panjab. Hats off to Jagdeep Sidhu, Gitaj Bindrakhia, Sargun Mehta and whole team.This is first movie in which Gitaj acted and it didn't look like that he is performing for the first time.What can i say about Sargun (Sargun is Sargun). A very brave step also taken by her to portray character of Gorey.Jagdeep Sidhu is a class filmmaker and i thank god that we have him in our industry.Songs as well as background score is also top notch and the poem in the climax by Jaani is of another level. I don't think anyone can write romance lyrically better than Jaani.Wishing good luck to Gitaj for a bright future.

2440.name: Secret Admirer
2440.storyline: This film was part of an intense, front-page-of-newspapers controversy in Puerto Rico in early March of 2016 when it was revealed that writer-director Eduardo Ortíz had basically plagiarized it almost in its entirety - word-for-word, scene-for-scene, and shot-for-shot - when he did his film Vasos De Papel (2016), and had tried to make everybody believe that the screenplay had been created and written by himself. The film had only been playing at Puerto Rican cinemas for a few days when the first articles pointing out the similarities between the two films, and pointing out that there was no mention anywhere of it being based on 'Secret Admirer', arose. Once the film was no longer being shown in cinemas across Puerto Rico, Mr. Ortíz first issued a statement saying that there were "certain similarities between one film and the other, not plagiarism. Everything is a matter of interpretation". Only a few hours after making that statement, Mr. Ortíz changed it, saying in a radio interview that he "had done something terribly wrong", and apologizing to his cast and crew. Mr. Ortíz had ignored and/or refused to comment on the issue until actress Natalia Lugo, who played the lead on Vasos De Papel (2016), released a statement on social media where she both condemned the film and expressed the embarrassment she felt when she saw 'Secret Admirer', and came to understand how she and her fellow actors and crew had been duped.

2441.name: The Royal Nanny
2441.storyline: This is Dan Jeannotte's (Colin) second appearance as a Prince in 2022. He also portrayed one in Home for a Royal Heart (2022).

2442.name: Charlie Bartlett
2442.storyline: In the family picture in Principal Gardner's home office, the woman in the photo is Robert Downey Jr.'s wife Susan Downey.

2443.name: On the Town
2443.storyline: A total of five days was spent filming in New York City. The two major problems faced by the crew were the weather (It rained for most of the shoot.) and the popularity of Frank Sinatra. Gene Kelly explained that the movie was filmed at the height of Sinatra-mania, and Frank would be instantly recognized by people on the streets. To avoid crowds, the cast insisted on taxis instead of limousines for transportation and that the camera be hidden inside a station wagon. During the finale of the musical number "New York, New York", which takes place in the sunken plaza at 30 Rockefeller Plaza in front of the statue of Prometheus, the heads of hundreds of curious spectators can be seen at the top of the frame of the last shot, staring at the three stars over the wall behind the statue.

2444.name: Boys
2444.storyline: When Sieger runs into his girlfriend walking her dog, you see Sieger's team logo on the left side of his t-shirt, but in the next shot, the logo has flipped onto the right side of his t-shirt due to it being a reversed image.

2445.name: Summer Lovers
2445.storyline: Valérie Quennessen played a working archaeologist. The production secured an unprecedented permission to film at an actual dig at Akrotiri, on the Mediterranean island of Santorini (Thera), believed by some to be the inspiration for Plato's Atlantis. Instructed by a real archaeologist, Quennessen set to work before the cameras in an area of the site selected for light and production values. Quennessen had hardly started when, much to the joy of everyone, she uncovered several pieces of 3500-year-old pottery. They were turned in and added to the scientific collection.

2446.name: Three Wishes for Cinderella
2446.storyline: Shown on Norwegian, German, Swiss, Czech and Slovak television every Christmas.

2447.name: Gidget
2447.storyline: The title character was based on the author's daughter, Kathy Kohner-Zuckerman, and her adventures growing up in the surf culture at the beach in Malibu during the 1950's. She is still petite, healthy and attractive and lives in Pacific Palisades with her husband. And yes, there was a "Moondoggie", who lives in California and is an artist.

2448.name: The Swedish Torpedo
2448.storyline: A biographical movie meant to depict the heroic story of a woman's efforts swimming across the English Channel unfortunately falls flat.From the opening sequence it becomes clear the filmmakers intention are not to focus on her hardship in achieving this feat but instead her troubled personal life as a single mother. Even though this intention is admirable, the result is a sluggish drama that never is able to engage the viewer.The screenwriting is too weak and underdeveloped, failing to create a strong enough plot that creates any significant forward movement.The good art direction and photography is nowhere near enough to make a great film.It's a real shame that this filmmakers lacks the talent to grasp the importance of strong narrative, believing that lingering moments of glances and mood is sufficient.Hire better screenwriters.

2449.name: A Kindhearted Christmas
2449.storyline: The second made for television holiday-themed movie for Jennie Garth and Cameron Mathison after starring together in Holidaze (2013).

2450.name: A '90s Christmas
2450.storyline: Get your fill of happily-ever-afters with this year's lineup of holiday-themed romantic movies to watch from the comfort of home.

2451.name: A Taste of Christmas
2451.storyline: Although he is half-Greek and half-Italian, Gilles Marini speaks English with a strong French accent because he GREW UP in France. While minimal Italian is spoken (since it is an ENGLISH SPEAKING FILM) Gilles is actually fluent in Italian. Gilles taught himself English upon moving to the US.

2452.name: Silver Skates
2452.storyline: When Alice has her examination she is supported by a senior scientist. It is Dmitri Mendeleev (1834-1907), a famous Russian scientist, who is the founder of the Periodic Table of Elements. In 1869 he presented his discovery to the Russian Chemical Society.

2453.name: Breezy
2453.storyline: Danny Peary in his book "Guide for the Film Fanatic" (1987) states "not many people paid attention to the film upon release" while Richard Schickel in his book "Clint: A Retrospective" (2012) states that this movie in theaters "came and went virtually without notice". In a later interview, Eastwood would blame Universal for not marketing this film correctly, leading it to be a flop at the box office - even with its relatively low budget of only $750,000.

2454.name: Ice Castles
2454.storyline: Lynn-Holly Johnson was cast after she was brought to the attention of the filmmakers by "Ice Capades" executive Michael Kirbay and ice-skating coach John Nicks. Johnson, who was on tour with the Ice Capades show, flew to Minnesota for a script reading and to perform some ice-skating. Johnson then flew back to the show, and then, a week later, flew to Toronto, Canada for a screen-test. Johnson landed the role and signed on not long after this.

2455.name: The Awful Truth
2455.storyline: Irene Dunne later recalled the scene where she pretends to be Cary Grant's ill-bred nightclub performer sister, which was written over a weekend and handed to her on the morning she was scheduled to film it. She was supposed to do a burlesque bump in the middle of her musical number, a move she was never able to do. Leo McCarey told her just to say, "Never could do that" when she got to that moment. She did, it stayed in the film, and Dunne found it "a choice comic bit".

2456.name: War and Peace
2456.storyline: Audrey Hepburn's character was supposed to be thirteen when the movie begins. She was twenty-seven when this movie came out.

2457.name: Homeward Bound II: Lost in San Francisco
2457.storyline: Ralph Waite (voice of Shadow) replaced Don Ameche who died in 1993 after making the first film.

2458.name: Black Angel
2458.storyline: The Italian ministry of the arts and culture deemed the production culturally significant and donated 1.6 million Euros to the film's overall budget.

2459.name: Nightfall
2459.storyline: During the fashion show, Anne Bancroft's character is introduced as wearing a ball gown by Jean Louis who was Columbia Pictures' costume designer. He designed the costumes for this film and many classics, including The Lady from Shanghai (1947) and From Here to Eternity (1953). He also was the costume designer for the 1960s TV sitcom Green Acres (1965).

2460.name: Saving Face
2460.storyline: The scene in the video shop with Joan Chen features a shot of the video for The Last Emperor (1987). Chen starred in that movie.

2461.name: The Four Feathers
2461.storyline: The major fight scene is the Battle of Abu Klea, which took place on January 17, 1885. A British Desert Column of approximately 1,100 troops fought a Mahdist force of over 12,000 dervishes. The scene depicted in the film is a fictional version of the actual battle.

2462.name: Magic in the Moonlight
2462.storyline: Wei Ling Soo, Stanley's on-stage persona, is a reference to Chung Ling Soo, the stage name of William Ellsworth Robinson (1861-1918), a popular magician in the U.S. and Europe for many years. Chung Ling Soo also tried to debunk spiritualists, and even wrote a book about it in 1898. A major difference is how carefully the men protect their Chinese personas. In this movie, people seem to be aware of Stanley's role as Wei Ling Soo. Robinson, very careful to protect his stage persona, lived as Chung, never breaking character while in public. He died on March 24, 1918 when a bullet catch trick went wrong. "My God, I've been shot!" were his last words and the first English words he had spoken on stage in nineteen years.

2463.name: About Last Night
2463.storyline: When Danny (Michael Ealy) and Debbie (Joy Bryant) are sitting in their apartment watching television and eating Chinese food, the film that they are watching is the original About Last Night (1986), starring Rob Lowe and Demi Moore.

2464.name: Tart
2464.storyline: Anna Paquin was originally cast as Cat Storm. She dropped out of the lead role in favor of X-Men.

2465.name: Nights in Rodanthe
2465.storyline: As of 2013, the house has been renamed "The Inn at Rodanthe" and completely refurbished to more closely resemble the interior movie scenes which were filmed elsewhere in North Carolina. Sun Realty manages the property and has extensive photographs of the interior, particularly the blue bedroom in which Richard Gere's character stays while visiting. The unique shutter doors into the kitchen have also been re-created as have the various shutters, porches, and exterior details.

2466.name: Australian Rules
2466.storyline:
Screen adaptation from a novel is not only about leaving things out but also about strengthening links. By
creating a stronger relationship between the Blacky and Dumby's red sister Clarence characters, the film
brought the crux of the source novel's ideas about racism and Blacky's growing awareness of bigotry and
hypocrisy, into a sharper focus.

2467.name: For Whom the Bell Tolls
2467.storyline: The book (and movie's title) is taken from John Donne's "Meditation XVII" from 1624: ..."No man is an island, entire of itself... any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in mankind; and therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls; it tolls for thee."

2468.name: Into the Night
2468.storyline: Jack Nicholson had director John Landis fly out to his home in Colorado and drive through a snowstorm just to tell him he was not interested in the role of Ed Okin.

2469.name: A Season for Miracles
2469.storyline: The DVD version of the movie has scenes and extended scenes that were cut/shortened in recent television airings of the film on the Hallmark Channel.

2470.name: A Dickens of a Holiday!
2470.storyline: Extensive product placement by Ace Hardware.

2471.name: Jack Frost
2471.storyline: Cossacks are members of an ethnic group found in southern Russia and Ukraine. They are known for their horsemanship and fighting skills.

2472.name: Angels of Sex
2472.storyline: Last acting credit, as of 2023, for Ana Cimini.

2473.name: Holiday in Santa Fe
2473.storyline: Gia Lopez, who plays Frankie Ortega, is the real-life daughter of Mario Lopez, who plays her uncle, Tony Ortega.

2474.name: Milk Money
2474.storyline: One extra in this film is 14-year-old Kevin Youkilis, future first-baseman and two-time World Series champion for the Boston Red Sox.

2475.name: Good Dick
2475.storyline: Bryce Dallas Howard and Seth Gabel credited as Kissing Woman and Kissing Man are married in real life.

2476.name: Carmilla
2476.storyline: The poem Lara recites for Carmilla is 'To His Coy Mistress', by Andrew Marvell.

2477.name: Check Inn to Christmas
2477.storyline: The railroad at the very beginning of the movie is the Heber Valley railroad in Heber City, Utah, and the Snowball Toss was filmed on Main St. in Bountiful, Utah.

2478.name: Practical Magic 2
2478.storyline: Akiva Goldsman, one of the writers behind the 1998 original film, will pen the screenplay.

2479.name: Saving Christmas Spirit
2479.storyline: Ghillie can't be male only female reindeer have antlers in winter.

2480.name: Going the Distance
2480.storyline: Justin Long's first scene shot in the film was his nude one when he has sex with Drew Barrymore on a dining room table.

2481.name: Party Girl
2481.storyline: On June 3, 1995, it became the first feature film to be shown in its entirety on the Internet through Glenn Fleishman's Point of Presence Company (POPCO). Parker Posey appeared live in the POPCO offices to introduce the film and welcome Internet viewers.

2482.name: For a Handful of Kisses
2482.storyline: This is a strangely sweet and sad movie about a romantic and vibrant woman with a serious problem trying to maintain normalcy in her life, as she falls in love with a man that is suited to understand her problems or is he). Ana De Armas is charming and beautiful in this. It is no surprise she has gone on to be one of the biggest stars in the world. She has a natural screen presence, even back when this small picture was made. It deals with some serious issues in a good way. It is well shot, but it is clearly a low budget film. This is not so believable, but it is sweet in sports and upsetting in others. The film is Spanish with English subtitles.

2483.name: Who's That Girl
2483.storyline: This movie was originally titled "Slammer" until Madonna wrote "Who's That Girl" and decided to use it as the theme song. The song went to #1 on the Billboard chart in August 1987.

2484.name: Soldier of Orange
2484.storyline: The explosions in this movie were provided not by special effects technicians, but by the Dutch Marines. In his DVD commentary on this movie, director Paul Verhoeven states that the explosive charges were held in place with metal. When one of the charges was set off, it blew the metal to bits. One of the flying fragments nearly killed Rutger Hauer.

2485.name: Last Year at Marienbad
2485.storyline: The match game in the movie is named as "Nim". In order to win the game there is only one tactic including a system called "Nim Sum". If both players use this tactic perfectly, then the owner of the first move will eventually lose. Due to the same reason, it is always disadvantageous to start the game first.

2486.name: How to Marry a Millionaire
2486.storyline: Lauren Bacall's character, Schatze, says, "I've always liked older men . . . Look at that old fellow, what's-his-name, in The African Queen (1951); absolutely crazy about him." She is referring to her then real-life husband, Humphrey Bogart.

2487.name: Look Who's Talking Now
2487.storyline: Tabitha Lupien did her own basketball moves.

2488.name: To Rome with Love
2488.storyline: The term 'Ozymandias Melancholia', which is mentioned three times throughout the film, was invented by Woody Allen for his movie Stardust Memories (1980).

2489.name: To All the Boys: P.S. I Still Love You
2489.storyline: Lana Condor hopes to bring some of her "Deadly Class" character's toughness to Lara Jean in the upcoming To All the Boys I've Loved Before sequel.

2490.name: Private Tutor
2490.storyline: Alessandra Cruz & Arnold Reyes were original cast for this movie. Alessandra even appeared in advanced posters. But they were replaced by Zsara Laxamana & Mark Dionisio.

2491.name: Hiding Out
2491.storyline: Aunt Lucy is actually Jon Cryer's mother Gretchen.

2492.name: American Ninja
2492.storyline: In an interview with German media in 2012, Michael Dudikoff revealed that he sweated so much during the later fight scenes because he had malaria.

2494.name: Mammal
2494.storyline: At the time of filming the sex scene, Rachel Griffiths was 47 and Barry Keoghan was 23, with her being 24 years older than him.

2495.name: Sands of Iwo Jima
2495.storyline: While John Wayne was honored to be nominated for an Academy Award for this film, he believed the nomination should have been for She Wore a Yellow Ribbon (1949).

2496.name: On the 12th Date of Christmas
2496.storyline: As mentioned in this film, Chicago was the first to start turtle racing. But not in the Chinatown area. Actually at Riverview Amusement Park.

2497.name: A Christmas Duet
2497.storyline: Wouldn't Be ChristmasWritten by Mark Grilliot and Alec Puro

2498.name: A Christmas Proposal
2498.storyline: Though it takes place over Christmas in Washington State, all the trees/foliage are fully green.

2499.name: Santa's Squad
2499.storyline: The snowmen all look fake. You can see the cotton fibers on them and they move when touched.

2500.name: Calamity Jane
2500.storyline: Doris Day recorded the song "Secret Love" in only one take.

2501.name: Desert Hearts
2501.storyline: The $350,000 budget for the film was raised independently with limited partnerships.

2502.name: Anything Else
2502.storyline: This is loosely based on Woody Allen's experiences as a young comedy writer who married young, and met an older man who taught him about life, comedy, and philosophy (and who was institutionalized).

2504.name: Upside Down
2504.storyline: The scene where Adam first puts on the weights and flips upside down is actually shot in a room that is suspended in a giant wheel. The room, and everything inside it, moves 360 degrees. The camera moves with the room, so motion is not detectable, other than Adam flipping upside down.

2505.name: Lone Wolf McQuade
2505.storyline: When asked to comment on David Carradine's actual martial arts skills, Chuck Norris opined, "David Carradine is every bit as good a martial artist as I am an actor."

2506.name: The Goodbye Girl
2506.storyline: Richard Dreyfuss won the Oscar for Best Actor in a Leading Role for his role as Elliot Garfield. At 30, he was the youngest actor to win this Oscar. This record was broken by Adrien Brody when he won the Best Actor Oscar in 2003 for his lead role in The Pianist (2002) at age 29.

2507.name: Words on Bathroom Walls
2507.storyline: Molly Parker and Taylor Russell play mother and daughter on Lost in Space (2018).

2508.name: Mummies
2508.storyline: The gateway used to summon the Phoenix is based on design and activation special effect of the gateway in Stargate (1994).

2509.name: The Man with the Answers
2509.storyline: Dead BoysPerformed by by Sam FenderMusic and Lyrics by Sam FenderPolydor Records

2510.name: Gun Crazy
2510.storyline: The bank heist sequence was done entirely in one take, with no one outside the principal actors and people inside the bank aware that a movie was being filmed. When John Dall as Bart Tare says, "I hope we find a parking space," he really meant it, as there was no guarantee that there would be one. In addition, at the end of the sequence someone in the background screams that there's been a bank robbery - this was actually a bystander who saw the filming and assumed the worst.

2511.name: The Rewrite
2511.storyline: The scene in which Hugh Grant's character watches himself in a video clip on the Internet is the video of the actual acceptance speech given by Hugh Grant in 1995 when he won the Golden Globe as the Best Actor in a Comedy/Musical for Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994). They dubbed the speech to reflect the fictional movie screenplay at the center of The Rewrite.

2512.name: Roll Bounce
2512.storyline: Ten percent of the movie's opening weekend gross was donated to the victims of Hurricane Katrina.

2515.name: Ask the Dust
2515.storyline: Writer/director Robert Towne finished the script in the early 1990s but couldn't find financial backing. Even with Johnny Depp interested in the project, the script bounced around from studio to studio.

2516.name: Pillow Talk
2516.storyline: Ross Hunter wrote that after he made this film, no theatre managers wanted to book it. Popular movie themes at the time were war films, westerns, and spectacles. Hunter was told by the big movie chains that sophisticated comedies like this movie went out with William Powell. They also believed that Doris Day and Rock Hudson were things of the past and had been overtaken by newer stars. Hunter persuaded Sol Schwartz, who owned the Palace Theatre in New York, to book the film for a two-week run, and it was a smash hit. The public had been starved for romantic comedy, and theatre owners who had previously turned down Hunter now had to deal with him on HIS terms.

2517.name: Ladies in Black
2517.storyline: The department store scenes were shot on the 7th floor of the David Jones building in the Sydney CBD. The 7th floor had remained disused for many years and still looked just as it did in 1959. The film crew only had one day to film these scenes as the next day renovations were due to begin on the building and the 7th floor would be inaccessible.

2518.name: HouseSitter
2518.storyline: The house was built as a standing set in Concord, Massachusetts. It was torn down soon after filming ended.

2519.name: She's the One
2519.storyline: Entire soundtrack composed of original songs by Tom Petty.

2520.name: Beverly Hills Chihuahua
2520.storyline: According to George Lopez, Papi, the chihuahua he voices in the movie, was one day away from being put down before he was rescued for the movie.

2521.name: A European Christmas
2521.storyline: The tropes & clichés of the Christmas Rom/Com/Drama are blown to smithereens with this intriguing yarn set in snowladen Serbia. Aware of Caprice's previous career as a lingerie model I began watching this TV flick with low expectations...Those expectations were confounded entirely as she turns in a very good performance in the leading role, playing Ivy Allen, a once-successful film director who is in the last chance saloon with the film production company who employ her - her sole remit, after another turkey, is to make another hit film.Believing the actor in her previous hit movie was the magic ingredient in that film's success, Ivy ditches her cheerless festive-free NYC Christmas holiday and flies to out to Serbia to track him down - hoping to persuade him to star in her next film project, as if her future depends on him entirely. Unaware of the Julian calendar used in Serbia she finds out the locals are about to celebrate their Christmas on 7th January (?). With little effort she manages to track him down, with his two sons, but he's dismissive, and wants to forget his previous life as an actor.The story is the right side of sweet, the dialogue is natural and never clunky and the viewer gets a unique chance to see a very different Christmas location and celebration - Serbian stylee.I'm not sure if it's wholely heartwarming or if the two leading characters have real feelings for each other (they seem more like good friends cautiously navigating romance than traditional lovers) BUT I enjoyed watching this film and don't mind watching it one more time.Overall it's a charming story with good performances from the leads and is delivered with - a rarely seen on TV screens - a ladle of Serbian Christmas Charm.

2522.name: Christmas in Mississippi
2522.storyline: The beach seen in the movie is the largest man made beach in the world.

2523.name: A Night in Heaven
2523.storyline: This film has a huge gay following - because of the male audiences, because of Christopher Atkins' seductive striptease, and because Atkins (who forgot to wear underwear in the hotel scene with Lesley Ann Warren) wound up being naked in one scene. However, most of the critics as well as the audiences were hostile to this film.

2524.name: Hemingway & Gellhorn
2524.storyline: Lars Ulrich, who appeared in this movie, is in the band Metallica. One of Metallica's songs, "For Whom The Bell Tolls", is based on the Ernest Hemingway novel of the same name.

2525.name: Un Amor
2525.storyline: Laia Costa's second collaboration with Isabel Coixet, following Foodie Love (2019).

2526.name: The Pirates of Penzance
2526.storyline: Although the chorus consisted of British performers, they are all lip-synching to the American singers from the original Broadway production.

2527.name: Miranda
2527.storyline: Director Tinto Brass asked the aspirants for the role of Miranda to strip completely naked in front of him during the audition. "I had to try a film scene, with the camera filming every part of my body," recalled Serena Grandi who was the chosen one.

2528.name: Beyond the Lights
2528.storyline: Gugu Mbatha-Raw sang all of her own songs for this movie.

2529.name: Watching the Detectives
2529.storyline: In order to keep as authentic of an American accent as possible, Cillian Murphy didn't use his true Irish accent on set until the film finished shooting.

2531.name: Another Country
2531.storyline: Loosely based on the early life of Guy Burgess, a key figure in the Cambridge Five spy ring of the 1930s and 1940s, who eventually defected to Russia in 1951. Even the manner of "Guy Bennett"'s father's death, as he discloses it to Harcourt, is the same as Burgess's father. Even so, the closing credits make the standard declaration, "The events, characters and firms depicted in this photoplay are fictitious. Any similarity to actual persons, living or dead, or to actual firms is purely coincidental."

2532.name: Wuthering Heights
2532.storyline: Laurence Olivier found himself becoming increasingly annoyed with director William Wyler's exhausting style of filmmaking. After yet another take, he is said to have exclaimed, "For God's sake, I did it sitting down. I did it with a smile. I did it with a smirk. I did it scratching my ear. I did it with my back to the camera. How do you want me to do it?" Wyler's retort was, "I want it better." However, Olivier later said these multiple takes helped him learn to succeed as a movie actor.

2533.name: Rio Grande
2533.storyline: According to Maureen O'Hara in her autobiography, "Tis Herself", some stunt men died during the shooting of the film when they fell from their horses during a scene in the middle of a muddy river. Their bodies were allegedly never recovered.

2534.name: Happiness Is
2534.storyline: I watched this movie with high expectations, eager to see where the story would take me. Unfortunately, it lacked clear direction, leaving me underwhelmed. Despite a talented cast, known for their impressive past work, the movie failed to deliver.The actors and actresses showcased their skills, but even their collective effort couldn't compensate for the narrative's shortcomings. The movie's potential was squandered due to its meandering plot and lack of focus.Overall, I wouldn't recommend this film. With a tighter script and clearer vision, it could have been something special. As it stands, it's a missed opportunity.

2535.name: 3 Bed, 2 Bath, 1 Ghost
2535.storyline: Lead actors Julie Gonzalo and Chris McNally are married in real life, having met and started dating while filming The Sweetest Heart (2018), also for The Hallmark Channel, and welcomed their first child in June 2022.

2536.name: Innocent Blood
2536.storyline: Although this entire movie is about vampires, the word "vampire" itself is never actually used.

2537.name: The Blonde One
2537.storyline: Second collaboration between director Marco Berger and Gaston Re, after Taekwondo (2016).

2538.name: Chasers
2538.storyline:
The final film Dennis Hopper directed and
his only comedy as director.

2539.name: Merry & Bright
2539.storyline: The pictures of young Cate are real photos of Jodie Sweetin as a child.

2540.name: Rugrats in Paris
2540.storyline: Dionne Quan is legally blind. She has never seen what her character, Kimi, looks like.

2541.name: Circle of Friends
2541.storyline: Minnie Driver gained 30 pounds for the role of Benny.

2542.name: Joy for Christmas
2542.storyline: When Jack and Bob are horribly lip syncing on the sidewalk, Bob's red gloves appear and disappear from shot to shot.

2543.name: Hope Springs
2543.storyline: Jeff Bridges turned down the role of Arnold.

2544.name: Christmas Around the Corner
2544.storyline: In real life, Glastenbury, Vermont is a ghost town in the southwestern part of the state, near Manchester. It was chartered in 1761 as part of New Hampshire, and had a population of 34 when Vermont became a state in 1791. The population began growing after the Civil War, topping out at 280. The biggest industry was lumber. The trees had disappeared by the late 1880s, and the population soon followed. Glastenbury was officially unincorporated in 1937. The 2010 census counted a population of 8.

2545.name: Mo' Better Blues
2545.storyline: Denzel Washington and Wesley Snipes were trained to mimic the playing of the instruments they play in the film (trumpet and saxophone), by musicians Terence Blanchard and Donald Harrison. Washington later admitted that he was lucky if he could play three notes of a simple tune prior to filming, and ended up being able to correctly mimic most of the songs performed in the film, as did Snipes.

2546.name: The Secret of Moonacre
2546.storyline: Four dogs played the character of Wrolf. They all had their fur dyed so they looked identical, and each dog had its own talents. One was particularly good at barking, another at licking, one at running, and one was good at just lying around.

2547.name: Here on Earth
2547.storyline: Melissa Joan Hart was considered for the role of Samantha.

2548.name: Easy Virtue
2548.storyline: In the vintage Monte Carlo scene which opens the movie, when Larita first sees John, both her and John's movements are slowed down while the rest of the cast play at "normal" (i.e. newsreel) speed. This was accomplished by filming the crowd, Larita, John, the background, and the foreground mechanics separately against greenscreen and compositing them together at different speeds.

2549.name: The Lady Eve
2549.storyline: It was hibernation season during the shoot, and Emma the king snake was always sleeping while also shedding her skin. Needless to say, she was very uncooperative.

2550.name: Stomp the Yard
2550.storyline: In the step tournament there was 2000 extras used as the crowd, but they didn't know that this was a movie so they were really cheering and booing the steppers

2551.name: Mona Lisa
2551.storyline: Mortwell's strip club is actually the famous Raymond RevueBar in London's Soho district. The giant prop hand Mortwell sits in was a famous element of the show, visible in a lot of promotional material for the club. At one point George walks past a poster for the Festival of Erotica, a real show at the RevueBar at the time.

2552.name: The Twilight Samurai
2552.storyline: Official submission of Japan for the 'Best Foreign Language Film' category of the 76th Academy Awards in 2004.

2553.name: Shiver
2553.storyline: Eliza Bennett was a popular fan choice for the role of Grace

2554.name: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty
2554.storyline: Author James Thurber offered producer Samuel Goldwyn $10,000 to not make the film.

2556.name: Blithe Spirit
2556.storyline: There have been many filmed adaptations of Noël Coward's play, including Blithe Spirit (1956) in which writer Noël Coward himself plays the lead role alongside Claudette Colbert and Lauren Bacall, but the most popular version is Blithe Spirit (1945) starring Rex Harrison, Constance Cummings, Margaret Rutherford and Kay Hammond and directed by David Lean.

2557.name: Great Expectations
2557.storyline: Helena Bonham Carter stated in an interview that she wore only one shoe for the filming of Great Expectations, as in the book, Dickens described Miss Havisham as wearing only one shoe.

2558.name: The Christmas Doctor
2558.storyline: Campbell Soup sponsored this movie. Watch for product placement.

2559.name: Blown Away
2559.storyline: The Talisman Ski Resort, located in Kimberly, Ontario, Canada, where Rich and Wes worked and was seen throughout the film, was opened in 1963 and closed in 2011 due to bankruptcy. Despite being purchased and resold a couple times since then, it has been abandoned since its closure and has slowly been taken over by the elements.

2560.name: A Hazard of Hearts
2560.storyline: Features two Bond Girls, Dame Diana Rigg and Fiona Fullerton, as well as Edward Fox, who played "M" in the unofficial James Bond movie, Never Say Never Again (1983).

2561.name: Albert Nobbs
2561.storyline: Glenn Close not only stars as the lead character Albert, but she also co-wrote the screenplay, wrote the original song for the film and produced.

2562.name: The Object of My Affection
2562.storyline: Sarah Jessica Parker and Robert Downey, Jr. were initially cast to star as Nina Borowski and George Hanson.

2563.name: Falling in Love
2563.storyline: Robert De Niro emphasized authenticity and attention to detail on the film. De Niro did this by having business cards made up for his character, even though they are never seen in the movie. Also, for the telephone conversation with his wife, De Niro got writer Michael Cristofer to write dialogue for his spouse's part, even though it was not in the script, nor going to be heard by audiences.

2564.name: Meet Me Under the Mistletoe
2564.storyline: Sarah and Simon do a fantastic job sharing a story of how two rivals with personal internal struggles come together at work to accomplish a huge project. The push-pull of the relationship gets your heart pumping at key moments. Love the concept of a niece living with a relative for education purposes, including that the niece is not a boneheadded teenager but a balanced teen that can enjoy the education pursuit and still enjoy the romance of her aunt. Extremely purehearted movie with a few Christmas capers tied in. Despite other reviews, I think the chemstry is fantastic and Sarah Fisher's natural beauty is a huge draw. Robin Dunne is one of my favs as he has done awesome work and this one is no exception. All the supporting cast is FABULOUS! NIce to see Paul and Jan together again this year as a power couple! Enjoy!!

2565.name: Game of Love
2565.storyline: Benjamin is the most wooden, robotic person to grace a screen since the terminator. The dialogue could have been written by a 2nd grader. There is a pathetic, unbelievable story that just ends with the couple hooking up- no real resolution of the "problem". Bella hasn't improved her acting skills from Disney sitcom level. There are long pauses trying to look artistic with shots of some pretty scenery, but it's so contrived, you can't enjoy it at all. If you want to see some skin, there's a bit of that, but it's just thrown in again with no real point to the story. My recommendation- save your time and skip this painful drivel.

2566.name: The Oranges
2566.storyline: Leighton Meester (Nina) and Adam Brody (Toby) are married in real life.

2567.name: Let's Go to the Rose Motel 4

2568.name: New York Minute
2568.storyline: Last film to feature Mary Kate and Ashley Olsen together.

2569.name: Ehrengard: The Art of Seduction
2569.storyline: Queen Margrethe II of Denmark was the Costume Designer for the film.

2570.name: By the Sea
2570.storyline: Director and writer Angelina Jolie about the period setting: "I chose to set By the Sea (2015) in the 1970s, not only because it is a colorful and alluring era, but because it removes many of the distractions of contemporary life and allows the focus to remain squarely on the emotions that the characters experience in their journey."

2571.name: Spontaneous
2571.storyline: When Mara plays a song on the diner jukebox she enters C 4. (A common variety of the plastic explosive)

2572.name: I Am a Sex Addict
2572.storyline: Once notable in the mid to late '90s French adult film starlet Rebecca Lord was cast off the street when she was spotted by writer/director Caveh Zahedi. He breaks the fourth wall of film making to tell us the audience then until he further researched her stage name online that he personally had NO idea that she was a notable name in the adult film industry. Merely a very gorgeous woman. He also spotted her because of her Escorting dates that were listed on a website coincided with the re-shoot dates he was then planning to take place in San Francisco that she listed on a site. The film's subject was, oddly enough, about Mr. Zahedi's life-long personally addictions to Prostitutes (Escorts).

2573.name: The Brothers Bloom
2573.storyline: The card trick performed by Rachel Weisz took her a month to learn, practicing every day. The shot itself took eleven takes.

2574.name: White Mischief
2574.storyline: The producers wanted to fire Trevor Howard from this movie, due to his alcoholism, but Sarah Miles insisted he should stay.

2575.name: Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara
2575.storyline: Imran played by Farhan Akhtar is seen having a fear of skydiving in the movie but in real life he's a certified skydiver and Arjun played by Hrithik Roshan is a certified scuba diver but his character is afraid of water.

2576.name: A Walk on the Moon
2576.storyline: Diane Lane wanted Viggo Mortensen to be in the film so much that she gave up part of her salary so that the production could afford him.

2577.name: Dorm Daze
2577.storyline: The only actors to appear in all three films of the Dorm Daze trilogy are: James DeBello (Cliff), Tony Denman (Newmar), Jennifer Lyons (Lynne), Patrick Cavanaugh (Pete), Paul Kim Jr. (Wang), Pat Casey (Mike) and Josh Miller (Brady).

2578.name: Christmas by Design
2578.storyline: The book title for this movie was Jingle Jammies.

2579.name: Música
2579.storyline: Synesthesia is a perceptual phenomenon in which stimulation of one sensory or cognitive pathway leads to involuntary experiences in a second sensory or cognitive pathway.

2580.name: It Was Always You
2580.storyline: The opening scene includes Erin Kraków's (Elizabeth) character cleaning the teeth of Ben Rosenbaum (Mr. Henry). Rosenbaum is a longtime regular of the Hallmark series 'When Calls the Heart', which Krakow stars in.

2581.name: Someday We'll Tell Each Other Everything
2581.storyline: A dirty and old(ish), somewhat unattractive brute starts advancing on the local 17 year old beauty. Unfortunately for everybody, he gives off a major rapey vibe. Their first meeting is literally him groping her without consent.Since her boyfriend is very goofy, she eventually gives in to the brute and allows him to take her very roughly and a borderline sexually abusive affair ensues.It's a German movie, so this counts as a romantic comedy.The lack of diversity is fine. This is set in early 90's East Germany and people of colour and the disabled obviously hadn't been invented yet.The cinematographer needs a big raise though.

2582.name: I'm Your Man
2582.storyline: Official submission of Germany for the 'Best International Feature Film' category of the 94th Academy Awards in 2022.

2583.name: You May Not Kiss the Bride
2583.storyline: The "Lover's Bay Resort" featured in the film is not an actual resort or hotel nor is it located in Nuku Hiva. It is actually a house located in O'ahu Hawaii at 1426 Mokulua Dr, Kailua, HI 96734, USA. It is also not secluded which is why they keep the surrounding area out of frame when driving into it in the movie. Unfortunately you can't go vacation there even if you wanted to.

2584.name: Autumn at Apple Hill
2584.storyline: Marks Erin Cahill and Wes Brown's fourth film as co-stars after Storm War (2011), Nanny Seduction (2017) and Every Time a Bell Rings (2021).

2585.name: Notes of Autumn
2585.storyline: Pascale Hutton and Kavan Smith, who portray the lover characters in Leo's novel come to life (at least in Leo's mind), have previously portrayed romantic partners in several other projects for The Hallmark Channel, such as When Calls the Heart (2014), The Perfect Bride (2017), The Perfect Bride: Wedding Bells (2019) and You Had Me at Aloha (2021), the latter three having all been written by Rick Garman, who also wrote this film.

2586.name: Read My Lips
2586.storyline: When the man calls for Paul Angeli and then hangs up, Carla peers into the copy room and then hangs up the phone. As she is sitting at her desk, the reflection of a moving crane or boom mic extension is visible in the glass behind her.

2587.name: Cinderella
2587.storyline: The white dress that Cinderella wears to the ball was so heavy that after 12 hours of shooting, Lesley Ann Warren was unable to move her shoulders and had to be injected with a muscle relaxant.

2588.name: Christmas in Evergreen: Tidings of Joy
2588.storyline: The character of Nick was introduced in Christmas in Evergreen (2017) as the mysterious man not from Evergreen hired to play Santa Claus. Now he is portrayed as having deep fifty year plus ties to the town.

2589.name: A Christmas in Tennessee
2589.storyline: The fourth of six TV movies directed by Gary Yates and starring Andrew W. Walker from 2012 to 2020.

2590.name: Five More Minutes
2590.storyline: Inspired by Scotty McCreery's song " Five More Minutes" which is played in the movie.

2591.name: The Unforgiven
2591.storyline: Before filming began, director John Huston and star Burt Lancaster took actress Lillian Gish out to the desert to teach her how to shoot, which she would have to do in the film. However, Huston was astounded to discover that Gish could shoot more accurately, and faster, than both he and Lancaster, who thought themselves expert marksmen. It turned out that early in her career Gish was taught how to shoot by notorious western outlaw and gunfighter Al J. Jennings, who had become an actor after his release from a long prison sentence for train robbery and was in the cast of one of her films. She found that she liked shooting and over the years had developed into an expert shot.

2592.name: A Hologram for the King
2592.storyline: Filmed mostly in Morocco. Only some exterior shots were taken in Riyadh.

2593.name: Be With You
2593.storyline: Remake of Ima, ai ni yukimasu (2004)

2594.name: Anaïs in Love
2594.storyline: Director Charline Bourgeois-Tacquet had already shot a short with actress Anaïs Demoustier, called Pauline asservie (2018), and wrote this movie with her in mind.

2595.name: To All the Boys: Always and Forever
2595.storyline: Though they were released a year apart, was filmed back-to-back with the previous film in the series, To All the Boys: P.S. I Still Love You (2020).

2596.name: Toscana
2596.storyline: The first Danish movie to release on Netflix World Wide. The movie was shot in only 19 days.

2597.name: Just Wright
2597.storyline: In the original shoot Kanye West and Amber Rose shot a courtside scene at one of the games. Before the movie was released Kanye had his Taylor Swift moment at the Grammy's which could be why his scene was cut.

2598.name: Christmas at the Ranch
2598.storyline: I've Got Your BackWritten by Dominique Provost-Chalkley (as Dom P-C)Performed by Dominique Provost-Chalkley (as Dom P-C), Emy Taliana, Desirée Dawson, and Natasha GrayArrangement by Russell BroomMixing and Mastering by Russell Broom

2599.name: Biosphere
2599.storyline: In a 2023 interview with The AU Review, Mel Eslyn spoke about the initial idea for the film: "Mark Duplass pitches me ideas that are always half a sentence and someone has to finish it. But they are always the best first half of a sentence you've heard. He had pitched me an idea along the lines of, 'What if there are the two last men on Earth and they're living in a biosphere and they're obsessed with Mario Brothers?' So we kind of started there, and I thought, 'Well, if the last two people on Earth are men then there's some stuff to dig into.'"

2600.name: Spotlight on Christmas
2600.storyline: Very similar storyline to A Christmas Break (2020), also released by Lifetime, but with a gender reversal of the lead characters.

2601.name: The Neighbor
2601.storyline: The only reason I gave this a 3 star is because of the acting, the story itself is a 1 star or less because its bland and builds very slowly. His wife starts problems for no reason but the neighbor girl script is pretty decent because people in abusive relationships are usually finding excuses to be with them or thinking they'll change. So take my word and ignore this title even if you're a fan of the actors. They all do a great job but it's ruined by the story.

2602.name: Kabir Singh
2602.storyline: Shahid Kapoor lost 14 kg of weight to do Kabir Singh.

2603.name: Previously Saved Version
2603.storyline: A unique way to present the enduring theme of human relationships, ideals vs reality, control and more but we won't go further here and add spoilers,Impressively good acting and entertaining with such.a small cast. The writing, acting and visuals are all done well. Like her memories, the audience gets backfilled on a little more history one step at a time until we see the full picture.If you're looking for action sci-fi or a big psychological thriller, then you'll likely be restless... but if you like a sci-fi backdrop with a Focus on struggling to get your perfect relationship back with a little action to boot, then I think you'll really enjoy it. I'll say it's better than 80% of the movies out there this the rating and my first review. Hope this helps you decide if you should watch.

2604.name: The Wood
2604.storyline: In a recent visit to USC, his alma mater, Rick Famuyiwa revealed that Paramount executives wanted the character of Mike to pinch Alicia's buttocks in the end scene for added laughs. Needless to say, Famuyiwa balked at this idea, and never shot the requested scene.

2605.name: Mad Dog and Glory
2605.storyline: Robert De Niro initially was offered the role of gangster Frank Milo, but he insisted on playing the timid Wayne instead. The mobster part went to Bill Murray.

2606.name: Malang
2606.storyline: Director Mohit Suri first offered Disha Patani's role to Kriti Sanon but the latter could not commit to the film due to date issues.

2607.name: Blow Dry
2607.storyline: Rachael Leigh Cook turned down the role of Rogue in X-Men (2000) to make this film. She had no interest in working with CGI.

2608.name: Very Good Girls
2608.storyline: Elizabeth Olsen and Boyd Holbrook dated after meeting on the set. They even got engaged, but it was called off when they split up.

2609.name: Trading Christmas
2609.storyline: The bus terminal shown in the movie is actually the building for the Abbotsford Flying Club.

2610.name: Dogs Don't Wear Pants
2610.storyline: J.-P. Valkeapää: Other customer of dominatrix Mona.

2611.name: Elegy
2611.storyline: David (Sir Ben Kingsley) tells Consuela that she looks like Goya's Maja Desnuda. Penélope Cruz (Consuela) plays Pepita Tudó in Volaverunt (1999), possibly a model for the Maja Desnuda.

2612.name: Arthur
2612.storyline: While sulking in his Batmobile after Hobson (Dame Helen Mirren) gives him an aspirin and vitamin, Arthur (Russell Brand) scrolls through his phone to look for Naomi's number and we briefly see Katy Perry, Brand's then-wife, listed as a contact.

2613.name: Drinking Buddies
2613.storyline: This film was entirely improvised. There was no script, and the only things the actors and the crew had was a vague outline of the plot and the order in which certain events would take place.

2614.name: Phir Aayi Hasseen Dillruba
2614.storyline: Film releases after 3 years of the original.

2615.name: The Sapphires
2615.storyline: There really was an Australian girl group in the 1960s called The Sapphires, but they had only three members, not four. When they were invited to tour for the troops in Vietnam, two of the group declined due to their anti-war stance, so the remaining Sapphire drafted her sister to help her out.

2616.name: Miss Christmas
2616.storyline: When Sam takes Holly to see the tree for the first time. She is taking pictures of the tree, she walks away from the tree to take pictures and the snow ripples and she doesn't leave footprints.

2618.name: Happy Endings
2618.storyline: Maggie Gyllenhaal does her own singing in the movie.

2619.name: The Cooler
2619.storyline: According to the director's commentary, William H. Macy was given three suits to wear during the film. During scenes where his character Bernie was hapless and unlucky, he wore a suit that was two sizes too big for him. During scenes where his luck was starting to turn around, he wore a suit that was one size too big for him. After he falls in love and is extremely lucky, he wears a perfectly tailored suit. Also, as Bernie's luck improves, the lighting surrounding him gets brighter, and his shirt and tie go from dark and subdued to bright and colorful.

2620.name: Titanic
2620.storyline: During the boarding of the lifeboats, Norman changes seats with a woman who arrives at the last moment when the boat was completely full. This was inspired by the action of a Mexican passenger in first class named Manuel Uruchurtu, who did the same thing to a woman from second class who was refused a seat on the lifeboat. After he gave up his seat to her, he asked her to travel to Mexico, if she survived, and tell his wife what happened. His body was never found.

2621.name: Change of Habit
2621.storyline: Director William A. Graham said in an interview years after the making of this film that Elvis Presley was the nicest man he had ever met.

2622.name: Clement
2622.storyline: Emmanuelle Bercot revealed in 2007 that the trigger to make this film came from a real-life relationship she had recently started with a young actor. "At first, I thought I'd never find a kid to play it. It was when I saw that he was enthusiastic that I threw myself into writing the story. The plan was for him to be the boy in my film, and I thought that if I played the woman, something of our relationship might come across on screen. But as filming was postponed, the boy became too big, so I looked for another child," she said.

2623.name: The Perfect Man
2623.storyline: The movie was based on Heather Robinson's life as a teenager in Tucson, AZ.

2624.name: The French Lieutenant's Woman
2624.storyline: The source novel does not feature the subplot of the actors and actresses playing the parts in a modern day movie. However, it had three alternate endings, from which readers could choose their favorite. Creating two parallel story lines allowed the filmmakers to include two of those endings, one happy and one tragic.

2625.name: A Life Less Ordinary
2625.storyline: Though most of his scene was cut from the movie, Timothy Olyphant (Hiker) later said he was hugely inspired by watching Holly Hunter work and the creative choices she made. He said his experience on his first few roles up to that point had been relatively uninspiring, but seeing how focused Hunter was made him want to keep working. A Life Less Ordinary is, in fact, only Olyphant's second feature film role, the first having been in The First Wives Club (1996).

2626.name: Time Is Up
2626.storyline: Bella Thorne and Benjamin Mascolo became a couple and later engaged after filming but split in 2022.

2627.name: The Royal Treatment
2627.storyline: Likely due to filming in New Zealand, this has several actors who were also in Power Rangers. James Gaylyn played Colonel Mason Truman in Power Rangers R.P.M. (2009) and Shelby's dad in Power Rangers Dino Charge (2015) and voiced General Peluso in Power Rangers Megaforce (2013) in addition to other roles; Jay Simon voiced Gorrox and Versix in Power Rangers Ninja Steel (2017), Hunter in Power Rangers Dino Charge (2015), and Bluefur in Power Rangers Megaforce (2013); Cameron Rhodes voiced Burnertron in Power Rangers Beast Morphers (2019), Headridge in Power Rangers Megaforce (2013), and Professor Cog in Power Rangers Samurai (2011); Jacque Drew voiced Madame Odius in Power Rangers Ninja Steel (2017) and Nightmare in Power Rangers Dino Charge (2015); Amanda Billings played principal Hastings in Power Rangers Ninja Steel/ Super Steel (2017/2018) and voice Bajilla in Power Rangers Cosmic Fury(2023); and Teuila Blakely played Commander Shaw in Power Rangers Beast Morphers (2019) and voiced Spyclops in Power Rangers Ninja Steel (2017).

2628.name: Ladies of the '80s: A Divas Christmas
2628.storyline: Christopher Atkins played Linda Gray's young lover on Dallas (1978). He's reunited with her here (with a wink to the audience) as her husband.

2630.name: Christmas on Honeysuckle Lane
2630.storyline: Filmed in the historic part of Wethersfield, CT, a suburb of Hartford.

2631.name: Sugar Plum Twist
2631.storyline: Phone number on the door of the dance studio is actually the number for Fred Astaire Dance Studio in Old Saybrook, CT - one location where the move was shot.

2632.name: Ramrod
2632.storyline: At the time of filming, Veronica Lake and director André De Toth were married. This film was their first screen collaboration.

2633.name: L'Avventura
2633.storyline: At its premiere at the 1960 Cannes Film Festival, this was booed so much to the extent that Michelangelo Antonioni and Monica Vitti fled the theater. However, after the second screening there was a complete turn around in how it was perceived and it was awarded the Special Jury Prize, going on to become a landmark of European cinema.

2634.name: Mistletoe Mixup
2634.storyline: Joey Lawrence, Matthew Lawrence, and Andrew Lawrence, are brothers in real life and Donna Lawrence is their real-life mother (though she plays their grandmother in the film).

2635.name: The Lords of Flatbush
2635.storyline: Henry Winkler stated that when he was creating the character of The Fonz in Happy Days (1974), he based his performance on Sylvester Stallone's portrayal of Stanley.

2636.name: Snow White
2636.storyline: To save money, the Cannon Movie Tales were shot two or three at a time. This movie was shot simultaneously with Beauty and the Beast (1987). This wasn't the best of situations in that often the two crews would be competing for limited equipment, costumes, and sets.

2637.name: Christmas in Maple Hills
2637.storyline: 7.6 stars.A wonderfully nostalgic and memorable story of two interwoven romances spanning 80 years in the town of Maple Hills. It's an account of a family on the verge of losing their maple farm because the bank discovers the deed is not in their name. The true owner is a mysterious person who signed it sometime soon after WWII.In the present day, a doctor and a young woman whose family runs the farm are falling in love. The mystery of the farm is occupying their time more than anticipated and soon becomes an impediment to the romance. In the past, we see her grandmother longing for a man to return from the war. He is not much more than a stranger to her, but she is in love with him and he with her. There are other men involved both in the past and present, and we are left trying to solve the mysteries of unrequited loves and how they all began. Who owns the farm, who will discover the identity of the stranger and the mystery deed owner?First of all, there are way too many commercials, so this film must have a runtime of 80 minutes. That's fine, but with a story so rich with so much potential, more is better. Nevertheless, it's very easy to get lost in both the back story and the present one, both so fascinating, it's difficult to pick which is better.It's a very intriguing mystery that keeps us guessing who, when, and where. Enjoy it for the excitement, the romance, or both, but either way this is two stories unconventionally rolled into one short film.

2638.name: Fading Gigolo
2638.storyline: John Turturro and Woody Allen share a barber, which is how Allen learned about the movie.

2639.name: Sissy
2639.storyline: Hannah Barlow in addition to playing Emma and co-directing the film, also sings the last song in the credits "An Ode to Narcisa" Performed by Hannah Barlow Composed by Kenneth Lampl & Hannah Barlow Lyrics by Hannah Barlow Produced by Kenneth Lampl.

2640.name: Surprised by Oxford
2640.storyline: Based on a true story, this film's world premiere was at the Heartland International Film Festival in Indianapolis, IN, to a sold-out crowd on Sat, Oct 8, 2022. Carolyn Weber, author of the book whose biographical novel the movie is based upon, was in attendance, along with actor Rose Reid, who played Caro Drake in the film, and other production members.

2641.name: A Midsummer Night's Dream
2641.storyline: During filming of Oberon (Ian Richardson) and Titania (Judi Dench) against a raining backdrop, one of the young men operating the hoses (to simulate rain) was so distracted by the nearly nude beauty of Dench, that he lost track of his hose, which blasted Dench and Richardson into the adjacent lake, from which they had to be rescued by the crew.

2642.name: Mohabbatein
2642.storyline: Amitabh Bachchan was out of work and with no makers approaching him, he approached Yash Chopra for some work, and was offered a role in the movie.

2643.name: Oh Christmas Tree!
2643.storyline: When the lot is being closed for being a fire hazard, just as Bob walks up, "Shark Tank"'s Robert Herjavec can be seen walking behind him.

2644.name: The Blue Lagoon
2644.storyline: A wedding scene was added in order to appease U.S. censors.

2645.name: Melancholie der Engel
2645.storyline: The director received several death threats after the movie was released

2646.name: A Lot Like Christmas
2646.storyline: The opening credits shows shots from the town Härnösand, Sweden and Kramfors, Sweden

2647.name: The Comedian
2647.storyline: Robert De Niro had been trying to make this movie for eight years.

2648.name: The Four Musketeers: Milady's Revenge
2648.storyline: Cardinal Richelieu (Charlton Heston) says to d'Artagnan (Michael York) that he has no personal enemies, only enemies of France. This line is in neither the original novel nor the script. Charlton Heston came across this quote of the Cardinal's when researching the role, and asked director Richard Lester to find a place to include it in this movie.

2649.name: A Snow Globe Christmas
2649.storyline: This movie resembles another Christina Milian movie called Snowglobe (2007) where she also is in a Snowglobe.

2650.name: Truly Madly Deeply
2650.storyline: Alan Rickman had cello lessons, and handles the right (bowing) hand, but the left hand is provided by a real cellist standing behind him with his arm through Alan Rickman's armpit. Juliet Stevenson does play her piano part however.

2651.name: Christmas at Pemberley Manor
2651.storyline: Though set in the cold of winter, the film was actually shot in the heat of mid-June Connecticut, with temperatures going over 30° Celsius/90° Fahrenheit.

2652.name: One Night Stand
2652.storyline: According to the book "Robert Downey, Jr. - The fall and rise of the comeback kid", Mike Figgis and Robert Downey Jr. met at Kate Mantilini's, a restaurant on Wilshire Boulevard in Beverly Hills, to discuss this movie. Downey arrived two hours late, barefoot, high, and carrying a purse with a gun sticking out of it. Figgis was shocked at first, but started a conversation anyway.
