Downey, who had lost a lot of weight because of his addiction, still expected to be offered the lead role of Max. Figgis offered him the part of Charlie, a man dying of A.I.D.S. instead. This in turn, gave Downey a shock, but after taking a good look in the mirror (and doing a line of coke) he decided to accept the part.

2653.name: The Chase
2653.storyline: Accidentally shown at the Dublin Film Festival as part of a classics retrospective instead of the Marlon Brando movie of the same name.

2654.name: Black Beauty
2654.storyline: The character Black Beauty is a colt/stallion (male). However the newly born foal playing Black Beauty in this film is a filly (female).

2655.name: The Jesus Rolls
2655.storyline: Though the character was created by the Coens in The Big Lebowski (1998), it was John Turturro who came up with Jesus's eccentric personality and mannerisms.

2656.name: Matchmaker Santa
2656.storyline: In the scene in the hotel honeymoon suite, the blanket curtain is an idea from It Happened One Night, the walls of Jericho.

2657.name: Mackenna's Gold
2657.storyline: During the swimming scene at the pool, Hesh-Ke was supposed to be topless with a loincloth. In an interview, Julie Newmar stated that at the last minute she decided to do the scene fully nude and no one, especially the actors and crew, argued with her about the decision.

2658.name: Tom and Huck
2658.storyline: During two months of filming in Alabama, the production endured muggy heat, swarming bugs, a mysterious "killer" mulch that made several people sick, severe thunderstorm warnings, and a tornado watch.

2659.name: Some Girls
2659.storyline: During the opening and closing credits, the music is from W.A. Mozart's Serenade # 13 for strings in G Major, K. 525, better known as "Eine Kleine Nachtmusik". In addition, the music during the scene where Michael is helping Granny out of her wet clothes and then again during several subsequent scenes involving Granny is a re-write of a portion of the 1st movement from Beethoven's Piano Concerto # 5, also known as the "Emperor" Concerto. It is uncertain why this went unmentioned in the movie's credits, as if James Newton Howard was the original composer of this music.

2660.name: The Mistletoe Inn
2660.storyline: When they are looking out of the window of the hotel in NYC, it is snowing. A few minutes later as they are walking through the streets, there are green leaves on the trees as the walk under them. The trees wouldn't have leaves on them in December and, being Christmas time, they also would likely be decorated with lights.

2661.name: Christmas in Rockwell
2661.storyline: Trish Stratus and Stephen Huszar appear together in Christmas in the Rockies (2020), by the same production company the previous year.

2662.name: This Beautiful Fantastic
2662.storyline: Andrew Scott was keen to play a part in the film as he was tired of playing villains.

2663.name: The Greatest Show on Earth
2663.storyline: See the complete list of Best Picture winners. For fun, use the "sort order" function to rank by IMDb rating and other criteria.

2664.name: Holding the Man
2664.storyline: When the adolescent Tim first asks John if he'll "go round with him," the telephone used by Ryan Corr is the actual telephone Timothy Conigrave would have used to make the call in real life. It was Conigrave's personal bedroom telephone from his youth, provided to the production by his sister Anna Davison.

2665.name: The Robe
2665.storyline: Richard Burton was once threatened with a gun by Stewart Granger because of the affair he was having with Granger's wife Jean Simmons during filming.

2666.name: A Short Film About Love
2666.storyline: The ending is different from the TV version. It was rewritten at the suggestion of lead actress Grazyna Szapolowska who wanted the film to have a "fairytale ending".

2667.name: A Song for Christmas
2667.storyline: The custom coach used by Adelaide Kay and company was made by Prévost, a Québec-based luxury coach builder and subsidiary of Volvo. Prévost built the custom coaches used by Presidents George W. Bush and Donald Trump; the latter was dubbed "Ground Force One."

2668.name: Love Me If You Dare
2668.storyline: The film is dedicated to Yann Samuell's parents-in-law Gerard and Sonia. Gerard and Sonia lent their house to Yann Samuell while he was writing the screenplay. The two were killed in a car crash a week before the film was released.

2669.name: What's Cooking?
2669.storyline: Rachel's mom, Ruth, spills coffee onto the saucer of the 4th cup. She puts spoons on all 4 saucers without cleaning the spilled coffee.

2670.name: Babyteeth
2670.storyline: Eliza Scanlen shaved her head for her role as Milla.

2671.name: Dating Amber
2671.storyline: The film was set in 1995, two years after the decriminalization of homosexuality in The Republic of Ireland.

2672.name: Millennium Actress
2672.storyline: Cranes appear frequently throughout the film, typically with Chiyoko in the same frame. In Japanese culture, cranes represent longevity and fidelity, and are said to live for a thousand years.

2673.name: Quartet
2673.storyline: Dame Maggie Smith recommended Pauline Collins to Director Dustin Hoffman for the part of Cissy.

2674.name: Above the Shadows
2674.storyline: Carries a 2017 copyright date, suggesting it was completed two years before release.

2675.name: The Rooftop Christmas Tree
2675.storyline: Peter Dillon is only 12 years old than Michelle Morgan, who plays his daughter.

2676.name: Christmas on the Farm
2676.storyline: Lovable over the top characters in a light hearted uplifting Aussie Christmas movie.Lots of references to Crocodile Dundee.Excellent cast and beautiful bright photography.Enjoyable rom com.

2677.name: Breath
2677.storyline: Western Australia writer Tim Winton's novel 'Breath' (on which this film is based) was first published in 2008 and won the Miles Franklin Literary Award in 2009. It was the third time the author was awarded this annual literary prize.

2678.name: Much Ado About Christmas
2678.storyline: The very first Christmas movie for the newly-rebranded "GAC Family" network.

2679.name: Chaos Theory
2679.storyline: Ryan Reynolds plays Elisabeth Harnois's father despite being less than three years older than her (945 days to be specific). Emily Mortimer, who plays Elisabeth Harnois's mother, is less than eight years older than her in real life.

2680.name: Christmas with a Prince: Becoming Royal
2680.storyline: Third Chistmas Movie for Kaitlyn Leeb.

2682.name: A Home for the Holidays
2682.storyline: I couldn't make it more than half an hour watching this trash! Shannon Elizabeth is so talentless it's mortifying!And she looks and sounds downright horrible! This is basically The Real Housewives disguised as a family Christmas movie!I've never even heard of the other people in this movie but they need to retire or consider a new line of work! They're that dreadful!It was ultra cringy to listen to and look at the cast and to listen to the music in this tripe!The half hour I wasted on this garbage is half an hour of my life that I'll never get back! Please avoid this gargantuan drivel like tobacco?!

2683.name: And So It Goes
2683.storyline: Rob Reiner cast himself as Artie because he needed an actor who would work for scale pay on short notice.

2684.name: China Girl
2684.storyline: Out of all of the films he has directed, Abel Ferrara has stated that "China Girl" is his favorite.

2685.name: Final Cut: Ladies and Gentlemen
2685.storyline: The film consists entirely of shots taken from other films. During the three years of its development many versions were made, the latest uses scenes from 450 different movies and TV series.

2686.name: Love at the Thanksgiving Day Parade
2686.storyline: From comedies to classics, we've rounded up 30 titles available to stream or rent as you settle into the sofa over the holidays.

2687.name: The Evening Star
2687.storyline: When producers found they could not use the original house used in Terms of Endearment (1983) for the project, they searched Houston (TX) for a house that looked similar. When they located one, they found out that it belonged to the daughter of the person who owned the one used in "Terms".

2688.name: A Godwink Christmas
2688.storyline: Filmed in Gibsons, British Columbia, Vancouver, and other locations in Canada, according to What's Filming. The movie was originally going to be called A Carousel Christmas (or a Christmas Carousel). A few exterior shots, however, were filmed later at Martha's Vineyard to give a more authentic feel, despite the movie itself being filmed in Canada.

2689.name: Bent
2689.storyline: Sir Ian McKellen (Uncle Freddie) starred in the role of Max in the original London West End theatre production in 1979.

2690.name: American Kamasutra
2690.storyline: Edited version of the TV series Submission.

2691.name: Resort to Love
2691.storyline: Christina Milian did all of her own singing in the film.

2692.name: Something New
2692.storyline: Sanaa Lathan's character, Kenya, is the daughter of Alfre Woodard's character. They share the same relationship in Love & Basketball (2000), and also in The Family That Preys (2008).

2693.name: Rockstar
2693.storyline: The film was shot in reverse as the crew didn't want to break the continuity of Ranbir Kapoor's hairstyle. So the climax with long hair was shot first.

2694.name: Big Miracle
2694.storyline: The sportscaster shown at the end of the archived news clip is a young Sarah Palin.

2695.name: Hollywoodland
2695.storyline: The film's producers were forced to shoot a new version of the opening credits of Adventures of Superman (1952) when Warner Brothers refused permission for the actual opening credits to be used within the film.

2696.name: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
2696.storyline: This movie is an indirect adaptation of Yasutaka Tsutsui's novel "The Girl Who Leapt Through Time" - the main character's aunt is Yoshiyama Kazuko, the protagonist of the novel.

2697.name: Snowkissed
2697.storyline: Filmed in part at a popular boutique restaurant and store in the rural area east of Winnipeg, Pineridge Hollow. It is also on the border of a wonderful year-round playground and campground, Bird's Hill Provincial Park.

2698.name: Heimliche Liebe - Der Schüler und die Postbotin
2698.storyline: i didn't know that in German language, there are too some good movies. it is a movies of a love between a school boy and a middle aged lady, who works as a post-woman. this film is in a great extent copied and remade in Bollywood in the name of 'Ek Chhotisi Love Story' that means 'a little love story'. I saw this movie, the German one, last night in an Austrian Channel. it is a pity that i could not finish the movie, but the subject matter seems to be interesting and fresh, clearly depicting that what happens when the love goes madly for somebody, regardless of the social differences. i couldn't understand when a director or a script writer selects just repeats the previously hit movie instead of creating a completely new one, having its own flavor. it could be of the small things in our lives, very common. it need't be dramatic and marvelous.

2699.name: Lost Illusions
2699.storyline: The character of Nathan d'Anastazio, played by Xavier Dolan, is actually a synthesis of three characters from the novel: Raoul Nathan, a scheming journalist, Daniel d'Arthez, a hard-working writer and Melchior de Canalis, a successful poet.

2700.name: A Clüsterfünke Christmas
2700.storyline: The first movie to film concurrently in both Canadian English and American English. Minor confusion among the cast led to the re-shooting of some scenes.

2701.name: Hiroshima Mon Amour
2701.storyline: This film pioneered the use of jump cutting to and from a flashback, and of very brief flashbacks to suggest obtrusive memories.

2702.name: A Summer Place
2702.storyline: The telephone operator asks for an additional $2.00 for a 3-minute continuation of the long distance call between Johnny and Molly. This equates to about $34.50 in 2017, which accurately depicts the cost of long distance telephone calls at the time. They were expensive and rare for the average citizen.

2703.name: Head in the Clouds
2703.storyline: Hugh Grant was originally announced for the Stuart Townsend part.

2705.name: Switched for Christmas
2705.storyline: Piper is played by Natasha Bure, Candace Cameron Bure's real-life daughter.

2706.name: Four Christmases and a Wedding
2706.storyline: Movie played at mall is 'Dear Santa' (2011)

2707.name: 3-Iron
2707.storyline: Director Kim ki-Duk wrote the screenplay of the movie in one month, the movie was filmed in 16 days and the film editing was done in 10 days.

2708.name: Torn Curtain
2708.storyline: In a conversation with François Truffaut, Sir Alfred Hitchcock said that he included the fight scene deliberately to show the audience how difficult it can be to kill a man, because several spy thrillers at the time made killing look effortless.

2709.name: Doctor Dolittle
2709.storyline: "The Reluctant Vegetarian" was one of the hardest scenes to film, mainly because of the number of animals that had to sit still for a lengthy period. The cast had hours of rehearsal and preparation before filming started. The first take went very well, until Sir Rex Harrison stopped singing. Director Richard Fleischer asked him why, and Harrison said he heard him yell "Cut!" Fleischer denied it, and they were starting to argue about it when both heard a voice yell "Cut!" The guilty party turned out to be Polynesia the Parrot. Harrison said "That's the first time I've ever been directed by a parrot. But she may be right. I probably can do it better."

2710.name: Mektoub, My Love: Canto Uno
2710.storyline: It is the first part of the cycle 'Mektoub is Mektoub,' a free film adaptation of François Bégaudeau's novel "The Injury".

2711.name: Black Tea
2711.storyline: A mix of all that is elegant in Chinese culture coupled with all that is elegant in what used to be the Kingdoms of West Africa and all of that in a 2024 setting which we are told is Guangzhou but is actually filmed in Taiwan also in Cape Verde for a little bit and the Ivory Coastthe dreamy quality of the tale here is bathed in silk it is soft and sophisticated throughout .... this is the film should have got the Palme D'or in 2024 instead of the garbage they give it to these daysThere is a meditation on couples also a small amount of the time is spent on racism in any country, but here is is tangentialThe main drive is to do with cultures and the intermingling of those and the possibilities thereinThis is a truly beautiful film at a pace which respects humanityI do not give it a 10 as it is not perfect but almost. Best I have seen in a whileTreat yourselves.

2712.name: Christmas in Pine Valley
2712.storyline: A retread of the annual yule tide favorite Christmas in Connecticut (1945), which also involves protagonists portraying themselves in fictitious terms to appease a journalist staying with them for the holidays.

2713.name: Melody
2713.storyline: The film's alternative title S.W.A.L.K. is a common British abbreviation for Sealed With A Loving Kiss, a phrase that lovers write on the envelope of love letters to each other.

2714.name: A Prairie Home Companion
2714.storyline: For insurance purposes, and in case 80-year-old director Robert Altman was unable to finish shooting the film, Paul Thomas Anderson was employed as a standby director.

2716.name: Letters to Santa
2716.storyline: 6.7 stars.I have mixed feelings about 'Letters to Santa'. It's a nice story about two kids who want their parents back together. Mom and dad are separated due to some unknown circumstances that we are not aware of until much later. She gives us her reasons why she told him to go live with his mother, but those aren't the actual problems. What also happened is he misspent some precious money and she felt somewhat betrayed. He didn't cheat or anything. The whole premise is very weak. If a marriage can break on something as flimsy as this, we are all doomed. But the rest of the film is not too bad. Yes, the parents bicker. Yes, there are slow parts. The children are endearing and the fitness woman is actually likable too, as is the "elf". The mother is a regular Latina seen in many films and she does fine. The lead female grows on you after a while, but she is an acquired taste, and my theory is that she is the reason for many negative reviews. The lead male is charismatic, but his personality is absent. For some reason he's not present and it's disconcerting, because beside his apparent lack of focus, he just doesn't show up for the part. I wonder if that's not the final straw for this movie. Cast two different lead actors and you probably have a winner here. What are the odds that both of them fail to entertain? Oh well, it happens.

2717.name: Othello
2717.storyline: This production marks the first time a black man was cast in the title role in a film version of Othello.

2718.name: Senseless
2718.storyline: Penelope Spheeris said in an interview that working with the Weinsteins on this made her want to stop making mainstream Hollywood movies. She thought, "How the fuck did I get here? What am I doing? I don't want to do this anymore. I don't want to work in this movie business anymore."

2719.name: Your Sister's Sister
2719.storyline: The movie was shot in 12 days and it was largely improvised.

2720.name: Permission
2720.storyline: Morgan Spector and Rebecca Hall are married in real life.

2721.name: My Blueberry Nights
2721.storyline: The name of the Jeremy's café "Klyuch" is actually the Russian word for key. It can be seen on the front door of the café in blue Cyrillic letters. Keys are an important plot point in the film because people leave them there often.

2722.name: Where Angels Fear to Tread
2722.storyline: The movie and source novel's title is derived from stanza in the poem "An Essay on Criticism" (1709) by Alexander Pope. It reads: "Nay, fly to Altars; there they'll talk you dead; For Fools rush in where Angels fear to tread".

2723.name: The Shadow Riders
2723.storyline: Sam Elliott, Tom Selleck, and Jeff Osterhage wanted to do another western together after they did The Sacketts (1979). They contacted that film's writer, Louis L'Amour and asked him to write a story idea for them. This film was the result.

2724.name: L'Eclisse
2724.storyline: To celebrate the life and career of Alain Delon, the actor often credited with starring in some of the greatest European films of the 1960s and '70s, we rounded up his top 10 movies, ranked by IMDb fan ratings.

2725.name: Dirty Love
2725.storyline: In one scene, a movie director named Robert Rodale treats Kam Heskin's character harshly. In the commentary track, Jenny McCarthy and her then-husband, director John Mallory Asher, said Rodale was intended to represent director Kevin Smith. McCarthy had auditioned for Mallrats, and felt he had treated her very rudely. Asher then sarcastically complimented Smith for 'Gigli' (mistaking it 'Jersey Girl,' both of which featured Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez.) Smith's story of the audition is on his podcast, 'Smodcast' episode #82.

2727.name: The Blue Angel
2727.storyline: There are various accounts of why Marlene Dietrich was cast as Lola Lola, but the one given by director Josef von Sternberg in his autobiography is that Dietrich came to test for the film with a bored, world-weary attitude because she was convinced she wasn't going to get the role and was merely going through the motions - and Sternberg hired her because that world-weary attitude was precisely what he wanted for the character.

2728.name: Atlantic City
2728.storyline: Just after filming ended Burt Lancaster nearly died during a routine gall bladder operation in January 1980, requiring multiple blood transfusions.

2729.name: Maggie's Plan
2729.storyline: The language that Julianne Moore and her kids speak is Danish.

2730.name: Rabbit Without Ears
2730.storyline: The scenes with Nora Tschirner and Jürgen Vogel on the red carpet at the German Film Awards were shot during the actual red carpet ceremony in 2007.

2731.name: The Razor's Edge
2731.storyline: There were 89 different sets built for the film, which had the longest shooting schedule for any film at the studio to that date. According to some news items, the film broke all previous studio box office records.

2732.name: Husbands and Wives
2732.storyline: Hoping to piggyback on the publicity surrounding Woody Allen's breakup with Mia Farrow, TriStar opened the film on 865 screens, the largest number ever given over to a Woody Allen picture. They were rewarded with an opening weekend of 3.52 million dollars, the biggest ever for an Allen film.

2733.name: Wicked Minds
2733.storyline: [first lines] Holden: [voice over] They say my generation is jaded. Brought up in a time when there's no faith in God, government, people... anything. But I always like to think of myself as more optimistic than that. But I have to admit, when I get into a situation like this, there's only one message that flashes in your head like a bright, red, burning neon sign: trust no one.

2734.name: Love Reset
2734.storyline: I usually don't go around writing reviews, but man, this movie? It's a solid 10 on my scale (and trust me, I'm a tough critic - nothing ever gets a perfect 10 in my book except for this).So, I walked into the theater with zero expectations, right? But this film turned out to be an absolute riot, way beyond what I thought it would be. I lost count of how many times I busted out laughing, and it wasn't just me - the whole theater was in stitches. The story threw some curveballs that I never saw coming, and the creativity in those unexpected moments? Genius.Let's talk about the main cast, Kang Ha-neul and Jung So-min - they killed it. The chemistry between them? Off the charts. And the other folks in the cast weren't slouching either - everyone held their own. Big shoutout to the director and the writers, too - they nailed it.If you're in the mood for a good laugh and a dash of romance, seriously, check this one out. And get this - I'm usually all about horror, but even with that background, I can vouch for this film. It's like a universal crowd-pleaser, breaking through genres and giving you the perfect mix of humor and romance. Don't miss it!

2735.name: State Fair
2735.storyline: Ann-Margret was a brunette, as can be witnessed from her early album covers and her screen test footage from State Fair (1962). It was director Jose Ferrer who recommended that she dye her hair red during pre-production of this film. The finished effect was so dazzling that she adopted this shade from that point on.

2736.name: Millennium Mambo
2736.storyline: Hou Hsiao-Hsien researches his projects meticulously. For Millennium Mambo, largely set in the hyper-charged twilight world of the Taipei rave scene, he threw himself into youth culture. He hung out at the local discos and even experimented with ecstasy.

2737.name: Vampire in Brooklyn
2737.storyline: From Reggie Hammond in 48 Hrs. to Chris Carver in Candy Cane Lane, take a look back at the iconic career of Eddie Murphy.

2738.name: Chennai Express
2738.storyline: Unusually, Deepika Padukone is credited ahead of Shah Rukh Khan, at the request of Shah Rukh Khan himself.

2739.name: The Story of Us
2739.storyline: Bruce Willis was going through his own divorce from Demi Moore at the time of filming.

2740.name: Needle in a Timestack
2740.storyline: The short story by Robert Silverberg that this movie is based on was first published in the June 1983 issue of Playboy. Silverberg had previously published a collection of ten short stories under the same title in 1966, and decided to re-use the title for this story.

2741.name: Palmetto
2741.storyline: Ray Liotta was considered for the role of Harry Barber.

2742.name: Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
2742.storyline: Winifred Watson's book was published the fall of 1938 and it became a smash hit. Plans were in the works for a Hollywood film version starring Billie Burke as Miss Pettigrew, but the start of WWII brought those plans to a halt. The publisher re-released the book in 2000 which led to it being "found" again by Hollywood after 60+ years.

2743.name: Amazing Grace
2743.storyline: The scene where William Wilberforce (Ioan Gruffudd) sings "Amazing Grace" at the card house was sung by Gruffudd at that moment. In the last several takes, a playback was used, but it is Ioan singing. Director Michael Apted had no idea whether or not Gruffudd could actually sing. Little did he know, Ioan is an accomplished soloist and choir singer. With a little practice, Ioan performed for the first time on-set while the cameras were rolling. All much to the surprise of the cast, crew, and director.

2744.name: Christmas in Homestead
2744.storyline: The film employed approximately 300 local extras and is estimated to have had a $375,000 economic impact on the town of Dahlonega.

2745.name: The Christmas Cottage
2745.storyline: Wallowa Lake Lodge, where Ava and Mason's wedding is held in Oregon, exists in real life. However, the filming of this movie, including what is used as the exterior shots of the lodge, does not take place at the real Wallowa Lake Lodge.

2746.name: Baaghi
2746.storyline: Shraddha Kapoor and Tiger Shroff were Classmates in childhood.

2747.name: Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam
2747.storyline: Kevin Jonas once received 43 birdhouses in one day by Camp Rock fans.

2748.name: Eat Drink Man Woman
2748.storyline: The opening sequence - in which a Sunday lunch is lovingly prepared - took over a week to film.

2749.name: She Taught Love
2749.storyline: Blu BillyWritten by Smino (as Christopher Smith), Monte Booker (as Ahmanti Booker), Amari Lewis, Michael Edward Neil, Nathaniel FoleyPerformed by SminoCourtesy of Interscope RecordsUnder license from Universal Music Enterprises

2750.name: Boys and Girls
2750.storyline: The students seen in several scenes at UC Berkeley are actual Berkeley students; the movie was filmed while classes were in session.

2751.name: The Science of Sleep
2751.storyline: At the 2006 Berlin Film Festival, director Michel Gondry told that the main location of the film is a house where he used to live 15 years ago.

2752.name: 45 Years
2752.storyline: The movie was shot in chronological order.

2753.name: Rifkin's Festival
2753.storyline: The scene in which Ingmar Bergman's The Seventh Seal (1957) chess game was recreated was filmed on the same beach where the Dragonstone landing of Game of Thrones (2011) was filmed. Christoph Waltz, dressed in a heavy black robe withstood high temperatures in the sun (40 degrees Celsius) on the hottest day of the last half century in the area.

2755.name: Look Who's Talking Too
2755.storyline: The Learjet featured in the movie was owned by John Travolta at the time the movie was made. Tail number N254JT. JT = John Travolta.

2756.name: Separate Lies
2756.storyline: Last full-length cinema film of John Neville, playing the role of "Lord Rawston."

2757.name: A Godwink Christmas: Miracle of Love
2757.storyline: Every featured vehicle had its brand logo painted in black so it can't be recognized.

2758.name: Skipped Parts
2758.storyline: Among the names on the chalkboard in the lunchroom are Mike D. (Tamra Davis's husband) and Billy M. (Billy Madison (1995)), which she also directed.

2759.name: Young Werther
2759.storyline: The film premiered at TIFF in Toronto, Canada in 2024.

2760.name: Accidental Love
2760.storyline: Production shut down numerous times due to financial problems. In May 2008, Jake Gyllenhaal and Jessica Biel walked off the set after producers failed to show they had enough money to pay the cast. The Screen Actors Guild (SAG) announced it would keep all cast members from the movie until the production company showed it had enough money set aside in a union-mandated account. When the International Alliance of Theatrical and Stage Employees (IATSE) learned that below-the-line crew members were not being paid, union leaders called for staff-members to boycott the production. Production shut down again in June 2008, when several crew members didn't show up for work because they hadn't been paid.

2761.name: Honeymoon in Vegas
2761.storyline: Little Elvis was played by a six-year-old Bruno Mars (Peter Gene "Bruno" Hernandez).

2762.name: Barefoot in the Park
2762.storyline: Robert Redford loathed wearing a suit and tie all day which was required for his character. During breaks between filming, Redford wore western boots and a black cowboy hat.

2763.name: Love You Like Christmas
2763.storyline: The exterior of Holly's diner was filmed in the same building that 'Luke's Diner' was filmed in for Pilot (2000).

2764.name: Bright Star
2764.storyline: John Keats' poems used in the film are: Endymion, When I Have Fears That I May Cease to Be, The Eve of St Agnes, Ode to a Nightingale, La Belle Dame Sans Merci and Bright Star.

2767.name: Fedora
2767.storyline: Prior to a preview in Santa Barbara, United Artists had cut twelve minutes from the movie. Director Billy Wilder refused to allow any further cuts, and the screening went poorly, with the audience laughing during the wrong parts of the film.

2768.name: Ecstasy
2768.storyline: First surviving non-pornographic film to depict a woman having an orgasm.

2769.name: Tyler Perry's A Madea Homecoming
2769.storyline: This film is based on "Madea's Farewell Play" due to having similar story lines.

2770.storyline: During its one week theatrical release from June 30 to July 6, it only made $422, making it the lowest grossing film of 2017.

2771.name: Sincerely Truly Christmas
2771.storyline: Paula and Jake started in Degrassi The Next Generation but did not share any scenes together as they appeared in different seasons

2772.name: Fair Game
2772.storyline: This is Cindy Crawford's only starring role in a film.

2773.name: If I Were Free
2773.storyline: This film is based on the play "Behold, We Live!" by John Van Druten.n The play opened in London on August 16, 1932. The play ran on the London stage during 1932 and starred Gertrude Lawrence and Gerald du Maurier in the leading roles.

2774.name: The Rosie Project
2774.storyline: Graeme Simsion wrote the screenplay before "reverse adapting" it into the bestselling novel of the same name.

2775.name: Tomorrow, When the War Began
2775.storyline: The language spoken by the invaders in the film is a totally made up language, sampled from many languages worldwide and then scrambled.

2776.name: The Wild One
2776.storyline: The Triumph motorcycle that Marlon Brando rides in the movie was his personal bike.

2777.name: Tarzan the Ape Man
2777.storyline: The elephants used in the early Weissmuller films were not African but Asian elephants with African sized ears strapped on. This practice is still common because the Asian species is much more docile than the African. In later films the fake ears were abandoned altogether figuring no one would know the difference.

2778.storyline: Karl Markovics was originally set to play Rocco, but a scheduling conflict made him drop out.

2779.name: Attenberg
2779.storyline: Yorgos Lanthimos meets his future wife, Ariane Labed, on the set of this film.

2780.name: An Unmarried Woman
2780.storyline: Dr. Penelope Russianoff, who plays Erica (Jill Clayburgh)'s therapist Tanya, was an actual practicing psychologist. The counseling sessions were filmed in her actual penthouse apartment on West 86th Street in New York, where she saw her patients. She worked for two and a half days and was paid US $2500. She was cast after having been recommended to director Paul Mazursky by "Girlfriends" (1978) director Claudia Weill. Russianoff said that she improvised most of her dialogue, which was based on the type of therapy she gave her patients. After the movie was launched, Russianoff became a mini-celebrity. She said the role gave her "instant celebrity-hood," being recognized on the streets of New York, where she signed autographs, and got a number of new clients. She wrote several self-help books in the 1980s, including "Why Do I Think I Am Nothing Without a Man?" (1988), a book first published about a decade after this film, but with a title and subject matter that were reflective of this picture.

2781.name: Bajirao Mastani
2781.storyline: A passion project for director Sanjay Leela Bhansali since the 1990s, even before he made his directorial debut, Khamoshi the Musical (1996). The film was first announced in 2003. Bhansali initially wanted to cast Salman Khan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, his lead pair from Straight from the Heart (1999), as the lead actors, with Bhoomika Chawla playing Kashibai, but his plans fell through when the real-life couple had a messy, highly-publicized breakup. Bhansali kept Khan on and approached Kareena Kapoor to play Mastani and Rani Mukerji to play Kashibai but shelved his plans and moved on to other projects after Khan and Kapoor both signed on to star in Kyon Ki... (2005), as he had wanted to be the first director to unite the pair, as he stated on the talk show Sanjay Leela Bhansali & Aishwarya (2004). Over the following decade, Bhansali kept expecting the project to be his next film, with several major actors being approached or rumored to be linked to the project, including Shahrukh Khan, Ajay Devgn, Hrithik Roshan and Katrina Kaif, while some in the industry believed it would never be made, calling it jinxed. The project was finally properly revived in 2014 when Bhansali finally decided on his lead actress from Mary Kom (2014), Priyanka Chopra Jonas, and his lead pair from Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram Leela (2013), Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone.

2782.name: Raise the Red Lantern
2782.storyline: Filmed at the Qiao Family Compound near the city of Pingyao. The complex is now open for tours, however, nowhere is there any mention of the film.

2783.name: The Family Star
2783.storyline: The UK release was cut, the distributor chose to remove scenes of violence in order to obtain a 12A classification. An uncut 15 classification was available.

2784.name: Sebastiane
2784.storyline: When asked about the film's nudity, director Derek Jarman replied "We couldn't afford costumes."

2785.name: Reverse the Curse
2785.storyline: David Duchovny, Evan Handler, Pamela Adlon and Jason Beghe previously worked together on Californication (2007).

2787.name: Prime
2787.storyline: The dog sitting at Meryl Streep's feet as she is eating the pastrami sandwich with her husband is, in fact, her own dog - Digby.

2788.name: Totally F***ed Up
2788.storyline: First part of Gregg Araki's Teenage Apocalypse Trilogy. The other two parts are The Doom Generation (1995) and Nowhere (1997). James Duval stars in all the three films.

2789.name: Kicking and Screaming
2789.storyline: The film was almost accepted in competition at the Cannes Film Festival, but Noah Baumbach refused to cut 15 minutes as they requested, and the film was ultimately rejected.

2790.name: Restoration
2790.storyline: Sir Ian McKellen and Robert Downey, Jr. became friends during the shoot, and McKellen was struck by Downey's talent and attitude compared to some of the British cast members. McKellen offered Downey a part in Richard III (1995), stating that casting an American actor would help fund that movie. When the release of this movie was delayed by eighteen months, owing to story concerns and re-shoots, Richard III (1995) was released in theaters before this movie.

2791.name: A Jazzman's Blues
2791.storyline: In reality, Willie Earl (Austin Scott) is actually about 5 years younger than Bayou, (Joshua Boone) who plays his younger brother, despite playing the older brother.

2792.name: Cool as Ice
2792.storyline: An early project of cinematographer Janusz Kaminski, who went onto work numerous times with Steven Spielberg.

2793.name: Christmas Mail
2793.storyline: When Matt and Kristi go for hot chocolate and Matt reaches up for a can of instant cocoa, the can is mainly white with writing. In a later shot, the can has changed and has a green band at the top.

2794.name: Jexi
2794.storyline: Because Rose Byrne recorded all her lines after filming, in order to have lines to react to, an earwig was placed inside Adam Devine's ear with and Actress/Voice-Over Artist Laurie Burke delivered Jexi's lines to him. However, sometimes the earpiece would malfunction. Co-Director Jon Lucas exclaimed that "there were times when Adam would just take the earbud out and do the whole scene without ever hearing anyone talking."

2795.name: A Christmas Carousel
2795.storyline: Lila's necklace appears and disappears multiple times during the time she is at the horse stables and carousel with the prince

2796.name: A Kid in King Arthur's Court
2796.storyline: Kate Winslet was reportedly told to lose weight for her role, and became sick as a result.

2797.name: A Royal Runaway Romance
2797.storyline: There are not any mountains in Nebraska.

2798.name: Madame Bovary
2798.storyline: This is actress Mia Wasikowska's fifth period drama set in the 19th century.

2799.name: Looks That Kill
2799.storyline: Shooting of the bridge scenes was continuously interrupted by weather. During the filming of the first bridge scene a strong but brief blizzard shut production down for a half an hour. Within an hour there was almost no sign it had snowed at all. The final scene on the bridge was completed minutes before an incoming electrical storm would have required production to be suspended for safety.

2800.name: Haunted Wedding
2800.storyline: The second time Linda Ko has portrayed Janel Parrish's mother after Never Been Chris'd (2023).

2801.name: Meet Dave
2801.storyline: From Reggie Hammond in 48 Hrs. to Chris Carver in Candy Cane Lane, take a look back at the iconic career of Eddie Murphy.

2802.name: Diary of a Fleeting Affair
2802.storyline: (at around 12 mins) As Charlotte and Simon are visiting the Petit Palais Museum in Paris they pass by a Pierre Bonnard's painting. Vincent Macaigne is featured in Bonnard: Pierre & Marthe (2023), a biopic devoted to Pierre and Marthe Bonnard.

2803.name: Sissi
2803.storyline: Magda Schneider, playing Sissi's mother Ludovika in all three parts of the Sissi trilogy, is Romy Schneider's real life mother.

2804.name: Revanche
2804.storyline: The literal English translation of the title is 'revenge', but it also has another meaning of 'second chance'. If you play a game against someone and lose, you can ask for 'revanche', another game/chance to beat your opponent.

2805.name: A Cinderella Christmas
2805.storyline: Emma Rigby is known to the British television audience for her role in the soap opera Hollyoaks. Lesley-Anne Down is known to British television audiences for her role in the original Upstairs Downstairs.

2806.name: ...And God Created Woman
2806.storyline: This film is generally credited with making St. Tropez a fashionable resort.

2807.name: Lilies Not for Me
2807.storyline: Just witnessed the world premiere here in Edinburgh International Film Festival 2024. An unexpectedly beautiful film. I braced myself for tears but left with a smile. It's a heartbreaking exploration of the dark side of the queer history in 1910s and 1920s , exposing the horrors of conversion therapy and unethical medical experiments. Yet, it's also a stunningly tender portrayal of love, loss, and the complexities of human emotion. The 1920s setting is simply breathtaking; it evokes the same sense of longing and beauty as Call Me By Your Name. I applaud the film for balancing the harrowing depictions of queer history with heartwarming portrayals of love. A truly remarkable film. Kudos!

2808.name: Sightseers
2808.storyline: Tony Way (Crich Tourist) is seen eating a Cornetto. This movie was Executively Produced by Edgar Wright, who directed Shaun of the Dead (2004), Hot Fuzz (2007), and The World's End (2013), a.k.a. "the Cornetto trilogy".

2809.name: The Other Sister
2809.storyline: Juliette Lewis was just out of rehab when Marshall cast her. The insurance company for the film didn't want to insure her, so Marshall put up the money himself.

2810.name: Bobby Deerfield
2810.storyline: Sydney Pollack once said of actor Al Pacino's performance and characterization in this film that Al is "one of the few actors around who can play a seemingly passive, uninteresting man, and make it not boring to watch."

2811.name: Love, Guaranteed
2811.storyline: Susan's car is a Volkswagen Karmann Ghia circa 1972

2812.name: Journey to the West: Conquering the Demons
2812.storyline: This was the highest grossing film of 2013 in China, making 1.247 billion yuan.

2813.name: For Richer or Poorer
2813.storyline: The farmhouse used in the film was located in Westminster, Maryland and was torn down a few years after the movie.

2814.name: A Christmas Switch
2814.storyline: The GFAM channel is currently showing this movie "The Christmas Switch" as "The Christmas Swap," which is the title of a movie where two MEN swap at Christmas. So GFAM has made a boo boo!

2815.name: XX/XY
2815.storyline: A married couple that director Austin Chick knew were so affected by the emotional repercussions of their friend's film that they started divorce proceedings shortly after seeing it.

2816.name: All That Heaven Allows
2816.storyline: The façade later cannibalized to make up the front of the Bates home in Psycho (1960) is visible a few houses up from Cary Scott's (Jane Wyman's) block.

2817.name: The Persian Version
2817.storyline: Referenced in Amanda the Jedi Show: I Watched 45 Movies in 1 Week | 'Talk to Me' and the Best Movies of Sundance 2023 Explained (2023)

2818.name: Same Time, Next Year
2818.storyline: Ellen Burstyn won the Best Actress Academy Award for Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore (1974) while performing in the "Same Time, Next Year" play on Broadway. In the same year, she won the Tony Award for Best Actress for the play. Ironically, Burstyn received both awards at the same time in the same week. Burstyn is one of only two actresses to win both awards in the same year. The other actress was Audrey Hepburn who won a best Actress Tony for "Ondine" in the same year she won an Oscar for Roman Holiday (1953).

2819.name: Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham...
2819.storyline: When Hrithik Roshan watched Shah Rukh Khan and Amitabh Bachchan play the reconciliation scene he was so impressed and intimidated by the acting that he was unable to complete his own shot. He had to do it the next day after Amitabh had calmed him down and reassured him that everything would be fine.

2820.name: Duplicity
2820.storyline: Take a look back at Julia Roberts' movie career in photos.

2821.name: A Thin Line Between Love and Hate

2822.name: The Wizards Return: Alex vs. Alex
2822.storyline: Although the character of Justin Russo is heavily mentioned in this film, David Henrie is not featured in it due to scheduling conflicts with another movie (most likely the drama 1000 to 1: The Cory Weissman Story (2014)).

2823.name: A Christmas Number One
2823.storyline: Iwan Rheon, a songwriter as well as an actor, wrote the "Christmas number one" song with composer Guy Chambers.

2824.name: Grace of Monaco
2824.storyline: In January 2013, more than a year before the release of this movie, Grace Kelly's children Prince Albert, Princess Caroline, and Princess Stephanie of Monaco, issued a joint statement saying they had no association with the production. The family added that this movie contains major historical inaccuracies, and that Director Olivier Dahan ignored their requests for changes.

2825.name: Soapdish
2825.storyline: Extensive re-shoots on this film forced Kevin Kline to withdraw from Hook (1991). He was replaced by Robin Williams.

2826.name: Christmas on the Range
2826.storyline: Torry Martin, the movie's co-writer, makes an uncredited appearance as the Christmas ball's wild-haired DJ.

2827.name: The Phantom of the Opera at the Royal Albert Hall
2827.storyline: Colm Wilkinson, (one of four Phantoms performing encore) was in fact the first ever Phantom, who originated this role. It happened in 1985 at Sydmonton Festival - typical place of Andrew's Webber Lloyd previews of his musicals. Wilkinson might had been first Phantom on stage, but later that year, he had chosen to be first Jean Valjean in Les Miserables, another role played by Ramin Karimloo.

2828.name: Bedazzled
2828.storyline: Although Raquel Welch is featured in most of the promotional material for this movie, she is on-screen for only roughly seven minutes.

2830.name: Die in a Gunfight
2830.storyline: Despite his prominent billing with the rest of the cast in the film's trailer and poster, Billy Crudup only provides a voice-over narration.

2831.name: The Healer
2831.storyline: All profits for this film go to charity. Writer/Director Paco Arango is a philanthropist responsible for the famous charity organization Aladina, a children's cancer-care center in Spain.

2832.name: Open by Christmas
2832.storyline: The Best Buds Flower Shop is a nod to Brennan Elliott's Flower Shop Mysteries that he starred in. The boxes that Alison Sweeney carries have labels that are similar to the bakery shop in Murder, She Baked: A Chocolate Chip Cookie Mystery (2015) movies that she starred in.

2833.name: Foreign Correspondent
2833.storyline: Shooting was completed on May 29, 1940, after which Sir Alfred Hitchcock made a visit to England. He returned on July 3 with the word that the Germans were expected to start bombing at any time. Ben Hecht was hurriedly called in and wrote the tacked-on final scene set at a London radio station. It was filmed on July 5, and the real-life bombing started on July 10, 1940.

2834.name: Film Stars Don't Die in Liverpool
2834.storyline: The real Peter Turner, on whose memoir this movie was based, has a cameo as Jack, the stage manager who brings out chairs before Peter and Gloria perform Romeo & Juliet.

2835.name: Christmas at Holly Lodge
2835.storyline: Filmed in BC on Grouse Mountain.

2836.name: Signed, Sealed, Delivered for Christmas
2836.storyline: The Mr. Jordan character is loosely based on a 1941 movie figure, Mr. Jordan, who returns to earth after he dies.

2837.name: The Young Girls of Rochefort
2837.storyline: Danielle Darrieux is the only actor who actually sings for herself.

2838.name: David and Bathsheba
2838.storyline: Gregory Peck was a heavy drinker as a young actor in Hollywood. In 1949 he was hospitalized with heart spasms, and while filming David and Bathsheba (1951) he was hospitalized with a suspected heart attack. Though it turned out to be a palpitation brought on by his lifestyle and overwork, he began to drink less thereafter. However, he did not stop smoking for many more years.

2839.name: 42nd Street
2839.storyline: The film was so financially successful it saved Warner Brothers from bankruptcy.

2840.name: Our Souls at Night
2840.storyline: The fictional county of Holt, where the film and Kent Haruf's novel are set, is in Eastern Colorado. Holt is a composite of the three Colorado towns where the author grew up: Wray, Holyoke and Yuma. All of Haruf's novels take place in the fictional town of Holt.

2841.name: Moscow on the Hudson
2841.storyline: In preparation for his role, for about a year, lead actor Robin Williams studied Soviet customs and learned the Russian language. Reportedly, Williams spent five hours a day learning Russian and had learned to speak it well within a month. By the time of principal photography, Williams was at a proficiency level where he could carry out a conversation. Williams's teacher was a Russian actor called David.

2842.name: The Little Mermaid
2842.storyline: One of three live-action adaptations of "The Little Mermaid" in production in 2017.

2843.name: Good Morning Christmas!
2843.storyline: Alison Sweeney and Marc Blucas also portrayed love interests in an earlier Hallmark Channel movie, The Irresistible Blueberry Farm (2016).

2844.name: The Quiet American
2844.storyline: Director Phillip Noyce wanted Heath Ledger to play the role of Alden Pyle, but was happy with Brendan Fraser's work in this movie.

2845.name: I Am Curious (Yellow)
2845.storyline: On October 6, 1969, Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis was leaving a theater showing the film when she was confronted by paparazzi. She gave a photographer a judo flip in the confrontation.

2846.name: The Spanish Apartment
2846.storyline: The first instalment of a trilogy written and directed by Cédric Klapisch, which follows the journey of Xavier from student to family man. This is followed by "Les poupées russes", released in 2005, and completed with "Casse-tête chinois", released in 2013.

2847.name: Mrs. Miniver
2847.storyline: See the complete list of Best Picture winners. For fun, use the "sort order" function to rank by IMDb rating and other criteria.

2848.name: George and the Dragon
2848.storyline: The movie is loosely inspired by the Legend of St George and the Dragon, popular in British and European folklore.

2849.name: Love Switch
2849.storyline: Filmed in Utah, Provo and Lehi.

2850.name: Love, Romance, & Chocolate
2850.storyline: Brittany Bristow was in the Hallmark Original Movie Love Blossoms (2017), which was also set and shot in Bruges, Belgium.

2851.name: The Burning Plain
2851.storyline: In a 2008 interview, Charlize Theron said taking her clothes off in front of cameras in this and any other film is is as easy as drinking for her. "I don't really think about it much. I read the scene and if it makes sense I do it. I treat it the same way as I would any other scene. Whether it's a nude moment or sitting at a bar drinking, it's all choices. I don't think about it as nudity."

2852.name: Christmas in the Rockies
2852.storyline: The orange splint was on the supposedly broken leg upside down.

2853.name: The Beauty Inside
2853.storyline: All 123 Woo-Jin character appeared in this film.

2854.name: A Perfect Christmas
2854.storyline: The brief shot of the street, at around 30 mins, is actually footage of a town in New Jersey. It is Main Street in Phillipsburg, NJ, which has been used in several other movies.

2855.name: The Boy in the Plastic Bubble
2855.storyline: During filming, 22-year-old John Travolta and 40-year-old Diana Hyland began dating and eventually fell in love, despite the fact that Hyland was nearly 18 years older than Travolta. She was still in the process of getting divorced from her husband, writer and producer Joseph Goodson when she passed away on Sunday, March 27, 1977, four months after their TV movie's broadcast, and while Travolta was filming Saturday Night Fever (1977).

2856.name: Ashes
2856.storyline: In the movie, Türkiye and Turks are pictured as if they are Iranians, Araps or Afgans.Balat is a very nice part of the city. In Balat you can find very modern coffees, chef's restaurants, beautiful scenery of Halic. It is not a place where you can buy spices, it is not a spice bazaar. It is very disgusting to show places and people in a way where the truth is not reflected.The movie itself is also horrible. Characters are very superficial. A lonely rich woman, a rich and busy man, a wild and poor man. These are the prototypes and even a normal person can write such a text with these superficial characters. I wanted to rate it with a zero but it is not possible. Horrible.

2857.name: The Dog Days of Christmas
2857.storyline: Broadcasted in Canada as "The Dog Days of Christmas". Copyrighted 2021

2858.name: A Holiday in Harlem
2858.storyline: Toward the end of the movie, when Jazmin is telling her mom and Mama Belle about a job offer, a magnet with a blue square and two yellow bars can be seen among the Christmas cards on the refrigerator behind her. It appears to be the logo for the Human Rights Campaign.

2859.name: Eks
2859.storyline: OoPerformed by Blvck Flowers Ft. KritikoComposed by Louie Cristobal (as John Louie Cristobal)Published by TunecoreProduced by Kritiko and Jim DacanayMixed and mastered by Kritiko and Jim Dacanay

2860.name: Catch a Christmas Star
2860.storyline: Carmine (Christopher Jacot) makes a comment to Nikki (Shannon Elizabeth) concerning the movie Love Actually (2003). Shannon Elizabeth appeared in Love Actually as "Harriet--the Sexy One." The real name of her boyfriend in that movie was Kris Marshall.

2862.name: Norwegian Wood
2862.storyline: This is only Jonny Greenwood's second film score, following his acclaimed work on There Will Be Blood (2007). Greenwood was keen to score the film as he was a big fan of the novel. His involvement was in some doubt, however, as Thom Yorke wanted to return to the studios to record a new Radiohead album. Greenwood found the time to balance both projects.

2863.name: Intoxicated by Love
2863.storyline: The film reached the 4th place in the total sales of 2024's Iranian cinema, with 10.7 billion tomans in the first 2 days of release.

2864.name: Same Time, Next Christmas
2864.storyline: Lea Michelle sings the song played over the title sequence.

2865.name: Haseen Dillruba
2865.storyline: In the beginning of the movie Rani's aunt shows her photos of two prospects to be her groom, one is Rishu (Vikrant Massey), other photo is of director Vinil Mathew.

2866.name: Bed of Roses
2866.storyline: Michael Convertino's score for this film was composed for and recorded by two orchestras in different locations. Then the two separate pieces were mixed and overlaid with each other in the studio to create the final product.

2867.name: A Night in the Life of Jimmy Reardon
2867.storyline: River Phoenix was reportedly embarrassed by his role in this film, as it marketed him as a teen heartthrob. Phoenix wanted to be taken more seriously as an actor, not a celebrity.

2868.name: A Christmas Star
2868.storyline: Jingle BellsArranged by Adam Saunders & Mark CousinsCourtesy of APM Music

2869.name: How to Talk to Girls at Parties
2869.storyline: Elle Fanning and Alex Sharp both perform their own singing for the film.

2870.name: From the Terrace
2870.storyline: The third of ten feature films co-starring Paul Newman and Joanne Woodward. They also teamed for three TV movies and mini-series.

2871.name: Absence of Malice
2871.storyline: Paul Newman once said of this movie while publicizing The Verdict (1982): "I'd rather have the freedom to do the kind of pictures like The Verdict (1982) ... I enjoyed kicking the beejeezus out of the press in Absence of Malice (1981)."

2872.name: My King
2872.storyline: The movie is loosely inspired by writer-director Maïwenn's marriage to Jean-Yves Le Fur.

2873.name: Dil Bechara
2873.storyline: Experience the trailer for Dil Bechara with exclusive commentary from director Mukesh Chhabra.

2874.name: Falcon Lake
2874.storyline: Chloé: Tell me your biggest fear.Bastien: You first... .Chloé: I'll tell you.Bastien: You swear?Chloé: I swear... .Bastien: We do a countdown. 3, 2, 1. And we say our worst fear.Chloé: Come on.Bastien: But you really do, I'm not kidding. You say it?Chloé: Yes, I'll say it.Bastien: Are you ready?Chloé: Yes. One...Bastien: Three...Bastien, Chloé: [together] Three, two, one...Bastien: Jerking off in front of my parents.Chloé: No. No, that's not true!Bastien: Yes... .Chloé: Nonsense!Bastien: But would you like that? "Dad, mom, sorry."Chloé: No, but there are worse things than that.

2875.name: Love Potion No. 9
2875.storyline: Tate Donovan and Sandra Bullock dated from 1990-1994.

2876.name: Call of the Flesh
2876.storyline: Renée Adorée was cast at the insistence of her friend and frequent costar Ramon Novarro, who probably didn't know how ill she was with tuberculosis. She suffered two hemorrhages during production which almost shut the project down. After one setback, Novarro tried to convince production supervisor Hunt Stromberg to relieve her of her duties and re-shoot her material with another actress, offering to waive his salary, but Stromberg insisted, against doctor's orders, that it would be too expensive. After completing her last scene, Adorée had a second hemorrhage again and lost consciousness; she was rushed to a sanitarium in La Crescenta, California. Although Adorée survived two more years, her health effectively ended her chances at a continued career. Call of the Flesh (1930) was her last film.

2877.name: A Madea Christmas
2877.storyline: This movie takes place in a town called Bucktussle, Alabama. There isn't a Bucktussle, but there is a town called Bug Tussle that is within a decent proximity to Jasper, Alabama; the city where Sheldon Construction Company built the dam.

2878.name: Crazy Rich Asians 2
2878.storyline: Adele Lim, who co-wrote the Crazy Rich Asians (2018) screenplay, exited the project due to a dispute with the studio over a pay disparity. She was reportedly paid less money than her male co-writer Peter Chiarelli, even though she was the more experienced of the two. In the ensuing controversy, the studio offered Lim a pay raise, but she still declined to return.

2879.name: A Merry Christmas Match
2879.storyline: Aired as the first of sixteen original films in Hallmark Movies & Mysteries' 2019 "Miracles of Christmas" lineup.

2880.name: The Darwin Awards
2880.storyline: The segment with the rocket powered car features MythBusters (2003) host Jamie Hyneman and Adam Savage as the surplus salesman. The first episode of 'MythBusters' dealt with that particular urban legend.

2881.name: Bulworth
2881.storyline: Many objected against Warren Beatty hiring Composer Ennio Morricone to write the score for the film. One of the reasons was his hefty fee of about a million dollars and Beatty eventually won out over his producers. Despite all of this, Morricone only has a little more than ten minutes of his complete score featured in the final cut of the film which largely dominated by rap music and other source music. Morricone was not pleased with the end results of the film and what Beatty had done to his score.

2882.name: Welcome Home, Roscoe Jenkins
2882.storyline: According to Louis C.K. on the DVD commentary of Louie (2010), his part in this film was originally much larger, but his performance was so bad that most of his scenes were deleted.

2884.name: Together
2884.storyline: The movie was shot in only 10 days.

2885.name: Christmas by Chance
2885.storyline: You Make My ChristmasPerformed by Nicole LewisWritten by John Cirillo & Nicole LewisPublished by St. Cruz Music PublishingCourtesy of Song and Film LLC

2886.name: Stay the Night
2886.storyline: This movie is about an autistic woman, who struggles to connect with other human beings. Follow her over the course of one night as she meets a down-and-out hockey player and navigates her own romantic life.This movie has that simple premise and is almost entirely carried by the strength of its main characters Grace and Carter. Andrea Bang (from Kim's Convenience fame) and Joe Scarpallino give excellent performances and it's important, as this movie focuses entirely on their interactions/relationship. The acting was the standout piece and their on-screen chemistry and the solid, believable delivery are rarely seen in movies these days.Unfortunately, for these 2 actors, the plot does them no favors. In fact, there is no plot, other than Grace sabotaging herself and her romantic life for about an hour and a half. It's a shame, because the acting is enough to keep you engaged in the movie... until you ask why you are even watching in the first place. There was nothing interesting or exciting in the story and it's easy to lose interest.If you are looking for a character-driven drama or are the sort of person who needs good characters in a movie, this film is for you. If you need anything more, it's hard to find it in "Stay the Night" and you may find yourself bored by the half-hour mark.

2887.name: Jingle Around the Clock
2887.storyline: Elle and Max (played by Brooke Nevin and Michael Cassidy) mention a fictional famous cooking-show host named "Julia Wise" (Teryl Rothery), a character introduced in another 2018 Hallmark Christmas movie, Road to Christmas (2018).

2888.name: Om Shanti Om
2888.storyline: It was director Farah Khan's desire to bring Sanjay Dutt, Shah Rukh Khan, Aamir Khan, Salman Khan and Saif Ali Khan together onscreen for the first time ever. However, Aamir Khan refused to make a cameo appearance.

2889.name: A Christmas Wish in Hudson
2889.storyline: When Lori and Patrick are sitting in the park on the bench Lori's hand keeps jumping from the back of the bench to her lap from scene to scene.

2890.name: Nude Tuesday
2890.storyline: The language spoken (Zobftanlik) was created specifically for the film by Wellington actor and voice coach Perry Piercy. The subtitles were written by different non-New Zealand actors and comedians. These subtitles vary depending on the country the movie was released in.

2891.name: Nostalgic Christmas
2891.storyline: The wooden Santas in the movie were carved by Nova Scotia, Canadian Elizabeth Brown who is a full time woodcarver. She has a real wood shop where she carves and paints those Santas as well as many other styles of art and sculpture. Unlike Anne in the movie, Elizabeth actually taught her dad to carve wood some 17 years ago. She's been carving since 1993.

2892.name: Dil To Pagal Hai
2892.storyline: October 30, 2022, marks 25 years since the release of this genre-defining love story.

2893.name: The Sentiment of the Flesh
2893.storyline: Last film directed (as of 2023) by Roberto Garzelli.

2894.name: Masquerade
2894.storyline: The film's original title was "Dying for Love," but the studio was concerned that the public would associate the title with AIDS, and thus it was dropped.

2895.name: High Strung
2895.storyline: All the subway scenes are filmed in Bucharest where the old trains run filled with graffiti except the windows.

2896.name: Christmas with a Prince: The Royal Baby

2897.name: Man of the Year
2897.storyline: Christopher Walken's character describes having worked with elephants in the circus when he was a kid. The summer he was 16 years old, Christopher Walken had a job as part of the lion-taming act of a traveling circus.

2898.name: The Thief of Bagdad
2898.storyline: Filming began in Britain, but because of the Blitz - the German air raids on London - the production relocated to Hollywood. There was such a long break in production that Sabu's early scenes had to be reshot because he had grown several inches.

2899.name: Robin and Marian
2899.storyline: This movie could not be shot in England, because some of the major principals were tax exiles.

2900.name: Hrashwo Deergha
2900.storyline: 1. Story: Wait, What Story?The movie starts nowhere and ends nowhere.Characters are confused about their own purpose.By the time the climax arrives, you won't even care anymore.2. Acting: Painful to WatchThe lead actor shows two emotions: sleepy and lost.The supporting actors look like they didn't want to be there either.Dialogues are so unnatural, even AI could do better.3. Cinematography: Feels Like a Home VideoRandom camera angles that make no sense.Shaky shots gave me a headache.4. Music: Please Make It StopSongs that make your neighbor's wedding music sound good.Lyrics so meaningless, you'd prefer silence.Background score? More like background noise.5. Length: Never-Ending TortureEvery scene feels 10 minutes longer than it needs to be.Even the clock in the theater gave up ticking.6. Special Effects: Straight from the 90sExplosions look like someone threw red powder in the air.7. Audience Reaction: Regret EverywhereThose who watched full either fell asleep or were scrolling TikTok.8. Final Verdict:Watching Raswa Dirgha is like sitting in traffic for 3 hours-frustrating, boring, and a complete waste of time.If you love yourself, don't watch this movie. Even staring at the ceiling is a better use of your day.Recommendation: Avoid. Even if someone offers free tickets, run in the opposite direction!

2901.name: The Consequences of Love
2901.storyline: The book the girl at the table reads is Louis-Ferdinand Céline's "Voyage au bout de la Nuit" (1932).

2902.name: A Holiday for Love
2902.storyline: Home Hardware is a major Canadian retail chain. They are not in the US. Yet their plainly labeled storefront is clearly visible on the main street of "Athens Nebraska."

2903.name: Elisa & Marcela
2903.storyline: Isabel Coixet revealed on an interview that one of the reasons she decided to shoot in black and white was that the budget of the movie wasn't very large, so a B/W look helps selling to the audience the period setting and wardrobe.

2904.name: Raaz 3
2904.storyline: Bipasha had earlier stated she didn't want to work with Emraan because of their height difference but worked together in this film.

2905.name: 8 Women
2905.storyline: When Louise shows a photo of her former employer, it is a picture of Romy Schneider.

2906.name: To Hell and Back
2906.storyline: A total of 50,000 rounds of ammunition, 300 pounds of TNT, 600 pounds of blasting powder and ten cases of 40% dynamite were required for the filming of the battle scenes.

2907.name: The Christmas Chocolatier
2907.storyline: As per the closing credits, this movie was shot in Vienna, Austria. It is also known as "My Sweet Austrian Holiday" with some of the dialogue change from the 'Austrian' edition to be more Canadian (.i.e. whenever the lead actress and actor mention Austria and Vienna in the first version, they say Ottawa or Quebec instead in the second version)

2908.name: You, Me and Dupree
2908.storyline: Donald Fagen and Walter Becker, of the popular 70's band "Steely Dan", addressed a humorous letter to Owen Wilson's brother, Luke, on their blog with claims that the idea of "You, Me and Dupree" was stolen from their song, "Cousin Dupree". (Lyrics to "Cousin Dupree" can also be found on their website.) Only the name Dupree, and the possibility that Cousin Dupree and that Wilson's character Dupree both may have slept on a couch seem to be the only common links in their claims. Owen Wilson replied to this fact saying "I have never heard the song 'Cousin Dupree' and I don't even know who this gentleman, Mr. Steely Dan, is. I hope this helps to clear things up and I can get back to concentrating on my new movie, "HEY 19" (which is the title of a Steely Dan song).

2909.name: Beauty and the Beast
2909.storyline: The effect of the candles lighting themselves as the merchant passes them was achieved by blowing them out and then running the film in reverse as he walked backward past them. The entire sequence was done in one long take and reversed - a quick glimpse of the fireplace shows the flames appearing to move downward.

2910.name: Dracula Has Risen from the Grave
2910.storyline: This was Hammer Films' most profitable movie.

2911.name: Fred: The Movie
2911.storyline: Miranda Cosgrove was offered the role of Judy but turned it down due to scheduling conflicts.

2913.name: Blue Sky
2913.storyline: The film was completed in 1991, but was shelved and not released theatrically until three years later. This was due to studio production house Orion Pictures' bankruptcy.

2914.name: Expensive Candy
2914.storyline: Sa panaginip langPerformed by AlamatComposed by Sean CedroPublished by Viva Music Publishing, Inc.Produced by Jason Paul LaxamanaArranged by Paulo ProtacioMixed and mastered by Japs MendozaVocal arrangement by Zebedee ZunigaRecorded by Ponz MartinezCourtesy of Viva Records Corporation

2915.name: Darker Shades of Summer
2915.storyline: Summer: 'While having sex standing next to a window, she answers her husband on her cell phone' Hi.Dylan: Hi love, I'm gonna be an hour late, this evening really fucked me today.Summer: There I have a couple of hour too, it's okay.Dylan: I'll try not to be too loong, bye!Summer: hangs up the phone and continues moaning with pleasure'. Yeahh.

2917.name: Finding Your Feet
2917.storyline: Celia Imrie was filming during the day and appearing in "King Lear" with Glenda Jackson at The Old Vic at night. A fast car would take her across London to The Old Vic at the end of each day's filming.

2918.name: In a Better World
2918.storyline: The Danish title 'Hævnen' translates into English as 'Revenge'. Susanne Bier mentioned that she prefers the English title 'In a Better World' which emphasizes the hopefulness of the film while the Danish title emphasizes the severeness of the film (at 1:52:49 in the Blu-ray director's commentary).

2919.name: Excess Baggage
2919.storyline: Was delayed from a planned Christmas 1996 release due to troublesome test screenings. This led to several reshoots, which expanded on the relationship between Alicia Silverstone and Benicio Del Toro's characters.

2920.name: Herzklopfen
2920.storyline: Julia Stemberger was 19 years old at the time of filming.

2921.name: Sullivan's Travels
2921.storyline: Cinematographer John Seitz admired Preston Sturges' unconventional approach to his work. The opening scene comprised ten pages of dialogue to cover about four and a half minutes of screen time. It was scheduled for two complete days of shooting. On the morning of the first day, Seitz found Sturges inspecting the set with a viewfinder, looking for where he could cut the scene and change camera set-ups. Seitz dared him to do it all in one take. Never one to refuse a dare, Sturges took him up on it, although the nervous Seitz had never attempted to complete a two-day work schedule in one day. With the endorsement of McCrea and the rest of the actors, Sturges pressed on, determined to set a record. The first take was fine, but the camera wobbled a little in the tracking shot following the men from screening room to office, so they tried again. They did two or three takes at the most and that was it - two full days work by 11 a.m. on the first day, a feat that had the entire studio buzzing.

2922.name: Deep End
2922.storyline: David Lynch once claimed, "There's never been a color movie I've freaked out over except one, this thing called Deep End."

2923.name: The Private Lives of Pippa Lee
2923.storyline: Julianne Moore only spent two days filming her role.

2924.name: How Much Do You Love Me?
2924.storyline: Bertrand Blier: first customer of the prostitute who wants to go to Seychelles (Muguet).

2925.name: No Sleep 'Til Christmas
2925.storyline: The main characters (Lizzie and Billy) are married to each other in real life.

2926.name: Royal New Year's Eve
2926.storyline: Jessy Schram played Cinderella in the ABC television show Once Upon a Time (2011).

2927.name: The Taming of The Shrew
2927.storyline: In his memoirs, writer and director Franco Zeffirelli said that making this movie was the most fun he had in his entire career.

2928.name: Christmas Bedtime Stories
2928.storyline: Scott Fee and Yvonne Schalle are a real life television newscaster and meteorologist respectively as they portray in the movie.

2929.name: No Small Affair
2929.storyline: The film was originally to star Sally Field and Matthew Broderick in 1981, but production shut down after director Martin Ritt had a heart attack.

2930.name: Snow Bride
2930.storyline: Keith Andreen, the actor portraying Doria's husband, is lead actress Katrina Law's real-life husband. At the time of filming, they had only been married for a few months.

2931.name: Once Upon a Christmas Wish
2931.storyline: Mario Lopez (Brian) and Courtney Lopez (Nina Myers) have been married since December 1, 2012. Mario Lopez and Courtney Lopez (née Mazza) first met on Broadway in 2008, and their off-stage romance has been going strong ever since. They have three children.

2932.name: Porthole
2932.storyline: The director was so ashamed that he used the Directors Guild-approved nom de plume Alan Smithee.

2933.name: First Girl I Loved
2933.storyline: The film premiered at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival and won the Audience Award for "Best of NEXT".

2934.name: The Last Mistress
2934.storyline: Catherine Breillat discovered Fu'ad Aït Aattou in a Paris café.

2935.name: Tallulah
2935.storyline: Sian Heder got the idea for the film when she was working as a nanny when she first moved to L.A.

2936.name: Spetters
2936.storyline: Spetters was heavily criticized in the Netherlands. Many critics accused the movie of being anti-women, anti-gay, anti-invalid, and anti-Christian. They also called it devoid of morals and needlessly decadent. This criticism was one of the contributing factors in director Paul Verhoeven's decision to begin making movies in America rather than his native land. In fact, on the movie's commentary track, Verhoeven has stated that the reason he was not fazed by the negative criticism of Showgirls (1995) was because he'd already been through it with Spetters (1980). He also pointed out that he also moved to America because it grew difficult to get funding. "All Dutch movies were fifty to sixty percent subsidized by the government. I was denied government funding because my movies were considered to be decadent, perverted, and antigovernment. That's when I had to leave. The problem was the leftists -- they are so fucking dogmatic. At that time in Holland, they were often more fascistic than the right."

2937.name: Priceless
2937.storyline: The movie's title in French is "Hors de prix" which means "overpriced, outrageously expensive" or "out of one's leagues, something one cannot afford or reach" rather that "priceless" (a priceless object would be one for which its value cannot be determined).

2938.name: Eva
2938.storyline: DungawPerformed by Franky OcampoComposed by Adie Garcia (as Adie)Publisher: OC Music Publishing, Inc.Producer: Adie Garcia (as Adie)Arranger: Franz SacroProduction House: Home RecordingPre-mixed: Adie Garcia (as Adie)Mixing and mastering: Hazel Pascua

2939.name: Finding Santa
2939.storyline: Aired as the tenth of twenty-one original films in The Hallmark Channel's 2017 "Countdown to Christmas" lineup.

2940.name: Mansfield Park
2940.storyline: Julia Joyce has played the younger character of two of Billie Piper roles. Here in "Mansfield Park" and also in the "Doctor Who" episode "Father's Day."

2941.name: The Sailor Who Fell from Grace with the Sea
2941.storyline: First English language filmed adaptation of a novel by Japanese writer Yukio Mishima.

2942.name: Zoey 102
2942.storyline: Austin Butler (James) revealed that he wasn't asked to return. He said, "I haven't heard anything about that. I don't know. I'm so grateful for all those stepping stones that I had throughout my career. Zoey 101 (2005) was a big turning point for me, because it was the first time I was ever a series regular on a show, so I got to be part of an entire season. I remember getting my first line on a TV show, and that was huge for me, you have all these different moments that are pivotal for you, but now I'm just going after whatever story resonates with me or whatever director or actors that I really want to work with."

2943.name: This Property Is Condemned
2943.storyline: Tennessee Williams was so dismayed by the film made from his play he threatened to have his name taken off the credits.

2944.name: A Greek Recipe for Romance
2944.storyline: While filming on Syros, there was an International Dance and Performing Arts festival held on the streets. Rather than shoot the scheduled scene, the crew walked to the center of town and improvised a scene where Abby and Theo watch the dancing. They changed into the correct wardrobe just in time to get off a few shots before sunset.

2945.name: Children of a Lesser God
2945.storyline: The first film directed by a woman (Randa Haines) to be Oscar nominated for the Academy Award for Best Picture.

2946.name: The Red Violin
2946.storyline: Christoph Koncz (as Kaspar Weiss the orphan virtuoso) was only nine years old when featured in this movie. He is an Austrian-Hungarian classical musician that became an internationally-renowned violinist and conductor.

2947.name: Cassandra's Dream
2947.storyline: Knowing the famous audition process of Woody Allen, in which an actor enters the room, is looked over by Allen and seconds later leaves the room, Colin Farrell entered his office, stood up, turned around and said, "That's it, right?" When Allen smiled and said yes, Farrell left the office.

2948.name: The Perfect Date
2948.storyline: Noah Centineo and Laura Marano also played love interests on Austin & Ally (2011).

2949.name: Hanukkah on Rye
2949.storyline: The movie makes several references to "Fiddler on the Roof," which was written by Joseph Stein, Jerry Bock, and Sheldon Harnick. Bock and Harnick also wrote "She Loves Me" with Joe Masteroff. "She Loves Me" is based on Miklós László's 1937 play "Parfumerie," the original source material for "Hanukkah on Rye" and three other movies.

2950.name: The Librarian: Return to King Solomon's Mines
2950.storyline: Jonathan Frakes: Appears (briefly) as the ex-con husband on the "Honeymoon Bus".

2951.name: The History Boys
2951.storyline: The cast for this movie are the same cast who appeared in the original play at the National Theatre in London, England.

2952.name: Christmas in Angel Falls
2952.storyline: Filmed in North Bay, Ontario Canada in September 2017. The church used for interiors and exteriors was St. Andrew's United Church in the same city.

2953.name: Happy Howlidays
2953.storyline: Get your fill of happily-ever-afters with this year's lineup of holiday-themed romantic movies to watch from the comfort of home.

2954.name: Dracula 3D
2954.storyline: The first time Van Helsing (a Dutchman in the novel) has actually been played by someone from The Netherlands.

2955.name: Heavenly Bodies
2955.storyline: Debut theatrical feature film directed by Lawrence Dane. The picture remains his first, final an only ever cinema movie as director.

2956.name: The Opposite of Sex
2956.storyline: The cabin in Ontario, Big Bear Lake is the same filming location as Dr. Falken's house in WarGames (1983).

2957.name: Magic Stocking
2957.storyline: Imogen Tear, who played Hannah Monroe, were given the puppy as a gift at the completion of the film production. The puppy kept his name, Magic, which is the same name as the character name. It is the puppy that Hannah originally wanted when her mother first said no and eventually received him toward the end of the movie.

2958.name: Christmas with Holly
2958.storyline: The coffee house that Sean Faris' character owns, "T.A.N. Coffee", is an actual café in Nova Scotia which operates by the same name.

2959.name: The Razor's Edge
2959.storyline: Bill Murray made a deal with Columbia Pictures that he would appear in Ghostbusters (1984) only if they financed this movie. Originally, no studio was interested in making the film until Dan Aykroyd suggested the deal to Murray. On the final day of shooting, Murray flew to New York City to start filming Ghostbusters.

2960.name: Hero
2960.storyline: Chevy Chase (Deke - Channel 4 News Director) could not be credited because he was under contract with Warner Brothers at the time. Columbia Pictures was allowed to hire Chase as long as he would go uncredited so he would not violate his contract.

2961.name: I Walked with a Zombie
2961.storyline: Edith Barrett, who played the mother, was only 3 years older than James Ellison, who played her younger son, Wesley. She was 2 years younger than Tom Conway, who played her older son, Paul.

2962.name: Last Call for Istanbul
2962.storyline: I feel like people are disappointed by the movie because they expected a basic Turkish movie where there's extra drama and love, the movie tells a kind of a realistic story that people fall in love and lose their way sometimes but they find their way back to each other.
