3814.storyline: Vicky Kaushal and Sara Ali Khan's first film together.

3815.name: Superman II: The Richard Donner Cut
3815.storyline: (at around 16 mins) The actor playing Clark Kent yelling out to Lois Lane after she jumps out of the Daily Planet is not Christopher Reeve. An uncredited actor was brought in to film the shot for the DVD release.

3816.name: The Fortune Cookie
3816.storyline: Production was halted for weeks after Walter Matthau had a heart attack. He had slimmed from 190 to 160 pounds by the time filming was completed and wore a heavy black coat to conceal the weight loss.

3817.name: The Marrying Man
3817.storyline: According to Premiere Magazine, Kim Basinger and Alec Baldwin, who moved in together during the filming, made life miserable for the crew with their demands and their attitude.First and foremost, there were Alec Baldwin's violent temper tantrums in which he threw a chair, smashed camera lenses, punched a wall and ripped a cellular phone from a Disney executive's hand. Things had already gotten off on the wrong foot when Disney Chairman Jeffrey Katzenberg when first meeting Baldwin reportedly joked "We could get a gate guard to do the same job as you." Baldwin naturally, didn't take kindly to the joke.As for Basinger, she was accused of habitual lateness (she kept production waiting on the set due to her elaborate morning routine, which included washing her hair with only Evian water and shampoo), flashing the crew, talking filthy on open walkie-talkies, refusing to shoot in sunlight, and demanding that no one look at her. Stories also included Basinger's feud with Simon over her dialogue (Basinger at one point told Neil Simon, "This isn't funny. Whoever wrote this doesn't understand comedy." Simon denied the incident. But he only visited the set one more time during filming) and a prima-donna attitude that ultimately resulted in the firing of the original director of photography because she didn't like how she looked in the test shots that he had taken. One person from the set claimed that at one point, Basinger pushed the director, Jerry Rees aside and tried to direct a musical number herself. Basinger also wouldn't settle for having her makeup touched up between close-up shots. Instead, she had to have her makeup completely removed and re-applied between takes, something that made filming take about 20x longer than it should have. In other words, retakes would take hours instead of minutes. Not only that, but Basinger wanted to shut down production so she could fly to Brazil to consult a psychic.It was also on the set that Basinger and Baldwin began a hot, steamy on-set romance. Allegedly, the crew miked the trailers to record them having sex and they then played them back so that Basinger and Baldwin could hear. One crew-member commented, "Honest to God, if I were destitute and living on the street with no food and somebody offered me a million dollars to work with Alec and Kim, I'd pass. Their actions were vile, deplorable, despicable."

3818.name: Paris Can Wait
3818.storyline: Diane Lane's real life daughter Eleanor Lambert plays her daughter in the film.

3819.name: If These Walls Could Talk 2
3819.storyline: Natasha Lyonne and Michelle Williams appeared in But I'm a Cheerleader (1999).

3820.name: Pardes
3820.storyline: The lead role of 'Ganga' was exclusively written for 'Madhuri Dixit'but madhuri had some issues with Subhash Ghai during filming of 'Khalnayak' so opted out of the movie.

3821.name: Lake Consequence
3821.storyline: May Karasun's first role and first nude scenes. She would film two more movies and appear nude in all of them.

3822.name: Houseboat
3822.storyline: Cary Grant was 54 when he made this film. His romantic lead, Sophia Loren, was 24.

3823.name: Mektoub, My Love: Intermezzo
3823.storyline: After being received with mixed to bad reviews, the movie hasn't been shown outside the 2019 Cannes Film Festival. Abdellatif Kechiche is supposedly working on a new Cut, but Pathé, the French distributor, hasn't set a release date yet. On Twitter, fans have created the hashtag #ReleaseTheKechicheCut, hoping to see the film's unedited version, similar to the famous hashtag #ReleaseTheSnyderCut which erupted after the troubled release of the Hollywood film Justice League (2017).

3824.name: To Our Loves
3824.storyline: In the original script, the father was due to die and was not scheduled to return at the time of the dinner scene. Maurice Pialat walked into the scene and left the actors to improvise in a situation they hadn't planned for.

3825.name: Sugarplummed
3825.storyline: Get your fill of happily-ever-afters with this year's lineup of holiday-themed romantic movies to watch from the comfort of home.

3826.name: A Woman Is a Woman
3826.storyline: Jean-Luc Godard's first film in color.

3827.name: Femalien 2
3827.storyline: Bethany Lorraine's first erotic film. She told Femme Fatales magazine that it was her agent's suggestion. She was doing a lot of modeling and commercial work before this. She said she was fine performing the required nudity, but the sex scene, which was her first, was difficult, especially since she and the male actor were stark naked in freezing water. Then the actor asked her out on a date, which she thought was creepy. This ended up being her last role after only two films.

3828.name: Christmas in the Air
3828.storyline: Aired as the second original film in Hallmark Movies & Mysteries' 2017 "12 Most Wonderful Movies of Christmas" lineup (which actually contained 14 original films).

3829.name: Holly's Holiday
3829.storyline:
Shown in the UK with the title "A Perfect Christmas"
 November 2015

3830.name: Berlin, I Love You
3830.storyline: The famous Chinese artist and political dissident Ai Weiwei - who currently lives and works in Berlin - shot a much anticipated episode for this movie, that was cut from the final version. He explained in an interview, that this happened because of hidden economic pressure from China: "The film has faced tremendous difficulties with regard to financing and distribution. During the promotion and sale of the film, the producer told us he had never faced such strong pushback on any previous film he had made than as he had from my participation in this film. People clearly told him that my involvement would be a problem for them to get financial support or distribution. It could even cause problems for future films, such as the next planned film, [error]. This comes as no surprise; China's influence in the cultural realm is beyond my imagination." (Screendaily, March 2019)

3831.name: Dear Zindagi
3831.storyline: The movie as we know has largely been shot in Goa, however, the last two days of the shooting schedule were fixed for Singapore. Unfortunately, rain played a spoilsport on the first day because of which the crew had lost more than half of their day. To compensate for the lost time, the crew shot for 24 hours the last day for they had their flights to catch on the next day.

3832.name: Cooley High
3832.storyline: According to Garrett Morris, the producers did not want to cast him in the role of Mr. Mason because they felt that he looked too young. Morris was a real-life schoolteacher at the time. Director Michael Schultz insisted that Morris was right for the role.

3833.name: Comes a Horseman
3833.storyline: Stuntman Jim Sheppard was killed when a horse that was dragging him veered from its course and caused him to hit his head on a fence post. The scene appears in the movie, although it was cut right before Sheppard's fatal accident.

3834.name: Baadshah
3834.storyline: While shooting the opening scene of the film in a club director Abbas Mastan noticed that joyful Jhonny Lever was very depressed on the whole day of the shoot.After the pack up.They went and asked what was the problem he told that his father was had a major operation today and he was nervous all day because of that.Abbas Mastan told him that they could have canceled the shoot if had reported them earlier.Jhonny Lever told them he knew they would cancel the shoot if he had told them but he didn't want to affect the film's schedule.

3835.name: Christmas in Love
3835.storyline: The film received a 500,000 Canadian dollar subsidy from the Government of Ontario.

3836.name: Serve the People
3836.storyline: The most successful part is the setting of time and place. Under the high-pressure military management system, a love that seems to exist can be born, and the it can last more than ten years. What was going on?The greatest thing is political satire, especially the oath of the so-called chairman, medals, honors, etc., even if you are beheaded thousands of times, you choose to love passionately.The most breakthrough is the bold sex scene. Although the feeling of falling in love is a little weak, it can be regarded as unconventional in that era. There is nothing more combative than the union of a man and a woman.I hope there will be a killing ending, like the movie "Natural Born Killers", a violent response to the distorted society, but the ending is still a little sad. This is the sadness of thought and the sadness of human weakness. I don't like this compromise ending.

3837.name: Casa Grande
3837.storyline: Actor Bruno Souza Leão was considered for the role

3838.name: Baby Steps
3838.storyline: "Baby Steps" is the sequel to the indie movie "Say Yes"

3839.name: Lore
3839.storyline: Despite spending time living in Berlin and directing the movie where the actors performed completely in German, director Cate Shortland doesn't speak the language.

3840.name: Best Friends
3840.storyline: Burt Reynolds once said of his co-star Goldie Hawn in this movie: "Goldie Hawn and I had been talking for five years about doing a movie together. She's someone who makes me laugh. Really laugh. I knew her when she was a dumb blonde and even then she was one of the smartest people I knew" and "We'd meet for dinner and compare notes on the scripts we'd read and liked, but we always ran up against the same problem. The male role always dominated the female character or vice versa. They didn't seem to be writing the kind of give-and-take comedies that Tracy and Hepburn [Spencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn] or Cary Grant and Jean Arthur used to do."

3841.name: Jezebel
3841.storyline: Following a quarrel with William Wyler, Bette Davis embarked on an affair with Henry Fonda that greatly increased tensions on the set. After a phone call from Fonda's pregnant wife, she called things off.

3843.name: Flesh and Bone
3843.storyline: Meg Ryan and Dennis Quaid were married at the time the movie was made. They tied the knot in 1991, but divorced in 2001.

3844.name: Happiness
3844.storyline: François' wife and children are played by Jean-Claude Drouot's real family in their only film appearances.

3845.name: Bloodline
3845.storyline: The part of Elizabeth Roffe was turned down by Candice Bergen, Jacqueline Bisset and Diane Keaton before Audrey Hepburn accepted, and the character's age was changed from 23 to 35.

3846.name: Despite the Falling Snow
3846.storyline: The story of this movie is the book "Before Snow Falls" written by Leyla in "I Can't Think Straight".

3847.name: Well Done!
3847.storyline: Mr Blake is obviously a very intelligent man, and fond of playing chess. However the improper backwards set up of the chess board is obvious. Unfortunately the chess board was incorrectly set up, so that the bottom-right square is black.Unfortunately as a consequence, the black queen and king plus the white queen and king are all on the wrong starting squares. No one ever plays the game of chess with the bottom-right square as black, because then all the kings and queens would then be incorrectly placed on the wrong color starting squares. How to set up the pieces on a chess board: First set up the board so that the bottom-right square is white . . . Place a rook on each of your two corners . . . Place the knights next to the rooks . . . Place the bishops to the inside of the knights . . . Place the queen on the remaining, matching-color square . . .

3848.name: Out of Season
3848.storyline: The Marine Hotel, where much of the film takes place, was the real-life Beach Inn within the village of Chiswell on Portland. The Beach Inn is now Beach House, a bed and breakfast.

3849.name: Girl Happy
3849.storyline: Shelley Fabares is the only woman who was Elvis Presley's love interest in three different films.

3850.name: Picnic
3850.storyline: William Holden almost turned down the film because he thought he was too old at 37 to play Hal Carter. Audiences agreed that he was much too old to play a character in his twenties.

3851.name: Tomorrow Is Another Day
3851.storyline: According to studio publicity materials for this picture, Steve Cochran broke his leg shooting a fight scene with Hugh Sanders during the first week of filming. After a short hospital stay, he wore a cast for two weeks during this production.

3852.name: Shortcomings
3852.storyline: Has four of the same cast members as Joy Ride (2023), which was released the same year. Both films star Sherry Cola, Stephanie Hsu, Ronny Chieng and Timothy Simons.

3853.name: Date with an Angel
3853.storyline: This movie made less than two million dollars, on an eight million dollars budget.

3854.name: Read It and Weep
3854.storyline: Kay Panabaker (Jamie Bartlett) and Danielle Panabaker (Is) are sisters in real life.

3855.name: Where Hands Touch
3855.storyline: Epilogue accompanying photographs from World War II: "Approximately 25,000 Black Germans existed under the Third Reich, including Rhineland children. Some perished in the camp system and others survived to be liberated in 1945. Together with those teens who escaped sterilisation, the survivors defied Hitler's vision of a future Germany without Black Germans."

3856.name: Noel Next Door
3856.storyline: Adrian Falconer, who portrays the complex manager Luis, also portrayed a character named Luis in My Heart Was Stolen (2002) of Kisarazu Cat's Eye (2002).

3857.name: A Christmas Romance
3857.storyline: The younger daughter is seen, and heard, reading from an old (British?) children's book with a title that is partly "Blackie's ...", a popular publishing company in the 1930s and later specializing in children's anthologies. It may be from this old book (her father's family lived in the remote cottage for generations) that the younger daughter has learned about the Legend of the Christmas Stranger, and, when the young man comes around to collect the overdue mortgage payments, she is convinced he is their Christmas Stranger. However, the actual legend is never explained, and the traditional Legend is about a child who arrives at a house, cold and hungry, and is given warm hospitality, and eventually is revealed to be the Christ Child. The debt-collector is, more or less given a warm welcome, but is not the Christ Child, of course.

3858.name: The Wedding Veil Expectations
3858.storyline: When Peter tells Avery that they should retrofit the house for earthquakes, Avery responds, "we never have earthquakes here," the "here" being Boston. The movie is actually filmed in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada, which indeed is in an earthquake zone.

3859.name: Pennies from Heaven
3859.storyline: Christopher Walken's bar-top dance scene took two months of rehearsal and two days of shooting. He claims he got compliments later from fans Fred Astaire and Gene Kelly.

3860.name: Bubble
3860.storyline: Uta means "to sing a song" in Japanese.

3862.name: Little Black Book
3862.storyline: Feature film debuts of Dave Annable, Yvette Nicole Brown, and singer Gavin Rossdale.

3863.name: If You Were the Last
3863.storyline: The United States flag patches on the orange jumpsuits' upper backs are facing the wrong way, with the starfield on the upper right. US flag display rules would place the starfield on the upper left corner of a flag on the back of a uniform.

3864.name: Joy of Sex
3864.storyline: John Belushi was offered a role in this film numerous times, but he originally turned it down. He eventually accepted the role, but died shortly afterwards. The producers were excited of having him on the poster wearing a diaper, even though no such scene appeared in the script. This was in the period Penny Marshall was supposed to direct based on a screenplay by John Hughes.

3865.name: Romance in Style
3865.storyline: Romance in Style is Jaicy Elliot's television film debut.

3866.name: And Then We Danced
3866.storyline: Levan Akin found Levan Gelbakhiani on Instagram.

3867.name: A Harvest Homecoming
3867.storyline: Trevor Donovan sings in this move, but Jessica Lowndes does not.

3868.name: Sadak
3868.storyline: An unofficial remake of famous Hollywood flick Taxi driver (1975).

3869.name: BUtterfield 8
3869.storyline: Dame Elizabeth Taylor and her husband, Mike Todd, had planned for Cat on a Hot Tin Roof (1958) to be her final movie, as she intended to retire from the screen. Todd had made a verbal agreement about this with MGM, but after his death, MGM forced Taylor to make this movie in order to fulfill the terms of her studio contract. As a result, Taylor refused to speak to director Daniel Mann for the entire production and hated this movie.

3870.name: In Love and War
3870.storyline: Sandra Bullock researched her role of Agnes Von Kurowsky by reading her dairies that she kept during the war and reading the love letters between her and Ernest Hemingway.

3871.name: Agent Cody Banks 2: Destination London
3871.storyline: Frankie Muniz underwent two months of martial arts training before filming began.

3872.name: The Incredibly True Adventure of Two Girls in Love
3872.storyline: When Evie's three friends are driving to the hotel near the end of the movie, the book that one of them is reading aloud from is "Rubyfruit Jungle", a lesbian novel by Rita Mae Brown.

3873.name: Christmas Joy
3873.storyline: Filmed in Maple Ridge, British Columbia, Canada.

3874.name: Pedro Paramo
3874.storyline: John Gavin's favorite of his films.

3875.name: Art of Love
3875.storyline: Don't You Wanna Be Minewritten by Mert Oktanperformed by Gulnur Gokçe and Cem Kahraman

3876.name: Deck the Halls
3876.storyline: Based on a novel by the same name, written by Mary Higgins Clark and her daughter, Carol Higgins Clark.

3877.name: Control
3877.storyline: The stunt work at the end of the "railrun" between Bulcsú and Gonzó, when the underground almost hits Gonzó is real, and no special effects were used.

3878.name: Miranda
3878.storyline: First cinema film directed by Marc Munden.

3879.name: City of Trees
3879.storyline: I would have changed the ending but I'm not sure how. The director made this movie. It developed at exactly the right pace from beginning to end. I don't know who Alexandra Swarens is but she's good. The movie held my undivided attention from the beginning to end. Thank you Prime. You did well with this one. I hope the director has more movies to spring on us.

3880.name: The Lost Valentine
3880.storyline: The novel this movie is based upon was originally published in 1998 as "The Last Valentine", but when it was re-published in 2011 after the success of the movie the title was changed to "The Lost Valentine". According to author James Michael Pratt's website, the story was inspired by true events.

3881.name: The Edukators
3881.storyline: The song "Where's The Real Sky" is credited to Jeff Cole on the soundtrack and was mentioned in the movie as a favorite artist of Jan and Jule. Jeff Cole is a pseudonym for the score-writer, Andreas Wodraschke. The singer is his friend Sam Genders of London.

3882.name: Ana, My Love
3882.storyline: Cinematographer Andrei Butica said that they used prosthesis in the sex scene between Mircea Postelnicu and Diana Cavallioti. "We used latex to seal the actual body parts, and we used prosthesis. A wonderful penis! And some hair. It looks very realistic in the film, but we tried to avoid actually showing it. In person it looked like Frankenstein's creation or something! It was horrifying. Cãlin and I rehearsed it with the make-up girl, who was the one who created the prosthesis and actually put them on. We rehearsed everything and we chose the angles we wanted to shoot from, according to exactly how much we were going to see and how much we would allow on the screen. There was semen coming out, which came from a small pump that you had to squeeze.," he said.

3883.name: Sound of Christmas
3883.storyline: Farrah Aviva, who plays Meg, Brad's assistant, is Brad actor Robin Dunne's wife.

3884.name: Dream Boy
3884.storyline: Rooney Mara's feature film debut (portrays Evelyn).

3885.name: The Broken Hearts Club: A Romantic Comedy
3885.storyline: When Timothy Olyphant and Andrew Keegan were filming their scene on the park swings, a group of teenage girls noticed Andrew and waited until the scene was over to ask him for his autograph. When Timothy offered his autograph, the girls declined as they didn't know who he was.

3886.name: The Lady Vanishes
3886.storyline: Though Cybill Shepherd only wears one costume in the movie, (a bias-cut white satin dress), the costume department made nine identical copies to facilitate filming.

3887.name: Little Ashes
3887.storyline: Robert Pattinson admitted in German magazine "Interview" that he masturbated for real during the sex scene, because he found it impossible to fake an orgasm and the reactions of the body and face during that moment. When asked why he didn't just fake it for the camera Robert shared, "[It} just doesn't work, so I pleasured myself in front of the camera."

3888.name: A Christmas Spark
3888.storyline: Jane Seymour and Joe Lando starred together in the TV show Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman (1993) from 1993-1998. They played couple Michaela and Sully.

3889.name: The Flamingo Kid
3889.storyline: This was the very first film to be given a PG-13 rating, but it was shelved for five months, making Red Dawn (1984) the first film to be *released* with the PG-13 rating.

3890.name: The Summer of Sangaile
3890.storyline: The film was selected as the Lithuanian entry for the Best Foreign Language Film at the 88th Academy Awards but it was not nominated.

3891.name: Tricked
3891.storyline: According to Paul Verhoeven, in the majority of submitted screenplays that he received, the wife openly condemned her husband's extramarital affairs. He chose to ignore this in lieu of having the wife stoically accept it under certain conditions, which he found a much more interesting and less predictable situation.

3892.name: Qarib Qarib Single
3892.storyline: In movie parvathy's character jaya wrote her name jayeshee tk on a website. In real life parvathy's full name is parvathy tk.

3893.name: The Wedding Banquet
3893.storyline: The Wedding Banquet (1993) has the highest cost-to-return ratio of 1993, earning $23.6 million from a budget of $1 million. This gave it a of 23.6 ratio, considerably higher than 1993's biggest money-maker "Jurassic Park" whose ratio was 13.8.

3894.name: My Life Without Me
3894.storyline: Originally the film was to feature Ann recording tapes for her father and for Dr. Thompson, in which she forgives her father for being absent during her childhood, and tells Dr. Thompson that his seeing patients as people isn't a bad thing before thanking him for keeping her impending death a secret. The ending montage was also supposed to feature a video clip of Ann's dad making shoes for his granddaughters from prison with tears in his eyes. These things never even made it to the filming stage, probably because of the length of the production itself.

3895.name: The Story of Ruth
3895.storyline: The role of Ruth was intended for Susan Strasberg - who was tested for the part - but the studio decided to cast Elana Eden after they saw her screen test for The Diary of Anne Frank (1959) and were stunned by her beauty and talent. However, she made only one subsequent movie, a B-picture some five years later.

3896.name: The Last Sunset
3896.storyline: This movie had a major influence on Sergio Leone, who worked with director Robert Aldrich on Sodom and Gomorrah (1962).

3897.name: Jingle All the Way to Love
3897.storyline: Lucky Sleigh Bell (feat. Sara Sommerer)Written by Jarryd Elias, Sara Sommerer, and Bobby RosePerformed by Jarryd Elias and Sara SommererCourtesy of Jarryd Elias Music

3898.name: Emmanuelle II
3898.storyline: The "X" certificate rating was removed by a special Parisian court ruling (26th January 1978).

3899.name: A Kismet Christmas
3899.storyline: The word Kismet is spoken 25 times.

3900.name: Housefull
3900.storyline: Whilst returning from the shoot of Housefull, Chunky Pandey was detained at Amsterdam airport, where the police had mistook him for a Mexican drug peddler.

3901.name: Forbidden
3901.storyline: Nikki: You know the difference between good sex and great sex?Jason: What?Nikki: A feeling of connection.

3902.name: Demetrius and the Gladiators
3902.storyline: Twice jailed for drug use, Jay Robinson once had the dubious honor of being recognized by his fellow inmates when this film was played for the convicts.

3903.name: The Pom Pom Girls
3903.storyline: A "Dawn 120" cigarette counter display is visible when Johnnie buys beer. Dawn 120s were a longer cigarette that sold poorly and were only available from mid 1975 to mid 1976.

3904.name: The Santa Con
3904.storyline: Melissa Joan Hart and Alimi Ballard previously worked together on Sabrina the Teenage Witch (1996). Ballard also guest starred on Hart's hit ABC family sitcom Melissa & Joey (2010).

3905.name: Greenberg
3905.storyline: In the early drafts of the screenplay, Greenberg was written as a man in his early 30s. Inspired by the idea of casting Ben Stiller, Noah Baumbach & Jennifer Jason Leigh rewrote the entire script and made Greenberg to be 40 years old, turning 41.

3906.name: When I Think of Christmas
3906.storyline: Peter Benson (Christmas Rapper) the director, appears with Niall Matter (Josh) in the Aurora Teagarden Mysteries series.

3907.name: LOL (Laughing Out Loud)
3907.storyline: Lisa Azuelos both wrote and directed this film after realizing that movies based on teen life in her home country of France were almost entirely missing. She would often see her daughter go to the theatre to watch either an American teen movie or a horror film.

3908.name: Unconquered
3908.storyline: While Boris Karloff was filming his scenes, he had his customary 4:00 p.m. tea break, which he always had written into his contract. They became so popular that even Gary Cooper and Charles Chaplin came on set for tea, and Paulette Goddard had a 4:00 p.m. tea break written into her contracts for the rest of her career.

3909.name: Bandslam
3909.storyline: David Bowie agreed to take part in the film because he was a fan of director Todd Graff's previous film Camp (2003).

3910.name: My Christmas Prince
3910.storyline: Frank Hardy and Nancy Drew are married, aka Mr. and Mrs. Logan.

3911.name: Henry's Crime
3911.storyline: The Music Hall in Tarrytown, New York stood-in as The Orphium Theatre. Upon seeing the posters in the display windows, Tarrytown citizens were actually very excited about the production involving Keanu Reeves and Vera Farmiga. Unfortunately there were no tickets being sold.

3912.name: Dreaming About You
3912.storyline: The controversy about this movie is that Martín Altomaro was barely 15 when he was making this film where, despite the transparencies and shadows used by director Marisa Sistach, the final sex scene between the young actor and Leticia Perdigón is very explicit.

3913.name: Rawhide
3913.storyline: During its run on television during the early 1960s, the film was retitled "Desperate Siege" in order to distinguish it from the Eric Fleming and Clint Eastwood television series "Rawhide" (1959).

3914.name: Scenes of a Sexual Nature
3914.storyline: The film managed to attract a cast including so many big names because the individual actors only spent two or three days filming their scenes and the producers offered them flexibility to work around their schedule on other projects and commitments.

3915.name: The World Unseen
3915.storyline: According to director Shamim Sarif when this film was sent for consideration to a film festival in Dubai, the DVD was mailed back to them with a note, which simply stated "the subject matter does not exist".

3916.name: The Truth About Cats & Dogs
3916.storyline: Janeane Garofalo, a shade over five feet tall, sometimes had to stand on a box just to be in the same frame with 6-foot co-star Uma Thurman.

3917.name: Wide Sargasso Sea
3917.storyline: The picture was classified and rated with a restricted NC-17 rating in the USA due to its explicit sexual content. Distributor Fine Line Features decided not to appeal the decision in order to try and gain a lower classification rating to make the movie marketable and able for younger audiences to attend. The New York Times reported "Fine Line Features, the art-film division of New Line Cinema, has accepted the rating for 'Wide Sargasso Sea (1993)' which includes male frontal nudity".

3918.name: Hideous Kinky
3918.storyline: The title of the film and book comes from the only two words the two girls remember their mum's friend saying "Hideous" and "Kinky". Bea in particular uses the words in a game that the girls play which is similar to "tag" but if she shouts "Hideous Kinky" before her sister tags her she is free.

3919.name: The Cheap Detective
3919.storyline: The movie was titled "The Cheap Detective", according to screenwriter Neil Simon, "because the detective in those old films never got paid! Who paid Humphrey Bogart for finding all those crooks in The Maltese Falcon (1941)? He arrested Mary Astor and sent her and everyone else to jail. Who paid him? The character is always involved in danger not for the bucks but because it's his lifestyle."

3920.name: Sound of the Sea
3920.storyline: A body double was used for Leonor Watling's breast-feeding scene.

3922.name: The Little Mermaid Live!
3922.storyline: Queen Latifah previously posed as Ursula for the Disney Parks Dream Portrait Series back in 2011.

3923.name: The Resurrection of Gavin Stone
3923.storyline: The church used in the film is Harvest Bible Chapel in Elgin, IL. There was an open call for extras to be seat fillers during a sermon scene.

3924.name: Zandalee
3924.storyline: Erika Anderson does not like to remember the filming of the most difficult sequences: "If I think back to the first day of working on Zandalee, I still get goose skin. It was the scene in which Nicolas Cage paints my naked body, the sun and the moon on my breasts and a river that flows down beyond the navel. And since Cage is an actor who loves improvisation, to show the domination of the male over the woman he put in such brutality and such participatory violence, that I was terrified, I felt really violated. We had to stop shooting and do it all again the next day. The rushes were pure pornography, they traumatized me."

3925.name: Under the Christmas Tree
3925.storyline: Enrico Colantoni who plays Alma's father has played Elise Bauman's father before in the web series Carmilla.

3926.name: Ae Dil Hai Mushkil
3926.storyline: The two leading female characters were originally supposed to be Pakistani women. However, Karan Johar decided to change the female characters to Indian Muslims to avoid further trouble after the film ran into controversy over the casting of a Pakistani actor Fawad Khan.

3927.name: High School High
3927.storyline: The film is dedicated to Elisabeth Leustig and Lexie Bigham, both of whom were involved in the movie's production and died in automobile crashes shortly after filming was completed. Bigham acted in the film, and Leustig was the film's casting director.

3928.name: Cocoon: The Return
3928.storyline: Ron Howard refused to have any association with the film, feeling concerned that the whole point of the first film would immediately be squandered.

3929.name: Ruthless
3929.storyline: Buck Mansfield quotes twice from the Bible. The first occasion is when he is being pursued by his creditors and he reads from Proverbs 31:10 -12 and 21 (...Who can find a virtuous woman? For her price is far above rubies....). The second instance is when he speaks to the bartender at Vendig's function and the quote is from Obadiah 1: 2-4 (...Though you set your nest among the stars, From there I will bring you down ...).

3930.name: Tuesday, After Christmas
3930.storyline: Mirela Oprisor (Adriana) is the wife of Mimi Branescu (Paul) and Maria Popistasu (Raluca) is the wife of Alexandru Baciu (screenplay).

3931.name: Locked Down
3931.storyline: The movie was shot in only 18 days in London during the COVID-19 pandemic.

3932.name: The Stud
3932.storyline: The opening montage of Tony's signed photographs includes one from Jackie Collins.

3933.name: Whisky Galore
3933.storyline: Remake of a 1949 Ealing classic of the same name, which itself was based on a real-life incident that occurred in 1941 on the Hebridean island of Eriskay when the SS Politician ran aground. The tale of how a group of local Scottish islanders raided a shipwreck for its consignment of 24,000 cases of whisky quickly became legend. What's less well reported is the fact that the ship was also carrying a considerable amount of hard cash. According to official files recently released by the Home Office, there were nearly 290,000 ten-shilling notes on board as well (this would be the equivalent of several million pounds at today's prices), not all of which were recovered. The money was on its way to the West Indies, and the banknotes were of a specifically Jamaican design, making them, of course, immediately identifiable in the Outer Hebrides. Despite this, 20 years after the 1949 film was shown, occasional visitors to the gift shop on Eriskay would find a Jamaican ten-shilling note in their change.

3934.name: The White Countess
3934.storyline: The Countess' (Natasha Richardson) family included her real-life mother Dame Vanessa Redgrave and aunt Lynn Redgrave.

3935.name: Twelfth Night
3935.storyline: In the mid 1950s, director Joseph L. Mankiewicz tried to set up a version with Audrey Hepburn and Danny Kaye, but it failed to materialize.

3936.name: The Lovebirds
3936.storyline: Paramount had originally planned to released the film theatrically on April 3, 2020, but decided to release it on Netflix due to the coronavirus pandemic and widespread theatre closings.

3937.name: Chasing Papi
3937.storyline: Roselyn Sanchez actually was Miss Puerto Rico Petite.

3938.name: Spring Breakdown
3938.storyline: When asked what IMDb-credit he would like to have removed Armie Hammer named this title.

3939.name: A Homecoming for the Holidays
3939.storyline: Laura Osnes has starred in Broadway musicals, arguably most famously in 2013 in the title role in "Rodgers + Hammerstein's Cinderella", for which she was nominated for a Tony Award.

3940.name: Hello, Goodbye and Everything in Between

3941.name: Love at the Christmas Contest
3941.storyline: The town contest Angie enters is called the "Green Pine Grove Town Square Christmas Eve Festival of Lights Christmas Tree Decorating Contest Finalist Gala".

3942.name: Down to You
3942.storyline: First time that Shawn Hatosy and Julia Stiles worked together. Later they would both join the cast of Dexter during Season 5.

3943.name: Wedding Agreement
3943.storyline: Based on the same title novel, Wedding Agreement by Mia Chuz.

3944.name: Premam
3944.storyline: The film had no trailer or teaser prior to its release.

3945.name: Tillu Square
3945.storyline: Anupama Parameswaran takes on a sizzling and alluring role in Tillu Square.

3946.name: Mr. Woodcock
3946.storyline: Seann William Scott and Billy Bob Thornton both disliked the film. Director Craig Gillespie also hated the end result, due to last-minute re-shoots done with another director (said director, later revealed to be David Dobkin, went uncredited, leaving Gillespie to take the blame).

3947.name: Ema
3947.storyline: The actors were never given the entire script during the production.

3948.name: Dragon's Lair: The Movie
3948.storyline: The movie's pitch to executives was funded by an online Indiegogo campaign. After a failed Kickstarter, it surpassed its initial $250K goal and made over $600K.

3949.name: The Man Who Loved Women
3949.storyline: First of two movies that Kim Basinger made with writer, producer, and director Blake Edwards. The second being Blind Date (1987).

3950.name: Made in Heaven
3950.storyline: The role of Emmett is credited to "himself" in the end credits, but was actually played by Debra Winger, who was married to Timothy Hutton at the time of filming.

3951.name: The Broadway Melody
3951.storyline: See the complete list of Best Picture winners. For fun, use the "sort order" function to rank by IMDb rating and other criteria.

3952.name: Firelight
3952.storyline: Though he had been in the film industry as a scriptwriter for many years, this was William Nicholson's first directed film.

3954.name: Rurouni Kenshin: Final Chapter Part II - The Beginning
3954.storyline: Takeru Satoh has portrayed the character of Kenshin Himura since 2012, and has been doing all his own stunts since he first took on the role

3955.name: Gunday
3955.storyline: The film was spammed with negative reviews due to many Bangladeshi people being upset at some of the historical inaccuracy shown in the movie.

3957.name: Belle Epoque
3957.storyline: When accepting his Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film, director (Fernando Trueba) said: "I would like to believe in God in order to thank him for this prize, but I only believe in (Billy Wilder), so... Thank you, Mr. Wilder!". Wilder himself reportedly phoned Trueba a few days later for acknowledgment and told him: "Hello Fernando, I'm God".

3959.name: Mujhse Dosti Karoge!
3959.storyline: Rani Mukerji plays a character named Pooja while Kareena Kapoor plays a character named Tina. Rani's played a character named Tina in Kuch Kuch Hota Hai (1998) while Kareena played a character named Pooja in Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham... (2001), both incidentally directed by Karan Johar

3960.name: Boy on a Dolphin
3960.storyline: While filming Boy on a Dolphin (1957), Sophia Loren was required to walk in a trench in order to give audiences the impression that her diminutive co-star, Alan Ladd, was taller than she.

3961.name: Blue Jay
3961.storyline: There was no script. The actors were given a summary of the movie and their characters and the rest was improvization.

3962.name: Life or Something Like It
3962.storyline: Christian Kane (Cal Cooper) is also the lead singer of outlaw country band Kane. When Cal comes out of the elevator towards the apartment, he's singing one of their songs "Sweet Carolina Rain".

3963.name: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
3963.storyline: For realistic close-up shots, William Holden learned how to taxi a fighter on the deck of an aircraft carrier.

3964.name: Groundswell
3964.storyline: Lacey Chabert has done over thirty Hallmark Movies before she turned 40 on September 30th, 2022. This is her thirty-first movie.

3965.name: I Love You More
3965.storyline: It seems almost any gay director make at least one coming-of-age drama. Problem is many of them are surprisingly unrelatable. Sometimes it's too tragedy ridden melodrama, sometimes it's too pink tinted image of what the director wished but never really had in reality.'I love you more' is much calmer, gentler drama. Especially the psychology of the teenage character in his first love, with all his idealism, anxiety, moodiness and blind drive, is depicted fairly realistically. Now as a grown-up, I find him incredibly annoying, but I can't deny I definitely shared a lot of the characters when I was about his age.It's not a perfect product. Ben's life and surrounding lacks the nitty gritty of real life, sceneries are all a bit too majestic every time, parents (especially mom) shows the patience of a saint... Overall everything is shimmering in a sort of golden light of late summer evening. I think it's the director looking back his childhood and his motherland with nostalgia... But at times I wished to see just a bit more rawness.Nevertheless I still think 'I love you more' is a positive addition to the extensive list of gay coming of age films, if nothing else than for the relatable depiction of the teenage psychology.

3966.name: Tabu
3966.storyline: The movie that Aurora was said to have participated in, "It will never snow again over Kilimanjaro", is, of course, fictional.

3967.name: Ashes in the Snow
3967.storyline: To avoid potential confusion with 50 Shades of Gray, many alternative titles were considered to replace the original title, "Between Shades of Gray". Screenwriter Ben York Jones came up with Ashes in the Snow, for its similarity in cadence, and its narrative significance.

3968.name: Lola
3968.storyline: This, Jacques Demy's first film, is a tribute to Max Ophüls.

3969.name: The Way He Looks
3969.storyline: According to an interview with The Moveable Fest, Fabio Audi who plays Gabriel is the one who suggested to Daniel Ribeiro that his character needed to have a bike. The original short film does not include a bike, but Daniel Ribeiro took the suggestion and started writing about the bike. It eventually became a bigger thing.

3970.name: The Life and Death of Peter Sellers
3970.storyline: Peter Sellers did not give a pony to his son Michael as shown in the film. He gave it to his younger daughter by Britt Ekland several years later. The change was made in order to compress events for dramatic purposes. According to the screenwriter, the horse disappeared after a couple of weeks, and when his daughter wanted to know where it was, he replied that he had given it to Princess Margaret.

3971.name: Every Other Holiday
3971.storyline: Broadcast in the UK on Channel 5 under the title "A Holiday Wish Come True" on 3 December 2018.

3972.name: The Enchanted Christmas Cake
3972.storyline: Erica Durance and Robin Dunne starred in The Christmas Chalet (2019) together.

3973.name: Space Oddity
3973.storyline: Kevin Bacon found out he was not the original actor that was a supposed to star in this movie when he was on The Jimmy Kimmel show. When Kimmel told him that Kyra Sedgwick had told him that herself, he seemed quite shocked.

3974.name: Farewell, My Queen
3974.storyline: In this movie, Diane Kruger speaks French with a German/Austrian accent - which is undoubtedly how the Austrian-born Marie Antoinette would have spoken herself.

3975.name: Rachel, Rachel
3975.storyline: Nell Potts, who plays Rachel as a young girl, is actually Joanne Woodward and Paul Newman's daughter.

3976.name: Forever Christmas
3976.storyline: Originally known as "Mr. 365", and has also aired as "Forever Christmas".

3977.name: The Good German
3977.storyline: The film was shot as if it had been made in 1945. Only studio back lots, sets and local Los Angeles locations were used. No radio microphones were used, the film was lit with only incandescent lights and period lenses were used on the cameras. The actors were directed to perform in a presentational, stage style. The only allowance was the inclusion of nudity, violence and cursing which would have been forbidden by the Production Code.

3978.name: Supercross
3978.storyline: The exterior shots of the Team Nami building are actually the Kawasaki Motorcycle Headquarters formerly located in Irvine, California. They did not however, have a private test track next to the property.

3979.name: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
3979.storyline: The musical number Kate rehearses for the amateur show, "Any Way The Wind Blows," had been written for Doris Day's previous film Pillow Talk (1959). The song title was, for a while, even the working title of that film.

3980.name: Juwanna Mann
3980.storyline: Kevin Pollak has said that when he signed on to the film, Will Smith was set to star.

3981.name: The Devil's Disciple
3981.storyline: The character of The Reverend Anthony Anderson was loosely based on the historical figure of Peter Muhlenberg, known as the "Fighting Parson of the American Revolution".

3982.name: White Nights
3982.storyline: Austrian actress Maria Schell learnt the script in Italian and spoke all her lines in Italian during the shooting, which won her the admiration of the Italian cast and crew. It was subsequently decided not to dub her voice by an Italian actress, which was the usual practice at the time.

3983.name: The Ramen Girl
3983.storyline: On the set of the film, Brittany Murphy nervously told director Robert Allan Ackerman that she had only ever been cast to be "either cute or crazy" and would not be able to deliver anything else. In response, they developed a code where he would say either "C1" or "C2." "C1" was "cute" and "C2" was "crazy," and Ackerman would say to her, "Too much C2, too much C1."

3984.name: Sailor Beware
3984.storyline: The boxing scene was written by Jerry Lewis, who demanded an extra $50,000 for it, which he then donated to the Muscular Dystrophy Association.

3985.name: The Harrad Experiment
3985.storyline: Melanie Griffith, who had a small uncredited role, met Don Johnson on the set of this film when it began filming in February 1972. The then 14-year-old Griffith and the 22-year-old Johnson began dating and later got married in January 1976, when Griffith was 18-years-old. The marriage only lasted six months, though they got remarried in 1989. Their second marriage lasted seven years.

3986.name: I Killed My Mother
3986.storyline: Xavier Dolan wrote the script when he was 16 years old. He said in an interview with French-Canadian newspaper 'Le Soleil' that the movie was in part an autobiography.

3987.name: Christmas Everlasting
3987.storyline: In "The Second Sister", the 2015 novel that Christmas Everlasting is based on, Lucy is a seasoned political campaigner rather than a corporate lawyer.

3989.name: The Broken Hearts Gallery
3989.storyline: Museum of broken relationships actually exists in Zagreb, Croatia. It started out similar... Muzej prekinutih veza, Zagreb Croatia.

3990.name: Touch
3990.storyline: Project notes, plot, and industry news

3991.name: Anastasia
3991.storyline: At the time of filming, those at Fox were not aware that the real Anna Anderson was still alive. After this came to their attention, they flew to her home in Germany and asked permission to use her name. It should be noted that, in the film, the full name "Anna Anderson" is never used, although "Mrs. Anderson" is briefly employed as an incognito in the later stages of the story.

3992.name: A New York Christmas Wedding
3992.storyline: Final film for Chris Trousdale who died in June 2020 of complications of Covid-19.

3994.name: Arjun Reddy
3994.storyline: The lead actor Vijay Devarakonda said in an interview that to be in the character of Arjun Reddy while filming the movie, he stayed away from watching light hearted comedy movies and preferred to watch dark movies instead.

3995.name: Both Sides of the Blade
3995.storyline: First film of actor Hana Magimel, daughter of Juliette Binoche and Benoît Magimel.

3996.name: Losing Control
3996.storyline: At the bank scene, a crew member is visible besides the car door. He quickly disappear in the next shot, when the main characters leave the bank's parking spot.

3997.name: Suzhou River
3997.storyline: Director Ye Lou was banned by the Chinese government to from making films for two years for making Suzhou River without authority approval.

3998.name: Finding Christmas
3998.storyline: In the opening of the movie there is a street scene that is supposed to be downtown Butters, North Carolina. There is street sign indicating US Hwy 20 and a state highway. This same street scene was use in The Christmas Parade (2014), and is the intersection of US 20 and Ohio 65 in Perrysburg, Ohio.

3999.name: 365 Days
3999.storyline:
Don't ever think to watch this !
One of the worst movies

4000.name: The Mistletoe Secret
4000.storyline: Midway, Utah, is a real place and has been a filming location for previous Hallmark movies set elsewhere. Ironically, although this movie takes place in Midway, it was not filmed there.

4001.name: Toma
4001.storyline: This movie is masterpiece from the first to the last second.

4003.name: Summer Storm
4003.storyline: Alicja Bachleda speaks German but had to be dubbed because the producers were bothered by her accent.

4004.name: Beyond Borders
4004.storyline: All the villages in exotic locations were authentic. The crews installed real running water for the grateful villagers. Some of them had never even seen a white man until then.

4005.name: The Innocent
4005.storyline: Writer/director Louis Garrel's mother, Brigitte Sy, worked 20 years in prisons for theater workshops.

4006.name: Camille
4006.storyline: Often filmed, the earliest version of Dumas Fils novella was made into film in 1907 as The Lady with the Camellias.

4007.name: Falling Into Place
4007.storyline: Art gallery scene was filmed in SoGo Arts in Saltmarket, Glasgow, Scotland.

4008.name: Facing Windows
4008.storyline: Massimo Girotti died on 6 January 2003 and the movie is dedicated to his memory. Before he was cast, Ferzan Özpetek had considered also Jean Rochefort and Serge Reggiani for his role.

4009.name: Blind Date Book Club
4009.storyline: Co-stars Erin Krakow and Johannah Newmarch also appear together in When Calls the Heart (2014).

4010.name: The Anniversary Party
4010.storyline: The movie was shot entirely in a Hollywood Hills house designed by Richard Neutra which is owned by Sofia Coppola.

4011.name: Silver and the Book of Dreams
4011.storyline: I just finished watching 'Silver and the Book of Dreams' and wanted to share my thoughts. It was a decent film, everyone involved did a great job.The visuals were pretty cool, with some imaginative landscapes and interesting stuff in the dream hall in particular. They added a nice touch to the overall experience.The characters were well portrayed, and the cast did a great job bringing them to life. While I didn't feel a deep connection to them, they were still enjoyable to watch, and I really liked the group dynamics.The music was nice and complemented the film well, but it didn't leave a lasting impression on me.Overall, 'Silver and the Book of Dreams' is worth a watch if you're a fan of fantasy films. It may not be the most mind-blowing one out there, but everyone involved put in a great effort, and it's a really solid film.

4012.name: Comet
4012.storyline: Writer and director Sam Esmail is married to lead actress Emmy Rossum

4013.name: American Heart
4013.storyline: Jeff Bridges' favorite film of his own.

4014.name: Black Velvet
4014.storyline: Italian censorship visa # 68813 delivered on 29 July 1976.

4015.name: Guiding Emily
4015.storyline: Being a movie about the loss of one's sight, the opening title card and some opening credits are also presented in braille, obviously without the raised surface to make it readable for someone sightless.

4016.name: Feast of Love
4016.storyline: Alexa Davalos said that she would never take her clothes off. However, after meeting the director she decided to be naked for the film and do both full frontal and rear nudity.

4017.name: A Very Charming Christmas Town
4017.storyline: What happens to the main girl in this Christmas movie is identical to what happens to the main character in The Christmas Ring (2020). Both have their written article released that they didn't want published. Both movies premiered in the same weekend and have other similarities also.

4018.name: Black Venus
4018.storyline: First of many full frontal nude scenes in her career by Florence Guerin. She was 17.

4019.name: Deathstalker IV: Match of Titans
4019.storyline: This final film in the series blatantly re-uses footage from the original Deathstalker movie, including tournaments, battles and party footage.

4020.name: Kissing Jessica Stein
4020.storyline: The cab scene where Helen and Jessica talk about blending lipstick was filmed after the filmmakers hailed a cab, paid the driver $20, the director drove, the director of photography was in the front seat and the sound woman climbed in the back trunk.

4021.name: Sweeter Than Chocolate
4021.storyline: Aired as the first of four original films in The Hallmark Channel's 2023 "Loveuary" lineup.

4022.name: Summertime
4022.storyline: Reportedly director Sir David Lean's personal favorite of his own movies.

4023.name: Dil Se..
4023.storyline: During the course of the film, the character played by Shahrukh Khan passes through each of the 7 shades of love defined in ancient Arabic literature - attraction, infatuation, love, reverence, worship, obsession and death.

4024.name: Somewhere in the Night
4024.storyline: During the course of the film, the name of the mysterious 'Larry Cravat' is said 85 times.

4025.name: Cruise
4025.storyline: Both leads in this movie, Spencer Boldman and Emily Ratajkowski, appeared in the same episode of iCarly (Season: 3, Episode: 3, iSpeed date), though the two don't share any scenes together in it.

4026.name: Sweet Mountain Christmas
4026.storyline: The mother's house was also a set in Hallmark's Father Christmas series. In some shots the beam with a painted phrase used as a plot point in the Father Christmas movies can be seen.

4027.name: Blacula
4027.storyline: The film was popular in the U.S., debuting at #24 on "Variety"'s list of top films. It eventually grossed over $1 million, making it one of the highest grossing films of 1972.

4028.name: Tumbledown
4028.storyline: Hannah's red truck broke down frequently and for at least one scene had to be pushed down the street by crew members just out of frame.

4029.name: Toothless
4029.storyline: This was Kirstie Alley's only Disney movie.

4030.name: The Pallbearer
4030.storyline: David Schwimmer was so busy filming this movie that he missed his Friends (1994) co-star Lisa Kudrow's wedding.

4031.name: Five Times Two
4031.storyline: In the French edition of the DVD, the director offers a version of the movie titled "2 x 5". This version shows the five sequences in the chronological order, from the moment the couple meets till their divorce. Subtle editing work has been applied to make the movie work.

4032.name: Holiday Twist
4032.storyline: I Got YouWritten By Michael Jay and Alan DemossPerformed by Jake Miller

4033.name: Krakatoa: East of Java
4033.storyline: Krakatoa was actually located west of Java.

4034.name: Two of a Kind
4034.storyline: Although she'd starred in three theatrical movies and had made countless TV appearances in the 15 year prior to this movie, Dame Olivia Newton-John was insecure about her acting abilities and decided to enroll in acting training in preparation for the film (and in fact her character is also part of an acting workshop).

4035.name: Christmas Under the Stars
4035.storyline: Autumn Reeser and Jesse Metcalf were co-stars in the 2015 Hallmark movie, A Country Wedding.

4036.name: Escaping Ohio
4036.storyline: Too Young to BurnWritten by Sonny SmithPerformed by Sonny and the SunsetsCourtesy of Fat Possum RecordsBy arrangement with Terrorbird Media

4038.name: Breaking Fast
4038.storyline: The character of Kal is specifically named after Kal-El, otherwise known as Superman, the fact of which is specifically mentioned more than once in the movie, with both main characters being major fans of the character of Superman. Both the Christopher Reeve portrayals of Superman, and the Henry Cavill portrayals of Superman are mentioned, and several clips from Superman (1978) are featured when the two main characters attend a theatrical screening of the film. Additionally, second lead Michael Cassidy, who portrays the character of Kal, appears in Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice (2016), portraying Jimmy Olsen.

4039.name: Santa, Maybe
4039.storyline: I enjoyed the movie and it kept my attention. Covers several true-to-life side stories to learn from which I enjoyed. Acting was excellent throughout as the entire cast brought the story to life in a genuine way. Rated it a "7" because I feel the supporting cast stories could be developed more. (Loved seeing Brooklyn Brough again) Lila's family and Glenn's family had lots of interesting idioscracies that were "touched" on but I would have liked to see more time spent on. May be some of the "theater" workers. Music choices were fantastic! Overall it is a wonderful, uplifting movie and when it ended, I found mysefl personally challenged and inspired.

4040.name: Love's Labour's Lost
4040.storyline: The actors did their own singing.

4041.name: Christmas in the Pines
4041.storyline: Jillian Murray and Dean Geyer are married to each other in real life.

4042.name: Christmas Lovers Anonymous
4042.storyline: The big city in the flyover is Minneapolis MN.

4043.name: My Christmas Fiancé
4043.storyline: Even though she's not listed in the credits, Denise Richards has a role as a frequent guest of the hotel.

4044.name: Cuban Fury
4044.storyline: In the scene were Bruce (Nick Frost) and Drew (Chris O'Dowd) are doing the dance-off in the parking garage, a car beeps to pass by, and in the car is Simon Pegg, Frost's frequent co-star from Spaced (1999), the Cornetto Trilogy and Paul (2011) (amongst others), and O'Dowd's from How to Lose Friends & Alienate People (2008).

4045.name: Meet Me at the Christmas Train Parade
4045.storyline: The crowd scenes where the star was put into the top of the tree was filmed in Spruce Grove, Alberta in Central Park.

4046.name: As Tears Go By
4046.storyline: First film directed by Kar-Wai Wong.

4047.name: For Keeps?
4047.storyline: Screenwriters Tim Kazurinsky and Denise DeClue began work by immersing themselves in the subject of teenage pregnancy, reading articles and speaking directly to teenage mothers. Kazurinsky said: "According to our research about 10,000 U.S. teenagers a week who are pregnant keep their babies. And in every interview we had with young pregnant girls, they all said, 'I never thought it would happen to me.' So we created Darcy Elliot as the kind of smart, with-it girl who would never think it could happen to her".

4048.name: Holiday for Heroes
4048.storyline: This is the second Hallmark movie in which Marc Blucas played an army sergeant. The other one was "Operation Christmas ".

4049.name: Suburban Secrets
4049.storyline: Originally titled "Lust for Laura", the lead roles were written for Erin Brown and Julian Wells. Brown declined, as she wanted to get out of the pornography industry, and Wells dropped out shortly afterward.

4050.name: Dog Days
4050.storyline: Ron Cephas Jones (Walter) and Jasmine Cephas Jones (Lola) are father and daughter in real life.

4051.name: In Like Flint
4051.storyline: According to the audio commentary on the DVD, Fox wanted to do another "Flint" movie but James Coburn turned them down.

4052.name: There's a Girl in My Soup
4052.storyline: Adapted by Terence Frisby from his own play. The Broadway production of "There's a Girl in My Soup" opened on Oct. 18, 1967 at the Music Box Theatre and ran for 322 performances. Gig Young and Barbara Ferris were in the original cast.

4054.name: Do You Remember Dolly Bell?
4054.storyline: Winner Best Actor (Slavko Stimac) at 25th Panama International Film Festival.

4055.name: 16 Wishes
4055.storyline:
Abby Jensen's original 16 wishes are:
When I'm 16...
1. I'll meet Joey Lockhart.
2. I'll have the cutest clothes in school.
3. I'll decorate my room the way I want.
4. I'll like sushi.
5. I'll have a credit card like Mommy's.
6. I'll be a good dancer.
7. I'll get my driver's license.
8. I'll have my own car, preferably RED.
9. People will stop treating me like a kid.
10. I'll be POPULAR!
11. I'll have my own bathroom.
12. I'll beat Krista Cook at something, anything, EVERYTHING!
13. I'll come home as late as I want.
14. My parents will understand me.
15. I'll have the BEST PARTY EVER!
16. [A picture of Logan stuck on with bubble gum]

4056.name: Luka Chuppi
4056.storyline: Pankaj Tripathi played the role of Kriti's father in a movie shot last year, Bareilly Ki Barfi.

4057.name: Jannat: In Search of Heaven...
4057.storyline: Partially based on a Gambler by James Caan.

4058.name: Mistress
4058.storyline: It is claimed that Parisian masochists didn't merely volunteer for treatment in the Dungeon scenes, but actually paid for the privilege.

4059.name: The Beautician and the Beast
4059.storyline: Fran Drescher took voice lessons to alter the nasal quality of her voice for the part of Joy Miller. When she arrived on-set using her new "normal" voice, producers insisted that she revert to her natural trademark one, as it was one of the reasons she was asked to play the part.

4060.name: Bronco Billy
4060.storyline: Scatman Crothers stated that his role as Doc Lynch was his second favorite after his role in "The King of Marvin Gardens (1972)."

4061.name: Night Train to Lisbon
4061.storyline: The title of the book written by the character Amadeu "Um Ourives das Palavras" is Portuguese for "A Goldsmith of Words."

4062.name: Harami
4062.storyline: Harami had it's world premiere at the Busan International Film Festival on 24th October, 2020.

4063.name: Mr. Manhattan
4063.storyline: To say this was brutal is an understatement. The lead characters are married in real life and this most always leads to a train wreck. Acting was weak at best, storyline incredibly predictable. While watching my gf and I were saying the lines before they were actually spoken. This service asks if my review contains a spoiler. If you can't predict the outcome 10 mins into the movie, you've been living in a box. This is a heavy faith based movie which made it a little preachy (pardon the pun). Don't know why we bothered, guess it was a slow TV night. I should have watched my grass grow instead. This was a BIG miss for me.

4064.name: At First Sight
4064.storyline: Val Kilmer prepared for his role by studying with a sculptor friend of his in New Mexico who had lost his sight in Vietnam. At 49:30 (NTSC) he is admiring a sculpture when he first visit's Amy's flat.

4065.name: Alice
4065.storyline: Sean Young filmed a small role, but it was later cut. She had been deleted from Woody Allen's previous film Crimes and Misdemeanors (1989) as well.

4066.name: A Letter to Three Wives
4066.storyline: (at around 1h 16 mins) To get the proper look of derision from Linda Darnell in the scene where she stares at a photo of Addie, director Joseph L. Mankiewicz used a picture of Otto Preminger, the director who had given Darnell such a hard time on the set of Forever Amber (1947).

4067.name: Cousins
4067.storyline: The movie's two male leads, Ted Danson and William Petersen, would both later on star as the chief forensic investigator on the popular TV crime series CSI: Crime Scene Investigation (2000), Petersen pioneering the part with Danson being his second replacement, after Laurence Fishburne.

4068.name: Being 17
4068.storyline: The film's title is derived from the first verse of Arthur Rimbaud's 1870 poem "Roman": "On n'est pas sérieux quand on a dix-sept ans" ("When you are seventeen you aren't really serious"). Additionally, the poster's tagline, "L'adolescence est le seul temps où l'on ait appris quelque chose" ("Adolescence is the only period in which we learn anything") is taken from "In the Shadow of Young Girls in Flower", the second volume in Marcel Proust's novel "In Search of Lost Time". Both Rimbaud and Proust were known to be homosexual.

4069.name: A Gift for Christmas
4069.storyline: When Mrs. Henley mentions that the New York State Theater (home of the NYC Ballet) changed its name, she is referring to what is now called the David Koch Theater at Lincoln Center.

4070.name: Faraway, So Close!
4070.storyline: Mikhail Gorbachev: only appears because his secretary was familiar with the movies of Wim Wenders and was a great admirer. She talked Gorbachev into giving up a couple of hours to do the cameo as he was on a trip to Germany anyway.

4071.name: Koi... Mil Gaya
4071.storyline: The mentally challenged character played by Hrithik wears spectacles. After going through various spectacles, the ones he finally used, were the same pair that he wore as ultra modern Raj in "Kaho Na Pyaar Hai".

4072.name: Kang Mak
4072.storyline: This is the second time Indra Jegel has taken on the role of a costumed ghost in a haunted house attraction, following his similar gimmick in the hit movie Agak Laen.

4073.name: Tune in for Love
4073.storyline: Kim Go Eun and Jung Hae In was in Goblin

4075.name: Winter Castle
4075.storyline: The Ice Hotel featured in the film isn't a made-up place - it's real and in Quebec City, Canada. The Hotel de Glace - the only ice hotel in North America.

4076.name: Elenore Makes Love
4076.storyline: Edited from NSFW: Not Safe for Work (2014)

4077.name: The Sweetest Heart
4077.storyline: Aired as the first of four original films in The Hallmark Channel's 2018 "Spring Fever" lineup (replacing the "Spring Fling" lineup of previous years).

4078.name: Lovers of the Arctic Circle
4078.storyline: When asked where the idea for the movie came from, Julio Medem said that he started thinking about it after getting divorced, because it was the first time he experienced heartbreak and wanted to write a movie about the love as the most powerful force, something that never ends and it's forever between two people.

4079.name: Brown Sugar
4079.storyline: Nicole Ari Parker and Boris Kodjoe are not only married in real life, but also play love interests on Soul Food (2000).

4082.name: Identification of a Woman
4082.storyline: The last feature film Michelangelo Antonioni made before his debilitating stroke.

4083.name: Sylvia
4083.storyline: Frieda Hughes, Sylvia Plath's daughter and literary executor, didn't allow the producers to access to her mother's poetry. She also publicly denounced the project in a published poem of her own.

4084.name: Summer with Monika
4084.storyline: In François Truffaut's The 400 Blows (1959), the poster that René and Antoine steal from the cinema is of Harriet Andersson in this film.

4085.name: The Unknown
4085.storyline: Joan Crawford always considered "The Unknown (1927)" a big turning point for her. She said it wasn't until working with Lon Chaney in this film that she learned the difference between standing in front of a camera and acting in front of a camera. She said that was all due to Chaney and his intense concentration, and after that experience she said she worked much harder to become a better actress.Chaney's performance certainly inspired co-star Crawford who wrote "Lon Chaney was my introduction to acting. The concentration, the complete absorption he gave to his characterization filled me with such awe I could scarcely speak to him...watching him have me the desire to be a real actress."

4086.name: Gingerbread Miracle
4086.storyline: The tongs Alex uses when he is filling boxes with desserts/bread changes from blue to pink to blue.

4087.name: Raintree County
4087.storyline: The scenes which Montgomery Clift shot for this movie just before his accident represent the only color footage available of him before he was disfigured. All of his previous movies had been shot in black-and-white.

4088.name: Twice Born
4088.storyline: Saadet Aksoy received critical acclaim with her portrayal of Aska.

4089.name: Gas Food Lodging
4089.storyline: In a March 2001 interview with "Shout" magazine, Fairuza Balk stated that out of all her films, this was her favorite. She indicated that "this film is very close to my heart. As a girl, I was very much like my character Shade. I was shy. I was a loner."

4090.name: A Journal for Jordan
4090.storyline: As part of his project (and to pay respects to the men and women of the Armed Forces), Denzel Washington visited Fort Irwin, California in September 2020 to do a meet-and-greet with soldiers and families.

4091.name: For Love & Honey
4091.storyline: The first movie of four in Hallmark Channel's June 2024 Passport to Love, the moniker in that the four movies are primarily set outside of the United States. The other three in chronological order and their settings are Savoring Paris (2024) (Paris), A Greek Recipe for Romance (2024) (Greece), and Two Scoops of Italy (2024) (Italy).

4092.name: I Am Woman
4092.storyline: Helen Reddy died on September 29th, 2020, a month after the film was released in the US and Australia.

4093.name: Falling in Love Like in Movies
4093.storyline: The Black & White nature of the movie is NOT a gimmick, but rather a plot device.

4094.name: Love Me Tender
4094.storyline: The footage of Elvis Presley singing "Love Me Tender" at the end was shot after preview audiences reacted badly to his character's fate. This new footage created a continuity error, as Elvis had dyed his hair black by the time of the additional shooting, whilst in the movie his hair color was closer to blonde.

4095.name: Lightning Strikes Twice
4095.storyline: Director King Vidor's own ranch in Paso Robles, California was used as a filming location for the Nolan Ranch.

4096.name: In a Wild Moment
4096.storyline: There are two remakes of this film: the American remake Blame It On Rio (1984) and a 2015 French film also called Un moment d'égarement.

4097.name: Rapa Nui
4097.storyline: While film critic Gene Siskel thought that the egg hunt was ridiculous, the ritual did indeed exist as part of the Birdman Cult.

4098.name: Journey to Italy
4098.storyline: George Sanders, in his 1960 autobiography, wrote at length about the making of this film, which he found an exasperating and unpleasant experience. He spoke witheringly about Roberto Rossellini, whom he characterized as being more interested in scuba diving than in film-making. Although the tone of his remarks is one of amusement, it became known that Sanders (who had admired earlier Rossellini films) had been deeply affected by exposure to a style of film-making quite foreign to his previous experience, and had spent the shoot feeling frustrated and angry, often bursting into uncontrollable tears.

4099.name: Blind
4099.storyline: Demi Moore's first dramatic leading role since Flawless (2007) in 2008.

4100.name: Happythankyoumoreplease
4100.storyline: Josh Radnor's directing and writing debut.

4101.name: Rising Damp
4101.storyline: Original cast-member Richard Beckinsale died before the film could go before the cameras; consequently his medical student character Alan Moore was rewritten as Christopher Strauli's art student John. At the time Strauli was a well-known face on British screens from his regular role in another Eric Chappell sitcom from Yorkshire Television, Only When I Laugh (1979). Strauli was encouraged by Leonard Rossiter to play his character as the original actor would have; however the young actor (who had been at RADA with Beckinsale) felt uncomfortable with this suggestion as his contemporary had died only relatively recently. He would recall the part as an extremely unhappy one for him, despite the affability of the director and of the rest of the cast, but reasoned that his strained relationship with Rossiter was due to him feeling unsettled by Straulie replacing the much-missed Beckinsale.

4102.name: Post Grad
4102.storyline: Amanda Bynes was originally set to star.

4103.name: Wheel of Fortune and Fantasy
4103.storyline: The three stories were actually designed as the three of a group of seven stories, which have all been written already. The first two were shot in late 2019, and the third one was shot in July 2020, in the midst of the long break in the shooting of Drive My Car (2021) due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

4104.name: Wonder Bar
4104.storyline: Al Jolson insisted on singing the opening number Vive la France live on set, as he claimed it would be impossible to do the song justice if was filmed miming to playback, in order to deliver it with the excitement and verve that only he could bring to it. Even though this presented considerable technical problems, Warner Brothers agreed (that's the real studio orchestra actually on set playing the house band of the Wonder Bar) and this is one of the very last musical numbers to be performed live on camera.

4105.name: Gloria
4105.storyline: Official submission of Chile to the Oscars 2014 best foreign language film category.

4106.name: The Great Christmas Switch
4106.storyline: A new take on the idea of twin sisters exchanging lives at Christmas time. Hallmark somewhat made it work, a couple of years ago, with Candace Cameron Bure.Past the unbelievable reality that a husband and two children would not tell their wife and mother from a twin, the story moves well, the situations feel real enough, and the ending , albeit predictable, is on line with Christmas spirit. Overall, the movie is captivating and worth your time.

4107.name: Christmas Unwrapped
4107.storyline: Ice skating scene filmed at the Rink of Dreams outside the Ottawa Ontario city hall.

4108.name: Little Caesar
4108.storyline: In one scene, Edward G. Robinson had to fire a pistol while facing the camera. Try as he might, he was unable to keep his eyes open each time he pulled the trigger. The problem was eventually solved by having Robinson's eyes held open with cellophane tape.

4109.name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
4109.storyline: Mandy Patinkin was originally cast as Quasimodo in the Disney version of The Hunchback of Notre Dame (1996), but dropped out due to clashes with the producer regarding the character. He was cast as Quasimodo in this film, and Tom Hulce was cast to voice Quasimodo in Patinkin's place, in the Disney version.

4110.name: Gayby
4110.storyline: Matt: I'm a guy. I can put it in anything.

4111.name: Dhadak
4111.storyline: Remake of blockbuster Marathi film Sairat 2016.

4112.name: Infamous
4112.storyline: Infamous was originally called "Southland" as evidenced by the end credits not being changed before releasing the movie VOD

4113.name: Schoolgirl's Report '75
4113.storyline: Featured in Von Sex bis Simmel (2005)

4114.name: Barry Munday
4114.storyline: Jean Smart (Carol Munday) & Patrick Wilson (Barry Munday) also worked together on nine episodes of Fargo (2014) as Floyd Gerhardt & Lou Solverson respectively.

4115.name: The Josephine Baker Story
4115.storyline: Filmed in over one hundred different locations, with eighty speaking parts, and six thousand extras, this movie was given the biggest budget of any HBO production (up until that time), as well the network's most extensive promotional campaign.

4116.name: Earthquake Bird
4116.storyline: Oscar-winning actress Alicia Vikander, known for her performances in Ex Machina and The Danish Girl, stars in the Netflix mystery drama Earthquake Bird. Who else has she played?

4117.name: Support Your Local Gunfighter
4117.storyline: The train in the opening credits and closing scene is Colorado's Durango & Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad, which was then the Denver and Rio Grande Western. In 1971 the DRGW was still owner and operator of the line, and this track was still part of a class 1 railroad and not a tourist / heritage railroad. Even though DRGW was looking at the time for a buyer or just the permission to the interstate transportation board for abandonment of the rail grade. They would find neither until the mid 1980s. The scene was reused a year later in the italian western comedy Man of the East (1972).

4118.name: The Happiest Millionaire
4118.storyline: Richard M. Sherman had reservations about whether Fred MacMurray was right for the part of Anthony J. Drexel Biddle, but Walt Disney overruled him.

4119.name: Scaramouche
4119.storyline: Stewart Granger wore lifts in the film so he would appear to be the same height as his slightly taller co-stars Mel Ferrer, Henry Wilcoxon and Richard Anderson. Granger's height was often listed as 6'3" but it is widely believed he was actually 6'1".

4120.name: The Last Time I Saw Paris
4120.storyline: Because of an error with the Roman numerals in the copyright notice on the prints, this movie was legally copyrighted in 1944, not 1954. The copyright was not renewed by MGM as it expired ten years earlier than the copyright office records indicated (in eighteen years versus twenty-eight years). At this time it was the copyright notice and date on the film prints that counted legally, so this movie entered the public domain in 1972.

4121.name: Dark Victory
4121.storyline: Bette Davis said that this was her favorite role.

4122.name: Little Voice
4122.storyline: Jane Horrocks sang all her own songs.

4123.name: How to Win a Prince
4123.storyline: Another mediocre Reel One Entertainment TV movie about fictional European royalty. Technically is mostly fine. The only semi-serious issue is that movie was obviously shot in Hamilton pretending to be Manhattan. However, the usage of the stock NYC footage was minimal compared to the excessive use in the past few years in the many ROE TV movies.Cast is passable. I never watched Anna Hopkins before. She was convincing. Ryan Bruce not so much. I liked Dianne Aguilar, and Ed Pinker as he's a real Brit.What ruined this TV movie for me is writing. In the first half, I seriously tought this is some kind of parody about European royalty. After all, prince has Freddie name (what?!), and basically nothing can be taken seriously. Still passable, but around the half, movie started to take itself seriously. The only good thing is that Anna Hopkins killed as Nina for the all wrong reasons which is obviously not her fault. Act III is a one giant insult.Just watch trailer to save your valuable free time as this is ROE, and for some reasons it reveals the whole movie.

4124.name: The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean
4124.storyline: This was one of Paul Newman's favorite roles.

4127.name: Hitched for the Holidays
4127.storyline: Joey Lawrence starred in a similar role in My Fake Fiancé (2009) where he pretended to be the Melissa Joan Hart fiancee and ended to fall in love with her.

4128.name: A Man and a Woman
4128.storyline: Director Lee Yoon-Ki and actress Jeon Do-Yeon previously worked together in 2008 film "My Dear Enemy."

4129.name: As It Is in Heaven
4129.storyline: In spite of being the most beloved Swedish film for several years it did not receive a single Golden Beetle, the most prestigious Swedish film award.

4130.name: Baking All the Way
4130.storyline: Movie is translated in Croatia as "12 bozicnih poslastica" which is a literal translation from "12 Treats of Christmas". That was the name of marketing campaign by Julia and Kris. They put posters in the town on which was written "Home Stead Presents The 12 Treats of Christmas".

4132.name: Heaven Help Us
4132.storyline: Film debut of actors Kevin Dillon, Patrick Dempsey, Stephen Geoffreys, Yeardley Smith, and Maggie Wagner

4133.name: Some Came Running
4133.storyline: Shirley MacLaine thought that Dean Martin turned in his best ever performance, because "he was a lot like Bama, a loner with his own code of ethics who would never compromise, so maybe it wasn't really a performance."

4134.name: The Tomorrow Man
4134.storyline: John Lithgow was born in Rochester, NY, where most of the movie was filmed.

4135.name: A Very Merry Toy Store
4135.storyline: Beth Broderick, who plays Pam Forrester (the mom in this movie), played Zelda Spellman (one of the Aunts) in the series Sabrina the Teenage Witch (1996) starring Melissa Joan Hart.

4136.name: Mascarpone: The Rainbow Cake
4136.storyline: Sono come tu mi vuoiPerformed by Andrea Fuorto

4137.name: Hard to Get
